  73def filepaths_to_database(img_paths, settings, source_folder, crop_mode):
  74
  75    png_df = pd.DataFrame(img_paths, columns=['png_path'])
  76
  77    png_df['file_name'] = png_df['png_path'].apply(lambda x: os.path.basename(x))
  78
  79    parts = png_df['file_name'].apply(lambda x: pd.Series(_map_wells_png(x, timelapse=settings['timelapse'])))
  80
  81    columns = ['plateID', 'rowID', 'columnID', 'fieldID']
  82
  83    if settings['timelapse']:
  84        columns = columns + ['time_id']
  85
  86    columns = columns + ['prcfo']
  87
  88    if crop_mode == 'cell':
  89        columns = columns + ['cell_id']
  90
  91    if crop_mode == 'nucleus':
  92        columns = columns + ['nucleus_id']
  93
  94    if crop_mode == 'pathogen':
  95        columns = columns + ['pathogen_id']
  96
  97    if crop_mode == 'cytoplasm':
  98        columns = columns + ['cytoplasm_id']
  99
 100    png_df[columns] = parts
 101
 102    try:
 103        conn = sqlite3.connect(f'{source_folder}/measurements/measurements.db', timeout=5)
 104        png_df.to_sql('png_list', conn, if_exists='append', index=False)
 105        conn.commit()
 106    except sqlite3.OperationalError as e:
 107        print(f"SQLite error: {e}", flush=True)
 108        traceback.print_exc()
 109
 110def activation_maps_to_database(img_paths, source_folder, settings):
 111    from .io import _create_database
 112
 113    png_df = pd.DataFrame(img_paths, columns=['png_path'])
 114    png_df['file_name'] = png_df['png_path'].apply(lambda x: os.path.basename(x))
 115    parts = png_df['file_name'].apply(lambda x: pd.Series(_map_wells_png(x, timelapse=False)))
 116    columns = ['plateID', 'rowID', 'columnID', 'fieldID', 'prcfo', 'object']
 117    png_df[columns] = parts
 118
 119    dataset_name = os.path.splitext(os.path.basename(settings['dataset']))[0]
 120    database_name = f"{source_folder}/measurements/{dataset_name}.db"
 121
 122    if not os.path.exists(database_name):
 123        _create_database(database_name)
 124
 125    try:
 126        conn = sqlite3.connect(database_name, timeout=5)
 127        png_df.to_sql(f"{settings['cam_type']}_list", conn, if_exists='append', index=False)
 128        conn.commit()
 129    except sqlite3.OperationalError as e:
 130        print(f"SQLite error: {e}", flush=True)
 131        traceback.print_exc()
 132
 133def activation_correlations_to_database(df, img_paths, source_folder, settings):
 134    from .io import _create_database
 135
 136    png_df = pd.DataFrame(img_paths, columns=['png_path'])
 137    png_df['file_name'] = png_df['png_path'].apply(lambda x: os.path.basename(x))
 138    parts = png_df['file_name'].apply(lambda x: pd.Series(_map_wells_png(x, timelapse=False)))
 139    columns = ['plateID', 'rowID', 'columnID', 'fieldID', 'prcfo', 'object']
 140    png_df[columns] = parts
 141
 142    # Align both DataFrames by file_name
 143    png_df.set_index('file_name', inplace=True)
 144    df.set_index('file_name', inplace=True)
 145
 146    merged_df = pd.concat([png_df, df], axis=1)
 147    merged_df.reset_index(inplace=True)
 148
 149    dataset_name = os.path.splitext(os.path.basename(settings['dataset']))[0]
 150    database_name = f"{source_folder}/measurements/{dataset_name}.db"
 151
 152    if not os.path.exists(database_name):
 153        _create_database(database_name)
 154
 155    try:
 156        conn = sqlite3.connect(database_name, timeout=5)
 157        merged_df.to_sql(f"{settings['cam_type']}_correlations", conn, if_exists='append', index=False)
 158        conn.commit()
 159    except sqlite3.OperationalError as e:
 160        print(f"SQLite error: {e}", flush=True)
 161        traceback.print_exc()
 162
 163def calculate_activation_correlations(inputs, activation_maps, file_names, manders_thresholds=[15, 50, 75]):
 164    """
 165    Calculates Pearson and Manders correlations between input image channels and activation map channels.
 166    
 167    Args:
 168        inputs: A batch of input images, Tensor of shape (batch_size, channels, height, width)
 169        activation_maps: A batch of activation maps, Tensor of shape (batch_size, channels, height, width)
 170        file_names: List of file names corresponding to each image in the batch.
 171        manders_thresholds: List of intensity percentiles to calculate Manders correlation.
 172        
 173    Returns:
 174        df_correlations: A DataFrame with columns for pairwise correlations (Pearson and Manders) 
 175                         between input channels and activation map channels.
 176    """
 177    
 178    # Ensure tensors are detached and moved to CPU before converting to numpy
 179    inputs = inputs.detach().cpu()
 180    activation_maps = activation_maps.detach().cpu()
 181
 182    batch_size, in_channels, height, width = inputs.shape
 183    
 184    if activation_maps.dim() == 3:
 185        # If activation maps have no channels, add a dummy channel dimension
 186        activation_maps = activation_maps.unsqueeze(1)  # Now shape is (batch_size, 1, height, width)
 187    
 188    _, act_channels, act_height, act_width = activation_maps.shape
 189
 190    # Ensure that the inputs and activation maps are the same size
 191    if (height != act_height) or (width != act_width):
 192        activation_maps = torch.nn.functional.interpolate(activation_maps, size=(height, width), mode='bilinear')
 193
 194    # Dictionary to collect correlation results
 195    correlations_dict = {'file_name': []}
 196
 197    # Initialize correlation columns based on input channels and activation map channels
 198    for in_c in range(in_channels):
 199        for act_c in range(act_channels):
 200            correlations_dict[f'channel_{in_c}_activation_{act_c}_pearsons'] = []
 201            for threshold in manders_thresholds:
 202                correlations_dict[f'channel_{in_c}_activation_{act_c}_{threshold}_M1'] = []
 203                correlations_dict[f'channel_{in_c}_activation_{act_c}_{threshold}_M2'] = []
 204
 205    # Loop over the batch
 206    for b in range(batch_size):
 207        input_img = inputs[b]  # Input image channels (C, H, W)
 208        activation_map = activation_maps[b]  # Activation map channels (C, H, W)
 209
 210        # Add the file name to the current row
 211        correlations_dict['file_name'].append(file_names[b])
 212
 213        # Calculate correlations for each channel pair
 214        for in_c in range(in_channels):
 215            input_channel = input_img[in_c].flatten().numpy()  # Flatten the input image channel
 216            input_channel = input_channel[np.isfinite(input_channel)]  # Remove NaN or inf values
 217
 218            for act_c in range(act_channels):
 219                activation_channel = activation_map[act_c].flatten().numpy()  # Flatten the activation map channel
 220                activation_channel = activation_channel[np.isfinite(activation_channel)]  # Remove NaN or inf values
 221
 222                # Check if there are valid (non-empty) arrays left to calculate the Pearson correlation
 223                if input_channel.size > 0 and activation_channel.size > 0:
 224                    pearson_corr, _ = pearsonr(input_channel, activation_channel)
 225                else:
 226                    pearson_corr = np.nan  # Assign NaN if there are no valid data points
 227                correlations_dict[f'channel_{in_c}_activation_{act_c}_pearsons'].append(pearson_corr)
 228
 229                # Compute Manders correlations for each threshold
 230                for threshold in manders_thresholds:
 231                    # Get the top percentile pixels based on intensity in both channels
 232                    if input_channel.size > 0 and activation_channel.size > 0:
 233                        input_threshold = np.percentile(input_channel, threshold)
 234                        activation_threshold = np.percentile(activation_channel, threshold)
 235
 236                        # Mask the pixels above the threshold
 237                        mask = (input_channel >= input_threshold) & (activation_channel >= activation_threshold)
 238
 239                        # If we have enough pixels, calculate Manders correlation
 240                        if np.sum(mask) > 0:
 241                            manders_corr_M1 = np.sum(input_channel[mask] * activation_channel[mask]) / np.sum(input_channel[mask] ** 2)
 242                            manders_corr_M2 = np.sum(activation_channel[mask] * input_channel[mask]) / np.sum(activation_channel[mask] ** 2)
 243                        else:
 244                            manders_corr_M1 = np.nan
 245                            manders_corr_M2 = np.nan
 246                    else:
 247                        manders_corr_M1 = np.nan
 248                        manders_corr_M2 = np.nan
 249
 250                    # Store the Manders correlation for this threshold
 251                    correlations_dict[f'channel_{in_c}_activation_{act_c}_{threshold}_M1'].append(manders_corr_M1)
 252                    correlations_dict[f'channel_{in_c}_activation_{act_c}_{threshold}_M2'].append(manders_corr_M2)
 253
 254    # Convert the dictionary to a DataFrame
 255    df_correlations = pd.DataFrame(correlations_dict)
 256
 257    return df_correlations
 258
 259def load_settings(csv_file_path, show=False, setting_key='setting_key', setting_value='setting_value'):
 260    """
 261    Convert a CSV file with 'settings_key' and 'settings_value' columns into a dictionary.
 262    Handles special cases where values are lists, tuples, booleans, None, integers, floats, and nested dictionaries.
 263
 264    Args:
 265        csv_file_path (str): The path to the CSV file.
 266        show (bool): Whether to display the dataframe (for debugging).
 267        setting_key (str): The name of the column that contains the setting keys.
 268        setting_value (str): The name of the column that contains the setting values.
 269
 270    Returns:
 271        dict: A dictionary where 'settings_key' are the keys and 'settings_value' are the values.
 272    """
 273    # Read the CSV file into a DataFrame
 274    df = pd.read_csv(csv_file_path)
 275
 276    if show:
 277        display(df)
 278
 279    # Ensure the columns 'setting_key' and 'setting_value' exist
 280    if setting_key not in df.columns or setting_value not in df.columns:
 281        raise ValueError(f"CSV file must contain {setting_key} and {setting_value} columns.")
 282
 283    def parse_value(value):
 284        """Parse the string value into the appropriate Python data type."""
 285        # Handle empty values
 286        if pd.isna(value) or value == '':
 287            return None
 288
 289        # Handle boolean values
 290        if value == 'True':
 291            return True
 292        if value == 'False':
 293            return False
 294
 295        # Handle lists, tuples, dictionaries, and other literals
 296        if value.startswith(('(', '[', '{')):  # If it starts with (, [ or {, use ast.literal_eval
 297            try:
 298                parsed_value = ast.literal_eval(value)
 299                # If parsed_value is a dict, recursively parse its values
 300                if isinstance(parsed_value, dict):
 301                    parsed_value = {k: parse_value(v) for k, v in parsed_value.items()}
 302                return parsed_value
 303            except (ValueError, SyntaxError):
 304                pass  # If there's an error, return the value as-is
 305        
 306        # Handle numeric values (integers and floats)
 307        try:
 308            if '.' in value:
 309                return float(value)  # If it contains a dot, convert to float
 310            return int(value)  # Otherwise, convert to integer
 311        except ValueError:
 312            pass  # If it's not a valid number, return the value as-is
 313
 314        # Return the original value if no other type matched
 315        return value
 316
 317    # Convert the DataFrame to a dictionary, with parsing of each value
 318    result_dict = {key: parse_value(value) for key, value in zip(df[setting_key], df[setting_value])}
 319
 320    return result_dict
 321
 322def save_settings(settings, name='settings', show=False):
 323    
 324    settings_2 = settings.copy()
 325    
 326    if isinstance(settings_2['src'], list):
 327        src = settings_2['src'][0]
 328        name = f"{name}_list"
 329    else:
 330        src = settings_2['src']
 331        
 332    if 'test_mode' in settings_2.keys():
 333        settings_2['test_mode'] = False
 334        
 335        if 'plot' in settings_2.keys():
 336            settings_2['plot'] = False
 337            
 338    settings_df = pd.DataFrame(list(settings_2.items()), columns=['Key', 'Value'])
 339    
 340    if show:
 341        display(settings_df)
 342
 343    settings_csv = os.path.join(src,'settings',f'{name}.csv')
 344    os.makedirs(os.path.join(src,'settings'), exist_ok=True)
 345    print(f"Saving settings to {settings_csv}")
 346    settings_df.to_csv(settings_csv, index=False)
 347
 348def print_progress(files_processed, files_to_process, n_jobs, time_ls=None, batch_size=None, operation_type=""):
 349    if isinstance(files_processed, list):
 350        files_processed = len(set(files_processed))
 351    if isinstance(files_to_process, list):
 352        files_to_process = len(set(files_to_process))
 353    if isinstance(batch_size, list):
 354        batch_size = len(batch_size)
 355
 356    if not isinstance(files_processed, int):
 357        try:
 358            files_processed = int(files_processed)
 359        except:
 360            files_processed = 0
 361    if not isinstance(files_to_process, int):
 362        try:
 363            files_to_process = int(files_to_process)
 364        except:
 365            files_to_process = 0
 366
 367    time_info = ""
 368    if time_ls is not None:
 369        average_time = np.mean(time_ls) if len(time_ls) > 0 else 0
 370        time_left = (((files_to_process - files_processed) * average_time) / n_jobs) / 60
 371        if batch_size is None:
 372            time_info = f'Time/image: {average_time:.3f}sec, Time_left: {time_left:.3f} min.'
 373        else:
 374            average_time_img = average_time / batch_size
 375            time_info = f'Time/batch: {average_time:.3f}sec, Time/image: {average_time_img:.3f}sec, Time_left: {time_left:.3f} min.'
 376    else:
 377        time_info = None
 378    print(f'Progress: {files_processed}/{files_to_process}, operation_type: {operation_type}, {time_info}')
 379
 380def reset_mp():
 381    current_method = get_start_method()
 382    system = platform.system()
 383    
 384    if system == 'Windows':
 385        if current_method != 'spawn':
 386            set_start_method('spawn', force=True)
 387    elif system in ('Linux', 'Darwin'):  # Darwin is macOS
 388        if current_method != 'fork':
 389            set_start_method('fork', force=True)
 390
 391def is_multiprocessing_process(process):
 392    """ Check if the process is a multiprocessing process. """
 393    try:
 394        for cmd in process.cmdline():
 395            if 'multiprocessing' in cmd:
 396                return True
 397    except (psutil.NoSuchProcess, psutil.AccessDenied, psutil.ZombieProcess):
 398        pass
 399    return False
 400
 401def close_file_descriptors():
 402    """ Close file descriptors and shared memory objects. """
 403    import resource
 404
 405    soft, hard = resource.getrlimit(resource.RLIMIT_NOFILE)
 406    for fd in range(3, soft):
 407        try:
 408            os.close(fd)
 409        except OSError:
 410            pass
 411
 412def close_multiprocessing_processes():
 413    """ Close all multiprocessing processes. """
 414    current_pid = os.getpid()
 415    for proc in psutil.process_iter(['pid', 'cmdline']):
 416        try:
 417            # Skip the current process
 418            if proc.info['pid'] == current_pid:
 419                continue
 420            
 421            # Check if the process is a multiprocessing process
 422            if is_multiprocessing_process(proc):
 423                proc.terminate()
 424                proc.wait(timeout=5)  # Wait up to 5 seconds for the process to terminate
 425                print(f"Terminated process {proc.info['pid']}")
 426        
 427        except (psutil.NoSuchProcess, psutil.AccessDenied, psutil.ZombieProcess) as e:
 428            print(f"Failed to terminate process {proc.info['pid']}: {e}")
 429
 430    # Close file descriptors
 431    close_file_descriptors()
 432
 433def check_mask_folder(src,mask_fldr):
 434    
 435    mask_folder = os.path.join(src,'norm_channel_stack',mask_fldr)
 436    stack_folder = os.path.join(src,'stack')
 437
 438    if not os.path.exists(mask_folder):
 439        return True
 440    
 441    mask_count = sum(1 for file in os.listdir(mask_folder) if file.endswith('.npy'))
 442    stack_count = sum(1 for file in os.listdir(stack_folder) if file.endswith('.npy'))
 443    
 444    if mask_count == stack_count:
 445        print(f'All masks have been generated for {mask_fldr}')
 446        return False
 447    else:
 448        return True
 449
 450def smooth_hull_lines(cluster_data):
 451    hull = ConvexHull(cluster_data)
 452    # Extract vertices of the hull
 453    vertices = hull.points[hull.vertices]
 454    # Close the loop
 455    vertices = np.vstack([vertices, vertices[0, :]])
 456    # Parameterize the vertices
 457    tck, u = splprep(vertices.T, u=None, s=0.0)
 458    # Evaluate spline at new parameter values
 459    new_points = splev(np.linspace(0, 1, 100), tck)
 460    return new_points[0], new_points[1]
 461
 462def _gen_rgb_image(image, channels):
 463    """
 464    Generate an RGB image from the specified channels of the input image.
 465
 466    Args:
 467        image (ndarray): The input image.
 468        channels (list): List of channel indices to use for RGB.
 469
 470    Returns:
 471        rgb_image (ndarray): The generated RGB image.
 472    """
 473    rgb_image = np.zeros((image.shape[0], image.shape[1], 3), dtype=np.float32)
 474    for i, chan in enumerate(channels):
 475        if chan < image.shape[2]:
 476            rgb_image[:, :, i] = image[:, :, chan]
 477    return rgb_image
 478
 479def _outline_and_overlay(image, rgb_image, mask_dims, outline_colors, outline_thickness):
 480    outlines = []
 481    overlayed_image = rgb_image.copy()
 482
 483    def process_dim(mask_dim):
 484        mask = np.take(image, mask_dim, axis=-1)
 485        outline = np.zeros_like(mask, dtype=np.uint8)  # Use uint8 for contour detection efficiency
 486
 487        # Find and draw contours
 488        for j in np.unique(mask):
 489            if j == 0:
 490                continue  # Skip background
 491            contours = find_contours(mask == j, 0.5)
 492            # Convert contours for OpenCV format and draw directly to optimize
 493            cv_contours = [np.flip(contour.astype(int), axis=1) for contour in contours]
 494            cv2.drawContours(outline, cv_contours, -1, color=255, thickness=outline_thickness) 
 495
 496        return dilation(outline, square(outline_thickness))
 497
 498    # Parallel processing
 499    with ThreadPoolExecutor() as executor:
 500        outlines = list(executor.map(process_dim, mask_dims))
 501
 502    # Overlay outlines onto the RGB image
 503    for i, outline in enumerate(outlines):
 504        color = np.array(outline_colors[i % len(outline_colors)])
 505        for j in np.unique(outline):
 506            if j == 0:
 507                continue  # Skip background
 508            mask = outline == j
 509            overlayed_image[mask] = color  # Direct assignment with broadcasting
 510
 511    return overlayed_image, outlines, image
 512
 513def _convert_cq1_well_id(well_id):
 514    """
 515    Converts a well ID to the CQ1 well format.
 516
 517    Args:
 518        well_id (int): The well ID to be converted.
 519
 520    Returns:
 521        str: The well ID in CQ1 well format.
 522
 523    """
 524    well_id = int(well_id)
 525    # ASCII code for 'A'
 526    ascii_A = ord('A')
 527    # Calculate row and column
 528    row, col = divmod(well_id - 1, 24)
 529    # Convert row to letter (A-P) and adjust col to start from 1
 530    row_letter = chr(ascii_A + row)
 531    # Format column as two digits
 532    well_format = f"{row_letter}{col + 1:02d}" 
 533    return well_format
 534
 535def _get_cellpose_batch_size():
 536    try:
 537        # Check if CUDA is available
 538        if torch.cuda.is_available():
 539            device_properties = torch.cuda.get_device_properties(0)
 540            vram_gb = device_properties.total_memory / (1024**3)  # Convert bytes to gigabytes
 541        else:
 542            print("CUDA is not available. Please check your installation and GPU.")
 543            return 8
 544        if vram_gb < 8:
 545            batch_size = 8
 546        elif vram_gb > 8 and vram_gb < 12:
 547            batch_size = 16
 548        elif vram_gb > 12 and vram_gb < 24:
 549            batch_size = 48
 550        elif vram_gb > 24:
 551            batch_size = 96
 552        print(f"Device {0}: {device_properties.name}, VRAM: {vram_gb:.2f} GB, cellpose batch size: {batch_size}")
 553        return batch_size
 554    except Exception as e:
 555        return 8
 556
 557def _extract_filename_metadata(filenames, src, regular_expression, metadata_type='cellvoyager', pick_slice=False, skip_mode='01'):
 558    
 559    images_by_key = defaultdict(list)
 560
 561    for filename in filenames:
 562        match = regular_expression.match(filename)
 563        if match:
 564            try:
 565                try:
 566                    plate = match.group('plateID')
 567                except:
 568                    plate = os.path.basename(src)
 569
 570                well = match.group('wellID')
 571                field = match.group('fieldID')
 572                channel = match.group('chanID')
 573                mode = None
 574
 575                if well[0].isdigit():
 576                    well = str(_safe_int_convert(well))
 577                if field[0].isdigit():
 578                    field = str(_safe_int_convert(field))
 579                if channel[0].isdigit():
 580                    channel = str(_safe_int_convert(channel))
 581
 582                if metadata_type =='cq1':
 583                    orig_wellID = wellID
 584                    wellID = _convert_cq1_well_id(wellID)
 585                    print(f'Converted Well ID: {orig_wellID} to {wellID}', end='\r', flush=True)
 586
 587                if pick_slice:
 588                    try:
 589                        mode = match.group('AID')
 590                    except IndexError:
 591                        sliceid = '00'
 592
 593                    if mode == skip_mode:
 594                        continue
 595                        
 596                key = (plate, well, field, channel, mode)
 597                file_path = os.path.join(src, filename)  # Store the full path
 598                images_by_key[key].append(file_path)
 599                
 600            except IndexError:
 601                print(f"Could not extract information from filename {filename} using provided regex")
 602        else:
 603            print(f"Filename {filename} did not match provided regex: {regular_expression}")
 604            continue
 605        
 606    return images_by_key
 607
 608def mask_object_count(mask):
 609    """
 610    Counts the number of objects in a given mask.
 611
 612    Parameters:
 613    - mask: numpy.ndarray. The mask containing object labels.
 614
 615    Returns:
 616    - int. The number of objects in the mask.
 617    """
 618    unique_labels = np.unique(mask)
 619    num_objects = len(unique_labels[unique_labels!=0])
 620    return num_objects
 621
 622def _update_database_with_merged_info(db_path, df, table='png_list', columns=['pathogen', 'treatment', 'host_cells', 'condition', 'prcfo']):
 623    """
 624    Merges additional columns into the png_list table in the SQLite database and updates it.
 625
 626    Args:
 627        db_path (str): The path to the SQLite database file.
 628        df (pd.DataFrame): DataFrame containing the additional info to be merged.
 629        table (str): Name of the table to update in the database. Defaults to 'png_list'.
 630    """
 631    # Connect to the SQLite database
 632    conn = sqlite3.connect(db_path)
 633
 634    # Read the existing table into a DataFrame
 635    try:
 636        existing_df = pd.read_sql(f"SELECT * FROM {table}", conn)
 637    except Exception as e:
 638        print(f"Failed to read table {table} from database: {e}")
 639        conn.close()
 640        return
 641    
 642    if 'prcfo' not in df.columns:
 643        print(f'generating prcfo columns')
 644        try:
 645            df['prcfo'] = df['plateID'].astype(str) + '_' + df['rowID'].astype(str) + '_' + df['columnID'].astype(str) + '_' + df['fieldID'].astype(str) + '_o' + df['object_label'].astype(int).astype(str)
 646        except Exception as e:
 647            print('Merging on cell failed, trying with cell_id')
 648        try:
 649            df['prcfo'] = df['plateID'].astype(str) + '_' + df['rowID'].astype(str) + '_' + df['columnID'].astype(str) + '_' + df['fieldID'].astype(str) + '_o' + df['cell_id'].astype(int).astype(str)
 650        except Exception as e:
 651            print(e)
 652        
 653    # Merge the existing DataFrame with the new info based on the 'prcfo' column
 654    merged_df = pd.merge(existing_df, df[columns], on='prcfo', how='left')
 655    
 656    # Drop the existing table and replace it with the updated DataFrame
 657    try:
 658        conn.execute(f"DROP TABLE IF EXISTS {table}")
 659        merged_df.to_sql(table, conn, index=False)
 660        print(f"Table {table} successfully updated in the database.")
 661    except Exception as e:
 662        print(f"Failed to update table {table} in the database: {e}")
 663    finally:
 664        conn.close()
 665
 666def _generate_representative_images(db_path, cells=['HeLa'], cell_loc=None, pathogens=['rh'], pathogen_loc=None, treatments=['cm'], treatment_loc=None, channel_of_interest=1, compartments = ['pathogen','cytoplasm'], measurement = 'mean_intensity', nr_imgs=16, channel_indices=[0,1,2], um_per_pixel=0.1, scale_bar_length_um=10, plot=False, fontsize=12, show_filename=True, channel_names=None, update_db=True):
 667    
 668    """
 669    Generates representative images based on the provided parameters.
 670
 671    Args:
 672        db_path (str): The path to the SQLite database file.
 673        cells (list, optional): The list of host cell types. Defaults to ['HeLa'].
 674        cell_loc (list, optional): The list of location identifiers for host cells. Defaults to None.
 675        pathogens (list, optional): The list of pathogens. Defaults to ['rh'].
 676        pathogen_loc (list, optional): The list of location identifiers for pathogens. Defaults to None.
 677        treatments (list, optional): The list of treatments. Defaults to ['cm'].
 678        treatment_loc (list, optional): The list of location identifiers for treatments. Defaults to None.
 679        channel_of_interest (int, optional): The index of the channel of interest. Defaults to 1.
 680        compartments (list or str, optional): The compartments to compare. Defaults to ['pathogen', 'cytoplasm'].
 681        measurement (str, optional): The measurement to compare. Defaults to 'mean_intensity'.
 682        nr_imgs (int, optional): The number of representative images to generate. Defaults to 16.
 683        channel_indices (list, optional): The indices of the channels to include in the representative images. Defaults to [0, 1, 2].
 684        um_per_pixel (float, optional): The scale factor for converting pixels to micrometers. Defaults to 0.1.
 685        scale_bar_length_um (float, optional): The length of the scale bar in micrometers. Defaults to 10.
 686        plot (bool, optional): Whether to plot the representative images. Defaults to False.
 687        fontsize (int, optional): The font size for the plot. Defaults to 12.
 688        show_filename (bool, optional): Whether to show the filename on the plot. Defaults to True.
 689        channel_names (list, optional): The names of the channels. Defaults to None.
 690
 691    Returns:
 692        None
 693    """
 694    
 695    from .io import _read_and_join_tables, _save_figure
 696    from .plot import _plot_images_on_grid
 697    
 698    df = _read_and_join_tables(db_path)
 699    df = annotate_conditions(df, cells, cell_loc, pathogens, pathogen_loc, treatments, treatment_loc)
 700    
 701    if update_db:
 702        _update_database_with_merged_info(db_path, df, table='png_list', columns=['pathogen', 'treatment', 'host_cells', 'condition', 'prcfo'])
 703    
 704    if isinstance(compartments, list):
 705        if len(compartments) > 1:
 706            df['new_measurement'] = df[f'{compartments[0]}_channel_{channel_of_interest}_{measurement}']/df[f'{compartments[1]}_channel_{channel_of_interest}_{measurement}']
 707    else:
 708        df['new_measurement'] = df['cell_area']
 709    dfs = {condition: df_group for condition, df_group in df.groupby('condition')}
 710    conditions = df['condition'].dropna().unique().tolist()
 711    for condition in conditions:
 712        df = dfs[condition]
 713        df = _filter_closest_to_stat(df, column='new_measurement', n_rows=nr_imgs, use_median=False)
 714        png_paths_by_condition = df['png_path'].tolist()
 715        fig = _plot_images_on_grid(png_paths_by_condition, channel_indices, um_per_pixel, scale_bar_length_um, fontsize, show_filename, channel_names, plot)
 716        src = os.path.dirname(db_path)
 717        os.makedirs(src, exist_ok=True)
 718        _save_figure(fig=fig, src=src, text=condition)
 719        for channel in channel_indices:
 720            channel_indices=[channel]
 721            fig = _plot_images_on_grid(png_paths_by_condition, channel_indices, um_per_pixel, scale_bar_length_um, fontsize, show_filename, channel_names, plot)
 722            _save_figure(fig, src, text=f'channel_{channel}_{condition}')
 723            plt.close()
 724            
 725# Adjusted mapping function to infer type from location identifiers
 726def _map_values(row, values, locs):
 727    """
 728    Maps values to a specific location in the row or column based on the given locs.
 729
 730    Args:
 731        row (dict): The row dictionary containing the location identifier.
 732        values (list): The list of values to be mapped.
 733        locs (list): The list of location identifiers.
 734
 735    Returns:
 736        The mapped value corresponding to the given row or column location, or None if not found.
 737    """
 738    if locs:
 739        value_dict = {loc: value for value, loc_list in zip(values, locs) for loc in loc_list}
 740        # Determine if we're dealing with row or column based on first location identifier
 741        type_ = 'rowID' if locs[0][0][0] == 'r' else 'columnID'
 742        return value_dict.get(row[type_], None)
 743    return values[0] if values else None
 744
 745def is_list_of_lists(var):
 746    if isinstance(var, list) and all(isinstance(i, list) for i in var):
 747        return True
 748    return False
 749
 750def normalize_to_dtype(array, p1=2, p2=98, percentile_list=None, new_dtype=None):
 751    """
 752    Normalize each image in the stack to its own percentiles.
 753
 754    Parameters:
 755    - array: numpy array
 756    The input stack to be normalized.
 757    - p1: int, optional
 758    The lower percentile value for normalization. Default is 2.
 759    - p2: int, optional
 760    The upper percentile value for normalization. Default is 98.
 761    - percentile_list: list, optional
 762    A list of pre-calculated percentiles for each image in the stack. Default is None.
 763    
 764    Returns:
 765    - new_stack: numpy array
 766    The normalized stack with the same shape as the input stack.
 767    """
 768
 769    if new_dtype is None:
 770        out_range = (0, np.iinfo(array.dtype).max)
 771    elif new_dtype in [np.uint8, np.uint16]:
 772        out_range = (0, np.iinfo(new_dtype).max)
 773    elif new_dtype in ['uint8', 'uint16']:
 774        new_dtype = np.uint8 if new_dtype == 'uint8' else np.uint16
 775        out_range = (0, np.iinfo(new_dtype).max)
 776    else:
 777        out_range = (0, np.iinfo(array.dtype).max)
 778
 779    nimg = array.shape[2]
 780    new_stack = np.empty_like(array, dtype=array.dtype)
 781
 782    for i in range(nimg):
 783        img = array[:, :, i]
 784        non_zero_img = img[img > 0]
 785        if not percentile_list is None:
 786            percentiles = percentile_list[i]
 787        else:
 788            percentile_1 = p1
 789            percentile_2 = p2
 790        if percentile_list is None:
 791            if non_zero_img.size > 0:
 792                img_min = np.percentile(non_zero_img, percentile_1)
 793                img_max = np.percentile(non_zero_img, percentile_2)
 794            else:
 795                img_min = np.percentile(img, percentile_1)
 796                img_max = np.percentile(img, percentile_2)
 797        else:
 798            img_min = percentiles[0]
 799            img_max = percentiles[1]
 800
 801        # Normalize to the range (0, 1) for visualization
 802        img = rescale_intensity(img, in_range=(img_min, img_max), out_range=out_range)
 803        new_stack[:, :, i] = img
 804    return new_stack
 805    
 806def _list_endpoint_subdirectories(base_dir):
 807    """
 808    Returns a list of subdirectories within the given base directory.
 809
 810    Args:
 811        base_dir (str): The base directory to search for subdirectories.
 812
 813    Returns:
 814        list: A list of subdirectories within the base directory.
 815    """
 816    
 817    endpoint_subdirectories = []
 818    for root, dirs, _ in os.walk(base_dir):
 819        if not dirs:
 820            endpoint_subdirectories.append(root)
 821            
 822    endpoint_subdirectories = [path for path in endpoint_subdirectories if os.path.basename(path) != 'figure']
 823    return endpoint_subdirectories
 824    
 825def _generate_names(file_name, cell_id, cell_nucleus_ids, cell_pathogen_ids, source_folder, crop_mode='cell'):
 826    """
 827    Generate names for the image, folder, and table based on the given parameters.
 828
 829    Args:
 830        file_name (str): The name of the file.
 831        cell_id (numpy.ndarray): An array of cell IDs.
 832        cell_nucleus_ids (numpy.ndarray): An array of cell nucleus IDs.
 833        cell_pathogen_ids (numpy.ndarray): An array of cell pathogen IDs.
 834        source_folder (str): The source folder path.
 835        crop_mode (str, optional): The crop mode. Defaults to 'cell'.
 836
 837    Returns:
 838        tuple: A tuple containing the image name, folder path, and table name.
 839    """
 840    non_zero_cell_ids = cell_id[cell_id != 0]
 841    cell_id_str = "multi" if non_zero_cell_ids.size > 1 else str(non_zero_cell_ids[0]) if non_zero_cell_ids.size == 1 else "none"
 842    cell_nucleus_ids = cell_nucleus_ids[cell_nucleus_ids != 0]
 843    cell_nucleus_id_str = "multi" if cell_nucleus_ids.size > 1 else str(cell_nucleus_ids[0]) if cell_nucleus_ids.size == 1 else "none"
 844    cell_pathogen_ids = cell_pathogen_ids[cell_pathogen_ids != 0]
 845    cell_pathogen_id_str = "multi" if cell_pathogen_ids.size > 1 else str(cell_pathogen_ids[0]) if cell_pathogen_ids.size == 1 else "none"
 846    fldr = f"{source_folder}/data/"
 847    img_name = ""
 848    if crop_mode == 'nucleus':
 849        img_name = f"{file_name}_{cell_id_str}_{cell_nucleus_id_str}.png"
 850        fldr += "single_nucleus/" if cell_nucleus_ids.size == 1 else "multiple_nucleus/" if cell_nucleus_ids.size > 1 else "no_nucleus/"
 851        fldr += "single_pathogen/" if cell_pathogen_ids.size == 1 else "multiple_pathogens/" if cell_pathogen_ids.size > 1 else "uninfected/"
 852    elif crop_mode == 'pathogen':
 853        img_name = f"{file_name}_{cell_id_str}_{cell_pathogen_id_str}.png"
 854        fldr += "single_nucleus/" if cell_nucleus_ids.size == 1 else "multiple_nucleus/" if cell_nucleus_ids.size > 1 else "no_nucleus/"
 855        fldr += "infected/" if cell_pathogen_ids.size >= 1 else "uninfected/"
 856    elif crop_mode == 'cell' or crop_mode == 'cytoplasm':
 857        img_name = f"{file_name}_{cell_id_str}.png"
 858        fldr += "single_nucleus/" if cell_nucleus_ids.size == 1 else "multiple_nucleus/" if cell_nucleus_ids.size > 1 else "no_nucleus/"
 859        fldr += "single_pathogen/" if cell_pathogen_ids.size == 1 else "multiple_pathogens/" if cell_pathogen_ids.size > 1 else "uninfected/"
 860    parts = file_name.split('_')
 861    plate = parts[0]
 862    well = parts[1] 
 863    metadata = f'{plate}_{well}'
 864    fldr = os.path.join(fldr,metadata)
 865    table_name = fldr.replace("/", "_")
 866    return img_name, fldr, table_name
 867
 868def _find_bounding_box(crop_mask, _id, buffer=10):
 869    """
 870    Find the bounding box coordinates for a given object ID in a crop mask.
 871
 872    Parameters:
 873    crop_mask (ndarray): The crop mask containing object IDs.
 874    _id (int): The object ID to find the bounding box for.
 875    buffer (int, optional): The buffer size to add to the bounding box coordinates. Defaults to 10.
 876
 877    Returns:
 878    ndarray: A new mask with the same dimensions as crop_mask, where the bounding box area is filled with the object ID.
 879    """
 880    object_indices = np.where(crop_mask == _id)
 881
 882    # Determine the bounding box coordinates
 883    y_min, y_max = object_indices[0].min(), object_indices[0].max()
 884    x_min, x_max = object_indices[1].min(), object_indices[1].max()
 885
 886    # Add buffer to the bounding box coordinates
 887    y_min = max(y_min - buffer, 0)
 888    y_max = min(y_max + buffer, crop_mask.shape[0] - 1)
 889    x_min = max(x_min - buffer, 0)
 890    x_max = min(x_max + buffer, crop_mask.shape[1] - 1)
 891
 892    # Create a new mask with the same dimensions as crop_mask
 893    new_mask = np.zeros_like(crop_mask)
 894
 895    # Fill in the bounding box area with the _id
 896    new_mask[y_min:y_max+1, x_min:x_max+1] = _id
 897
 898    return new_mask
 899    
 900def _merge_and_save_to_database(morph_df, intensity_df, table_type, source_folder, file_name, experiment, timelapse=False):
 901        """
 902        Merges morphology and intensity dataframes, renames columns, adds additional columns, rearranges columns,
 903        and saves the merged dataframe to a SQLite database.
 904
 905        Args:
 906            morph_df (pd.DataFrame): Dataframe containing morphology data.
 907            intensity_df (pd.DataFrame): Dataframe containing intensity data.
 908            table_type (str): Type of table to save the merged dataframe to.
 909            source_folder (str): Path to the source folder.
 910            file_name (str): Name of the file.
 911            experiment (str): Name of the experiment.
 912            timelapse (bool, optional): Indicates if the data is from a timelapse experiment. Defaults to False.
 913
 914        Raises:
 915            ValueError: If an invalid table_type is provided or if columns are missing in the dataframe.
 916
 917        """
 918        morph_df = _check_integrity(morph_df)
 919        intensity_df = _check_integrity(intensity_df)
 920        if len(morph_df) > 0 and len(intensity_df) > 0:
 921            merged_df = pd.merge(morph_df, intensity_df, on='object_label', how='outer')
 922            merged_df = merged_df.rename(columns={"label_list_x": "label_list_morphology", "label_list_y": "label_list_intensity"})
 923            merged_df['file_name'] = file_name
 924            merged_df['path_name'] = os.path.join(source_folder, file_name + '.npy')
 925            if timelapse:
 926                merged_df[['plateID', 'rowID', 'columnID', 'fieldID', 'timeid', 'prcf']] = merged_df['file_name'].apply(lambda x: pd.Series(_map_wells(x, timelapse)))
 927            else:
 928                merged_df[['plateID', 'rowID', 'columnID', 'fieldID', 'prcf']] = merged_df['file_name'].apply(lambda x: pd.Series(_map_wells(x, timelapse)))
 929            cols = merged_df.columns.tolist()  # get the list of all columns
 930            if table_type == 'cell' or table_type == 'cytoplasm':
 931                column_list = ['object_label', 'plateID', 'rowID', 'columnID', 'fieldID', 'prcf', 'file_name', 'path_name']
 932            elif table_type == 'nucleus' or table_type == 'pathogen':
 933                column_list = ['object_label', 'cell_id', 'plateID', 'rowID', 'columnID', 'fieldID', 'prcf', 'file_name', 'path_name']
 934            else:
 935                raise ValueError(f"Invalid table_type: {table_type}")
 936            # Check if all columns in column_list are in cols
 937            missing_columns = [col for col in column_list if col not in cols]
 938            if len(missing_columns) == 1 and missing_columns[0] == 'cell_id':
 939                missing_columns = False
 940                column_list = ['object_label', 'plateID', 'rowID', 'columnID', 'fieldID', 'prcf', 'file_name', 'path_name']
 941            if missing_columns:
 942                raise ValueError(f"Columns missing in DataFrame: {missing_columns}")
 943            for i, col in enumerate(column_list):
 944                cols.insert(i, cols.pop(cols.index(col)))
 945            merged_df = merged_df[cols]  # rearrange the columns
 946            if len(merged_df) > 0:
 947                try:
 948                    conn = sqlite3.connect(f'{source_folder}/measurements/measurements.db', timeout=5)
 949                    merged_df.to_sql(table_type, conn, if_exists='append', index=False)
 950                except sqlite3.OperationalError as e:
 951                    print("SQLite error:", e)
 952                    
 953def _safe_int_convert(value, default=0):
 954    """
 955    Converts the given value to an integer if possible, otherwise returns the default value.
 956
 957    Args:
 958        value: The value to be converted to an integer.
 959        default: The default value to be returned if the conversion fails. Default is 0.
 960
 961    Returns:
 962        The converted integer value if successful, otherwise the default value.
 963    """
 964    try:
 965        return int(value)
 966    except ValueError:
 967        print(f'Could not convert {value} to int using {default}', end='\r', flush=True)
 968        return default
 969
 970def _map_wells(file_name, timelapse=False):
 971    """
 972    Maps the components of a file name to plate, row, column, field, and timeid (if timelapse is True).
 973
 974    Args:
 975        file_name (str): The name of the file.
 976        timelapse (bool, optional): Indicates whether the file is part of a timelapse sequence. Defaults to False.
 977
 978    Returns:
 979        tuple: A tuple containing the mapped values for plate, row, column, field, and timeid (if timelapse is True).
 980    """
 981    try:
 982        parts = file_name.split('_')
 983        plate = 'p' + parts[0]
 984        well = parts[1]
 985        field = 'f' + str(_safe_int_convert(parts[2]))
 986        if timelapse:
 987            timeid = 't' + str(_safe_int_convert(parts[3]))
 988        if well[0].isalpha():
 989            row = 'r' + str(string.ascii_uppercase.index(well[0]) + 1)
 990            column = 'c' + str(int(well[1:]))
 991        else:
 992            row, column = well, well
 993        if timelapse:    
 994            prcf = '_'.join([plate, row, column, field, timeid])
 995        else:
 996            prcf = '_'.join([plate, row, column, field])
 997    except Exception as e:
 998        print(f"Error processing filename: {file_name}")
 999        print(f"Error: {e}")
1000        plate, row, column, field, timeid, prcf = 'error','error','error','error','error', 'error'
1001    if timelapse:
1002        return plate, row, column, field, timeid, prcf
1003    else:
1004        return plate, row, column, field, prcf
1005
1006def _map_wells_png(file_name, timelapse=False):
1007    """
1008    Maps the components of a file name to their corresponding values.
1009
1010    Args:
1011        file_name (str): The name of the file.
1012        timelapse (bool, optional): Indicates whether the file is part of a timelapse sequence. Defaults to False.
1013
1014    Returns:
1015        tuple: A tuple containing the mapped components of the file name.
1016
1017    Raises:
1018        None
1019
1020    """
1021    try:
1022        root, ext = os.path.splitext(file_name)
1023        parts = root.split('_')
1024        plate = 'p' + parts[0]
1025        well = parts[1]
1026        field = 'f' + str(_safe_int_convert(parts[2]))
1027        if timelapse:
1028            timeid = 't' + str(_safe_int_convert(parts[3]))
1029        object_id = 'o' + str(_safe_int_convert(parts[-1], default='none'))
1030        if well[0].isalpha():
1031            row = 'r' + str(string.ascii_uppercase.index(well[0]) + 1)
1032            column = 'c' + str(_safe_int_convert(well[1:]))
1033        else:
1034            row, column = well, well
1035        if timelapse:
1036            prcfo = '_'.join([plate, row, column, field, timeid, object_id])
1037        else:
1038            prcfo = '_'.join([plate, row, column, field, object_id])
1039    except Exception as e:
1040        print(f"Error processing filename: {file_name}")
1041        print(f"Error: {e}")
1042        plate, row, column, field, object_id, prcfo = 'error', 'error', 'error', 'error', 'error', 'error'
1043    if timelapse:
1044        return plate, row, column, field, timeid, prcfo, object_id
1045    else:
1046        return plate, row, column, field, prcfo, object_id
1047        
1048def _check_integrity(df):
1049    """
1050    Check the integrity of the DataFrame and perform necessary modifications.
1051
1052    Args:
1053        df (pandas.DataFrame): The input DataFrame.
1054
1055    Returns:
1056        pandas.DataFrame: The modified DataFrame with integrity checks and modifications applied.
1057    """
1058    df.columns = [col + f'_{i}' if df.columns.tolist().count(col) > 1 and i != 0 else col for i, col in enumerate(df.columns)]
1059    label_cols = [col for col in df.columns if 'label' in col]
1060    df['label_list'] = df[label_cols].values.tolist()
1061    df['object_label'] = df['label_list'].apply(lambda x: x[0])
1062    df = df.drop(columns=label_cols)
1063    df['label_list'] = df['label_list'].astype(str)
1064    return df
1065    
1066def _get_percentiles(array, p1=2, p2=98):
1067    """
1068    Calculate the percentiles of each image in the given array.
1069
1070    Parameters:
1071    - array: numpy.ndarray
1072        The input array containing the images.
1073    - q1: float, optional
1074        The lower percentile value to calculate. Default is 2.
1075    - q2: float, optional
1076        The upper percentile value to calculate. Default is 98.
1077
1078    Returns:
1079    - percentiles: list
1080        A list of tuples, where each tuple contains the minimum and maximum
1081        values of the corresponding image in the array.
1082    """
1083    nimg = array.shape[2]
1084    percentiles = []
1085    for v in range(nimg):
1086        img = np.squeeze(array[:, :, v])
1087        non_zero_img = img[img > 0]
1088        if non_zero_img.size > 0: # check if there are non-zero values
1089            img_min = np.percentile(non_zero_img, p1)  # change percentile from 0.02 to 2
1090            img_max = np.percentile(non_zero_img, p2)  # change percentile from 0.98 to 98
1091            percentiles.append([img_min, img_max])
1092        else:  # if there are no non-zero values, just use the image as it is
1093            img_min = np.percentile(img, p1)  # change percentile from 0.02 to 2
1094            img_max = np.percentile(img, p2)  # change percentile from 0.98 to 98
1095            percentiles.append([img_min, img_max])
1096    return percentiles
1097
1098def _crop_center(img, cell_mask, new_width, new_height):
1099    """
1100    Crop the image around the center of the cell mask.
1101
1102    Parameters:
1103    - img: numpy.ndarray
1104        The input image.
1105    - cell_mask: numpy.ndarray
1106        The binary mask of the cell.
1107    - new_width: int
1108        The desired width of the cropped image.
1109    - new_height: int
1110        The desired height of the cropped image.
1111
1112    Returns:
1113    - img: numpy.ndarray
1114        The cropped image.
1115    """
1116    # Convert all non-zero values in mask to 1
1117    cell_mask[cell_mask != 0] = 1
1118    mask_3d = np.repeat(cell_mask[:, :, np.newaxis], img.shape[2], axis=2).astype(img.dtype) # Create 3D mask
1119    img = np.multiply(img, mask_3d).astype(img.dtype) # Multiply image with mask to set pixel values outside of the mask to 0
1120    centroid = np.round(ndi.center_of_mass(cell_mask)).astype(int) # Compute centroid of the mask
1121    
1122    # Pad the image and mask to ensure the crop will not go out of bounds
1123    pad_width = max(new_width, new_height)
1124    img = np.pad(img, ((pad_width, pad_width), (pad_width, pad_width), (0, 0)), mode='constant')
1125    cell_mask = np.pad(cell_mask, ((pad_width, pad_width), (pad_width, pad_width)), mode='constant')
1126    
1127    # Update centroid coordinates due to padding
1128    centroid += pad_width
1129    
1130    # Compute bounding box
1131    start_y = max(0, centroid[0] - new_height // 2)
1132    end_y = min(start_y + new_height, img.shape[0])
1133    start_x = max(0, centroid[1] - new_width // 2)
1134    end_x = min(start_x + new_width, img.shape[1])
1135    
1136    # Crop to bounding box
1137    img = img[start_y:end_y, start_x:end_x, :]
1138    return img
1139    
1140def _masks_to_masks_stack(masks):
1141    """
1142    Convert a list of masks into a stack of masks.
1143
1144    Args:
1145        masks (list): A list of masks.
1146
1147    Returns:
1148        list: A stack of masks.
1149    """
1150    mask_stack = []
1151    for idx, mask in enumerate(masks):
1152        mask_stack.append(mask)
1153    return mask_stack
1154
1155def _get_diam(mag, obj):
1156
1157    if obj == 'cell':
1158        diamiter = 2 * mag + 80
1159        
1160    if obj == 'cell_large':
1161        diamiter = 2 * mag + 120
1162                                
1163    if obj == 'nucleus':
1164        diamiter = 0.75 * mag + 45
1165                                
1166    if obj == 'pathogen':
1167        diamiter = mag
1168                                
1169    return int(diamiter)
1170
1171def _get_object_settings(object_type, settings):
1172    object_settings = {}
1173
1174    object_settings['diameter'] = _get_diam(settings['magnification'], obj=object_type)
1175    object_settings['minimum_size'] = (object_settings['diameter']**2)/4
1176    object_settings['maximum_size'] = (object_settings['diameter']**2)*10
1177    object_settings['merge'] = False
1178    object_settings['resample'] = True
1179    object_settings['remove_border_objects'] = False
1180    object_settings['model_name'] = 'cyto'
1181    
1182    if object_type == 'cell':
1183        if settings['nucleus_channel'] is None:
1184            object_settings['model_name'] = 'cyto'
1185        else:
1186            object_settings['model_name'] = 'cyto2'
1187        object_settings['filter_size'] = False
1188        object_settings['filter_intensity'] = False
1189        object_settings['restore_type'] = settings.get('cell_restore_type', None)
1190
1191    elif object_type == 'nucleus':
1192        object_settings['model_name'] = 'nuclei'
1193        object_settings['filter_size'] = False
1194        object_settings['filter_intensity'] = False
1195        object_settings['restore_type'] = settings.get('nucleus_restore_type', None)
1196
1197    elif object_type == 'pathogen':
1198        object_settings['model_name'] = 'cyto'
1199        object_settings['filter_size'] = False
1200        object_settings['filter_intensity'] = False
1201        object_settings['resample'] = False
1202        object_settings['restore_type'] = settings.get('pathogen_restore_type', None)
1203        object_settings['merge'] = settings['merge_pathogens']
1204        
1205    else:
1206        print(f'Object type: {object_type} not supported. Supported object types are : cell, nucleus and pathogen')
1207
1208    if settings['verbose']:
1209        print(object_settings)
1210        
1211    return object_settings
1212    
1213def _pivot_counts_table(db_path):
1214
1215    def _read_table_to_dataframe(db_path, table_name='object_counts'):
1216        """
1217        Read a table from an SQLite database into a pandas DataFrame.
1218
1219        Parameters:
1220        - db_path (str): The path to the SQLite database file.
1221        - table_name (str): The name of the table to read. Default is 'object_counts'.
1222
1223        Returns:
1224        - df (pandas.DataFrame): The table data as a pandas DataFrame.
1225        """
1226        # Connect to the SQLite database
1227        conn = sqlite3.connect(db_path)
1228        # Read the entire table into a pandas DataFrame
1229        query = f"SELECT * FROM {table_name}"
1230        df = pd.read_sql_query(query, conn)
1231        # Close the connection
1232        conn.close()
1233        return df
1234
1235    def _pivot_dataframe(df):
1236
1237        """
1238        Pivot the DataFrame.
1239
1240        Args:
1241            df (pandas.DataFrame): The input DataFrame.
1242
1243        Returns:
1244            pandas.DataFrame: The pivoted DataFrame with filled NaN values.
1245        """
1246        # Pivot the DataFrame
1247        pivoted_df = df.pivot(index='file_name', columns='count_type', values='object_count').reset_index()
1248        # Because the pivot operation can introduce NaN values for missing data,
1249        # you might want to fill those NaNs with a default value, like 0
1250        pivoted_df = pivoted_df.fillna(0)
1251        return pivoted_df
1252
1253    # Read the original 'object_counts' table
1254    df = _read_table_to_dataframe(db_path, 'object_counts')
1255    # Pivot the DataFrame to have one row per filename and a column for each object type
1256    pivoted_df = _pivot_dataframe(df)
1257    # Reconnect to the SQLite database to overwrite the 'object_counts' table with the pivoted DataFrame
1258    conn = sqlite3.connect(db_path)
1259    # When overwriting, ensure that you drop the existing table or use if_exists='replace' to overwrite it
1260    pivoted_df.to_sql('pivoted_counts', conn, if_exists='replace', index=False)
1261    conn.close()
1262    
1263def _get_cellpose_channels(src, nucleus_channel, pathogen_channel, cell_channel):
1264
1265    cell_mask_path = os.path.join(src, 'norm_channel_stack', 'cell_mask_stack')
1266    nucleus_mask_path = os.path.join(src, 'norm_channel_stack', 'nucleus_mask_stack')
1267    pathogen_mask_path = os.path.join(src, 'norm_channel_stack', 'pathogen_mask_stack')
1268
1269
1270    if os.path.exists(cell_mask_path) or os.path.exists(nucleus_mask_path) or os.path.exists(pathogen_mask_path):
1271        if nucleus_channel is None or nucleus_channel is None or nucleus_channel is None:
1272            print('Warning: Cellpose masks already exist. Unexpected behaviour when setting any object dimention to None when the object masks have been created.')
1273        
1274    cellpose_channels = {}
1275    if not nucleus_channel is None:
1276        cellpose_channels['nucleus'] = [0,0]
1277        
1278    if not pathogen_channel is None:
1279        if not nucleus_channel is None:
1280            if not pathogen_channel is None:
1281                cellpose_channels['pathogen'] = [0,2]
1282            else:
1283                cellpose_channels['pathogen'] = [0,1]
1284        else:
1285            cellpose_channels['pathogen'] = [0,0]
1286        
1287    if not cell_channel is None:
1288        if not nucleus_channel is None:
1289            cellpose_channels['cell'] = [0,1]
1290        else:
1291            cellpose_channels['cell'] = [0,0]
1292    return cellpose_channels
1293
1294def annotate_conditions(df, cells=None, cell_loc=None, pathogens=None, pathogen_loc=None, treatments=None, treatment_loc=None):
1295    """
1296    Annotates conditions in a DataFrame based on specified criteria and combines them into a 'condition' column.
1297    NaN is used for missing values, and they are excluded from the 'condition' column.
1298
1299    Args:
1300        df (pandas.DataFrame): The DataFrame to annotate.
1301        cells (list/str, optional): Host cell types. Defaults to None.
1302        cell_loc (list of lists, optional): Values for each host cell type. Defaults to None.
1303        pathogens (list/str, optional): Pathogens. Defaults to None.
1304        pathogen_loc (list of lists, optional): Values for each pathogen. Defaults to None.
1305        treatments (list/str, optional): Treatments. Defaults to None.
1306        treatment_loc (list of lists, optional): Values for each treatment. Defaults to None.
1307
1308    Returns:
1309        pandas.DataFrame: Annotated DataFrame with a combined 'condition' column.
1310    """
1311    
1312    def _get_type(val):
1313        """Determine if a value maps to 'rowID' or 'columnID'."""
1314        if isinstance(val, str) and val.startswith('c'):
1315            return 'columnID'
1316        elif isinstance(val, str) and val.startswith('r'):
1317            return 'rowID'
1318        return None
1319
1320    def _map_or_default(column_name, values, loc, df):
1321        """
1322        Consolidates the logic for mapping values or assigning defaults when loc is None.
1323    
1324        Args:
1325            column_name (str): The column in the DataFrame to annotate.
1326            values (list/str): The list of values or a single string to annotate.
1327            loc (list of lists): Location mapping for the values, or None if not used.
1328            df (pandas.DataFrame): The DataFrame to modify.
1329        """
1330        if isinstance(values, str) and loc is None:
1331            # If a single string is provided and loc is None, assign the value to all rows
1332            df[column_name] = values  
1333    
1334        elif isinstance(values, list) and loc is None:
1335            # If a list of values is provided but no loc, assign the first value to all rows
1336            df[column_name] = values[0]
1337    
1338        elif values is not None and loc is not None:
1339            # Perform location-based mapping
1340            value_dict = {val: key for key, loc_list in zip(values, loc) for val in loc_list}
1341            df[column_name] = np.nan  # Start with NaN
1342            for val, key in value_dict.items():
1343                loc_type = _get_type(val)
1344                if loc_type:
1345                    df.loc[df[loc_type] == val, column_name] = key
1346
1347    # Handle cells, pathogens, and treatments using the consolidated logic
1348    _map_or_default('host_cells', cells, cell_loc, df)
1349    _map_or_default('pathogen', pathogens, pathogen_loc, df)
1350    _map_or_default('treatment', treatments, treatment_loc, df)
1351
1352    # Conditionally fill NaN for pathogen and treatment columns if applicable
1353    if pathogens is not None:
1354        df['pathogen'].fillna(np.nan, inplace=True)
1355    if treatments is not None:
1356        df['treatment'].fillna(np.nan, inplace=True)
1357
1358    # Create the 'condition' column by excluding any NaN values, safely checking if 'host_cells', 'pathogen', and 'treatment' exist
1359    df['condition'] = df.apply(
1360        lambda x: '_'.join([str(v) for v in [x.get('host_cells'), x.get('pathogen'), x.get('treatment')] if pd.notna(v)]), 
1361        axis=1
1362    )
1363    df.loc[df['condition'] == '', 'condition'] = pd.NA
1364
1365    return df
1366
1367def _split_data(df, group_by, object_type):
1368    """
1369    Splits the input dataframe into numeric and non-numeric parts, groups them by the specified column,
1370    and returns the grouped dataframes with conditional aggregation.
1371
1372    Parameters:
1373    df (pandas.DataFrame): The input dataframe.
1374    group_by (str): The column name to group the dataframes by.
1375    object_type (str): The column name to concatenate with 'prcf' to create a new column 'prcfo'.
1376
1377    Returns:
1378    grouped_numeric (pandas.DataFrame): The grouped dataframe containing numeric columns with conditional aggregation.
1379    grouped_non_numeric (pandas.DataFrame): The grouped dataframe containing non-numeric columns.
1380    """
1381    
1382    # Ensure 'prcf' column exists by concatenating specific columns
1383    if 'prcf' not in df.columns:
1384        try:
1385            df['prcf'] = df['plateID'].astype(str) + '_' + df['rowID'].astype(str) + '_' + df['columnID'].astype(str) + '_' + df['fieldID'].astype(str)
1386        except Exception as e:
1387            print(e)    
1388    
1389    # Create the 'prcfo' column
1390    df['prcfo'] = df['prcf'] + '_' + df[object_type]
1391    df = df.set_index(group_by, inplace=False)
1392
1393    # Split the DataFrame into numeric and non-numeric parts
1394    df_numeric = df.select_dtypes(include=np.number)
1395    df_non_numeric = df.select_dtypes(exclude=np.number)
1396
1397    # Define keywords for columns to be summed instead of averaged
1398    sum_keywords = ['area', 'perimeter', 'convex_area', 'bbox_area', 'filled_area', 'major_axis_length', 'minor_axis_length', 'equivalent_diameter']
1399
1400    # Create a dictionary for custom aggregation
1401    agg_dict = {}
1402    for column in df_numeric.columns:
1403        if any(keyword in column for keyword in sum_keywords):
1404            agg_dict[column] = 'sum'
1405        else:
1406            agg_dict[column] = 'mean'
1407
1408    # Apply custom aggregation
1409    grouped_numeric = df_numeric.groupby(df_numeric.index).agg(agg_dict)
1410    grouped_non_numeric = df_non_numeric.groupby(df_non_numeric.index).first()
1411
1412    return pd.DataFrame(grouped_numeric), pd.DataFrame(grouped_non_numeric)
1413    
1414def _calculate_recruitment(df, channel):
1415    """
1416    Calculate recruitment metrics based on intensity values in different channels.
1417
1418    Args:
1419        df (pandas.DataFrame): The input DataFrame containing intensity values in different channels.
1420        channel (int): The channel number.
1421
1422    Returns:
1423        pandas.DataFrame: The DataFrame with calculated recruitment metrics.
1424
1425    """
1426    df['pathogen_cell_mean_mean'] = df[f'pathogen_channel_{channel}_mean_intensity']/df[f'cell_channel_{channel}_mean_intensity']
1427    df['pathogen_cytoplasm_mean_mean'] = df[f'pathogen_channel_{channel}_mean_intensity']/df[f'cytoplasm_channel_{channel}_mean_intensity']
1428    df['pathogen_nucleus_mean_mean'] = df[f'pathogen_channel_{channel}_mean_intensity']/df[f'nucleus_channel_{channel}_mean_intensity']
1429
1430    df['pathogen_cell_q75_mean'] = df[f'pathogen_channel_{channel}_percentile_75']/df[f'cell_channel_{channel}_mean_intensity']
1431    df['pathogen_cytoplasm_q75_mean'] = df[f'pathogen_channel_{channel}_percentile_75']/df[f'cytoplasm_channel_{channel}_mean_intensity']
1432    df['pathogen_nucleus_q75_mean'] = df[f'pathogen_channel_{channel}_percentile_75']/df[f'nucleus_channel_{channel}_mean_intensity']
1433
1434    df['pathogen_outside_cell_mean_mean'] = df[f'pathogen_channel_{channel}_outside_mean']/df[f'cell_channel_{channel}_mean_intensity']
1435    df['pathogen_outside_cytoplasm_mean_mean'] = df[f'pathogen_channel_{channel}_outside_mean']/df[f'cytoplasm_channel_{channel}_mean_intensity']
1436    df['pathogen_outside_nucleus_mean_mean'] = df[f'pathogen_channel_{channel}_outside_mean']/df[f'nucleus_channel_{channel}_mean_intensity']
1437
1438    df['pathogen_outside_cell_q75_mean'] = df[f'pathogen_channel_{channel}_outside_75_percentile']/df[f'cell_channel_{channel}_mean_intensity']
1439    df['pathogen_outside_cytoplasm_q75_mean'] = df[f'pathogen_channel_{channel}_outside_75_percentile']/df[f'cytoplasm_channel_{channel}_mean_intensity']
1440    df['pathogen_outside_nucleus_q75_mean'] = df[f'pathogen_channel_{channel}_outside_75_percentile']/df[f'nucleus_channel_{channel}_mean_intensity']
1441
1442    df['pathogen_periphery_cell_mean_mean'] = df[f'pathogen_channel_{channel}_periphery_mean']/df[f'cell_channel_{channel}_mean_intensity']
1443    df['pathogen_periphery_cytoplasm_mean_mean'] = df[f'pathogen_channel_{channel}_periphery_mean']/df[f'cytoplasm_channel_{channel}_mean_intensity']
1444    df['pathogen_periphery_nucleus_mean_mean'] = df[f'pathogen_channel_{channel}_periphery_mean']/df[f'nucleus_channel_{channel}_mean_intensity']
1445
1446    channels = [0,1,2,3]
1447    object_type = 'pathogen'
1448    for chan in channels:
1449        df[f'{object_type}_slope_channel_{chan}'] = 1
1450
1451    object_type = 'nucleus'
1452    for chan in channels:
1453        df[f'{object_type}_slope_channel_{chan}'] = 1
1454
1455    #for chan in channels:
1456    #    df[f'nucleus_coordinates_{chan}'] = df[[f'nucleus_channel_{chan}_centroid_weighted_local-0', f'nucleus_channel_{chan}_centroid_weighted_local-1']].values.tolist()
1457    #    df[f'pathogen_coordinates_{chan}'] = df[[f'pathogen_channel_{chan}_centroid_weighted_local-0', f'pathogen_channel_{chan}_centroid_weighted_local-1']].values.tolist()
1458    #    df[f'cell_coordinates_{chan}'] = df[[f'cell_channel_{chan}_centroid_weighted_local-0', f'cell_channel_{chan}_centroid_weighted_local-1']].values.tolist()
1459    #    df[f'cytoplasm_coordinates_{chan}'] = df[[f'cytoplasm_channel_{chan}_centroid_weighted_local-0', f'cytoplasm_channel_{chan}_centroid_weighted_local-1']].values.tolist()
1460    # 
1461    #    df[f'pathogen_cell_distance_channel_{chan}'] = df.apply(lambda row: np.sqrt((row[f'pathogen_coordinates_{chan}'][0] - row[f'cell_coordinates_{chan}'][0])**2 + 
1462    #                                                  (row[f'pathogen_coordinates_{chan}'][1] - row[f'cell_coordinates_{chan}'][1])**2), axis=1)
1463    #    df[f'nucleus_cell_distance_channel_{chan}'] = df.apply(lambda row: np.sqrt((row[f'nucleus_coordinates_{chan}'][0] - row[f'cell_coordinates_{chan}'][0])**2 + 
1464    #                                                  (row[f'nucleus_coordinates_{chan}'][1] - row[f'cell_coordinates_{chan}'][1])**2), axis=1)
1465    return df
1466    
1467def _group_by_well(df):
1468    """
1469    Group the DataFrame by well coordinates (plate, row, col) and apply mean function to numeric columns
1470    and select the first value for non-numeric columns.
1471
1472    Parameters:
1473    df (DataFrame): The input DataFrame to be grouped.
1474
1475    Returns:
1476    DataFrame: The grouped DataFrame.
1477    """
1478    numeric_cols = df._get_numeric_data().columns
1479    non_numeric_cols = df.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns
1480
1481    # Apply mean function to numeric columns and first to non-numeric
1482    df_grouped = df.groupby(['plateID', 'rowID', 'columnID']).agg({**{col: np.mean for col in numeric_cols}, **{col: 'first' for col in non_numeric_cols}})
1483    return df_grouped
1484
1485###################################################
1486#  Classify
1487###################################################
1488
1489class Cache:
1490    """
1491    A class representing a cache with a maximum size.
1492
1493    Attributes:
1494        max_size (int): The maximum size of the cache.
1495        cache (OrderedDict): The cache data structure.
1496    """
1497
1498    def __init__(self, max_size):
1499        self.cache = OrderedDict()
1500        self.max_size = max_size
1501
1502    def get(self, key):
1503        if key in self.cache:
1504            value = self.cache.pop(key)
1505            self.cache[key] = value
1506            return value
1507        return None
1508
1509    def put(self, key, value):
1510        if len(self.cache) >= self.max_size:
1511            self.cache.popitem(last=False)
1512        self.cache[key] = value
1513
1514class ScaledDotProductAttention(nn.Module):
1515    """
1516    Scaled Dot-Product Attention module.
1517
1518    Args:
1519        d_k (int): The dimension of the key and query vectors.
1520
1521    Attributes:
1522        d_k (int): The dimension of the key and query vectors.
1523
1524    Methods:
1525        forward(Q, K, V): Performs the forward pass of the attention mechanism.
1526
1527    """
1528
1529    def __init__(self, d_k):
1530        super(ScaledDotProductAttention, self).__init__()
1531        self.d_k = d_k
1532
1533    def forward(self, Q, K, V):
1534        """
1535        Performs the forward pass of the attention mechanism.
1536
1537        Args:
1538            Q (torch.Tensor): The query tensor of shape (batch_size, seq_len_q, d_k).
1539            K (torch.Tensor): The key tensor of shape (batch_size, seq_len_k, d_k).
1540            V (torch.Tensor): The value tensor of shape (batch_size, seq_len_v, d_k).
1541
1542        Returns:
1543            torch.Tensor: The output tensor of shape (batch_size, seq_len_q, d_k).
1544
1545        """
1546        scores = torch.matmul(Q, K.transpose(-2, -1)) / torch.sqrt(torch.tensor(self.d_k, dtype=torch.float32))
1547        attention_probs = F.softmax(scores, dim=-1)
1548        output = torch.matmul(attention_probs, V)
1549        return output
1550
1551class SelfAttention(nn.Module):
1552    """
1553    Self-Attention module that applies scaled dot-product attention mechanism.
1554    
1555    Args:
1556        in_channels (int): Number of input channels.
1557        d_k (int): Dimensionality of the key and query vectors.
1558    """
1559
1560    def __init__(self, in_channels, d_k):
1561        super(SelfAttention, self).__init__()
1562        self.W_q = nn.Linear(in_channels, d_k)
1563        self.W_k = nn.Linear(in_channels, d_k)
1564        self.W_v = nn.Linear(in_channels, d_k)
1565        self.attention = ScaledDotProductAttention(d_k)
1566
1567    def forward(self, x):
1568        """
1569        Forward pass of the SelfAttention module.
1570        
1571        Args:
1572            x (torch.Tensor): Input tensor of shape (batch_size, in_channels).
1573        
1574        Returns:
1575            torch.Tensor: Output tensor of shape (batch_size, d_k).
1576        """
1577        Q = self.W_q(x)
1578        K = self.W_k(x)
1579        V = self.W_v(x)
1580        output = self.attention(Q, K, V)
1581        return output
1582
1583class ScaledDotProductAttention(nn.Module):
1584    def __init__(self, d_k):
1585        """
1586        Initializes the ScaledDotProductAttention module.
1587
1588        Args:
1589            d_k (int): The dimension of the key and query vectors.
1590
1591        """
1592        super(ScaledDotProductAttention, self).__init__()
1593        self.d_k = d_k
1594
1595    def forward(self, Q, K, V):
1596        """
1597        Performs the forward pass of the ScaledDotProductAttention module.
1598
1599        Args:
1600            Q (torch.Tensor): The query tensor.
1601            K (torch.Tensor): The key tensor.
1602            V (torch.Tensor): The value tensor.
1603
1604        Returns:
1605            torch.Tensor: The output tensor.
1606
1607        """
1608        scores = torch.matmul(Q, K.transpose(-2, -1)) / torch.sqrt(torch.tensor(self.d_k, dtype=torch.float32))
1609        attention_probs = F.softmax(scores, dim=-1)
1610        output = torch.matmul(attention_probs, V)
1611        return output
1612
1613class SelfAttention(nn.Module):
1614    """
1615    Self-Attention module that applies scaled dot-product attention mechanism.
1616    
1617    Args:
1618        in_channels (int): Number of input channels.
1619        d_k (int): Dimensionality of the key and query vectors.
1620    """
1621    def __init__(self, in_channels, d_k):
1622        super(SelfAttention, self).__init__()
1623        self.W_q = nn.Linear(in_channels, d_k)
1624        self.W_k = nn.Linear(in_channels, d_k)
1625        self.W_v = nn.Linear(in_channels, d_k)
1626        self.attention = ScaledDotProductAttention(d_k)
1627    
1628    def forward(self, x):
1629        """
1630        Forward pass of the SelfAttention module.
1631        
1632        Args:
1633            x (torch.Tensor): Input tensor of shape (batch_size, in_channels).
1634        
1635        Returns:
1636            torch.Tensor: Output tensor after applying self-attention mechanism.
1637        """
1638        Q = self.W_q(x)
1639        K = self.W_k(x)
1640        V = self.W_v(x)
1641        output = self.attention(Q, K, V)
1642        return output
1643
1644# Early Fusion Block
1645class EarlyFusion(nn.Module):
1646    """
1647    Early Fusion module for image classification.
1648    
1649    Args:
1650        in_channels (int): Number of input channels.
1651    """
1652    def __init__(self, in_channels):
1653        super(EarlyFusion, self).__init__()
1654        self.conv1 = nn.Conv2d(in_channels, 64, kernel_size=1, stride=1)
1655        
1656    def forward(self, x):
1657        """
1658        Forward pass of the Early Fusion module.
1659        
1660        Args:
1661            x (torch.Tensor): Input tensor of shape (batch_size, in_channels, height, width).
1662        
1663        Returns:
1664            torch.Tensor: Output tensor of shape (batch_size, 64, height, width).
1665        """
1666        x = self.conv1(x)
1667        return x
1668
1669# Spatial Attention Mechanism
1670class SpatialAttention(nn.Module):
1671    def __init__(self, kernel_size=7):
1672        """
1673        Initializes the SpatialAttention module.
1674
1675        Args:
1676            kernel_size (int): The size of the convolutional kernel. Default is 7.
1677        """
1678        super(SpatialAttention, self).__init__()
1679        self.conv1 = nn.Conv2d(2, 1, kernel_size, padding=kernel_size//2, bias=False)
1680        self.sigmoid = nn.Sigmoid()
1681
1682    def forward(self, x):
1683        """
1684        Performs forward pass of the SpatialAttention module.
1685
1686        Args:
1687            x (torch.Tensor): The input tensor.
1688
1689        Returns:
1690            torch.Tensor: The output tensor after applying spatial attention.
1691        """
1692        avg_out = torch.mean(x, dim=1, keepdim=True)
1693        max_out, _ = torch.max(x, dim=1, keepdim=True)
1694        x = torch.cat([avg_out, max_out], dim=1)
1695        x = self.conv1(x)
1696        return self.sigmoid(x)
1697    
1698# Multi-Scale Block with Attention
1699class MultiScaleBlockWithAttention(nn.Module):
1700    def __init__(self, in_channels, out_channels):
1701        super(MultiScaleBlockWithAttention, self).__init__()
1702        self.dilated_conv1 = nn.Conv2d(in_channels, out_channels, kernel_size=3, dilation=1, padding=1)
1703        self.spatial_attention = nn.Conv2d(out_channels, out_channels, kernel_size=1)
1704        
1705    def custom_forward(self, x):
1706        x1 = F.relu(self.dilated_conv1(x), inplace=True)
1707        x = self.spatial_attention(x1)
1708        return x
1709
1710    def forward(self, x):
1711        return self.custom_forward(x)
1712
1713# Final Classifier
1714class CustomCellClassifier(nn.Module):
1715    def __init__(self, num_classes, pathogen_channel, use_attention, use_checkpoint, dropout_rate):
1716        super(CustomCellClassifier, self).__init__()
1717        self.early_fusion = EarlyFusion(in_channels=3)
1718        
1719        self.multi_scale_block_1 = MultiScaleBlockWithAttention(in_channels=64, out_channels=64)
1720        
1721        self.fc1 = nn.Linear(64, num_classes)
1722        self.use_checkpoint = use_checkpoint
1723        # Explicitly require gradients for all parameters
1724        for param in self.parameters():
1725            param.requires_grad = True
1726        
1727    def custom_forward(self, x):
1728        x.requires_grad = True 
1729        x = self.early_fusion(x)
1730        x = self.multi_scale_block_1(x)
1731        x = F.adaptive_avg_pool2d(x, (1, 1)).view(x.size(0), -1)
1732        x = F.relu(self.fc1(x), inplace=True)
1733        return x
1734
1735    def forward(self, x):
1736        if self.use_checkpoint:
1737            x.requires_grad = True 
1738            return checkpoint(self.custom_forward, x)
1739        else:
1740            return self.custom_forward(x)
1741
1742#CNN and Transformer class, pick any Torch model.
1743class TorchModel(nn.Module):
1744    def __init__(self, model_name='resnet50', pretrained=True, dropout_rate=None, use_checkpoint=False):
1745        super(TorchModel, self).__init__()
1746        self.model_name = model_name
1747        self.use_checkpoint = use_checkpoint
1748        self.base_model = self.init_base_model(pretrained)
1749        
1750        # Retain layers up to and including the (5): Linear layer for model 'maxvit_t'
1751        if model_name == 'maxvit_t':
1752            self.base_model.classifier = nn.Sequential(*list(self.base_model.classifier.children())[:-1])
1753        
1754        if dropout_rate is not None:
1755            self.apply_dropout_rate(self.base_model, dropout_rate)
1756            
1757        self.num_ftrs = self.get_num_ftrs()
1758        self.init_spacr_classifier(dropout_rate)
1759
1760    def apply_dropout_rate(self, model, dropout_rate):
1761        """Apply dropout rate to all dropout layers in the model."""
1762        for module in model.modules():
1763            if isinstance(module, nn.Dropout):
1764                module.p = dropout_rate
1765
1766    def init_base_model(self, pretrained):
1767        """Initialize the base model from torchvision.models."""
1768        model_func = models.__dict__.get(self.model_name, None)
1769        if not model_func:
1770            raise ValueError(f"Model {self.model_name} is not recognized.")
1771        weight_choice = self.get_weight_choice()
1772        if weight_choice is not None:
1773            return model_func(weights=weight_choice)
1774        else:
1775            return model_func(pretrained=pretrained)
1776
1777    def get_weight_choice(self):
1778        """Get weight choice if it exists for the model."""
1779        weight_enum = None
1780        for attr_name in dir(models):
1781            if attr_name.lower() == f"{self.model_name}_weights".lower():
1782                weight_enum = getattr(models, attr_name)
1783                break
1784        return weight_enum.DEFAULT if weight_enum else None
1785
1786    def get_num_ftrs(self):
1787        """Determine the number of features output by the base model."""
1788        if hasattr(self.base_model, 'fc'):
1789            self.base_model.fc = nn.Identity()
1790        elif hasattr(self.base_model, 'classifier'):
1791            if self.model_name != 'maxvit_t':
1792                self.base_model.classifier = nn.Identity()
1793
1794        # Forward a dummy input and check output size
1795        dummy_input = torch.randn(1, 3, 224, 224)
1796        output = self.base_model(dummy_input)
1797        return output.size(1)
1798
1799    def init_spacr_classifier(self, dropout_rate):
1800        """Initialize the SPACR classifier."""
1801        self.use_dropout = dropout_rate is not None
1802        if self.use_dropout:
1803            self.dropout = nn.Dropout(dropout_rate)
1804        self.spacr_classifier = nn.Linear(self.num_ftrs, 1)
1805
1806    def forward(self, x):
