1807        """Define the forward pass of the model."""
1808        if self.use_checkpoint:
1809            x = checkpoint(self.base_model, x)
1810        else:
1811            x = self.base_model(x)
1812        if self.use_dropout:
1813            x = self.dropout(x)
1814        logits = self.spacr_classifier(x).flatten()
1815        return logits
1816
1817class FocalLossWithLogits(nn.Module):
1818    def __init__(self, alpha=1, gamma=2):
1819        super(FocalLossWithLogits, self).__init__()
1820        self.alpha = alpha
1821        self.gamma = gamma
1822
1823    def forward(self, logits, target):
1824        BCE_loss = F.binary_cross_entropy_with_logits(logits, target, reduction='none')
1825        pt = torch.exp(-BCE_loss)
1826        focal_loss = self.alpha * (1-pt)**self.gamma * BCE_loss
1827        return focal_loss.mean()
1828    
1829class ResNet(nn.Module):
1830    def __init__(self, resnet_type='resnet50', dropout_rate=None, use_checkpoint=False, init_weights='imagenet'):
1831        super(ResNet, self).__init__()
1832
1833        resnet_map = {
1834            'resnet18': {'func': models.resnet18, 'weights': ResNet18_Weights.IMAGENET1K_V1},
1835            'resnet34': {'func': models.resnet34, 'weights': ResNet34_Weights.IMAGENET1K_V1},
1836            'resnet50': {'func': models.resnet50, 'weights': ResNet50_Weights.IMAGENET1K_V1},
1837            'resnet101': {'func': models.resnet101, 'weights': ResNet101_Weights.IMAGENET1K_V1},
1838            'resnet152': {'func': models.resnet152, 'weights': ResNet152_Weights.IMAGENET1K_V1}
1839        }
1840
1841        if resnet_type not in resnet_map:
1842            raise ValueError(f"Invalid resnet_type. Choose from {list(resnet_map.keys())}")
1843
1844        self.initialize_base(resnet_map[resnet_type], dropout_rate, use_checkpoint, init_weights)
1845
1846    def initialize_base(self, base_model_dict, dropout_rate, use_checkpoint, init_weights):
1847        if init_weights == 'imagenet':
1848            self.resnet = base_model_dict['func'](weights=base_model_dict['weights'])
1849        elif init_weights == 'none':
1850            self.resnet = base_model_dict['func'](weights=None)
1851        else:
1852            raise ValueError("init_weights should be either 'imagenet' or 'none'")
1853
1854        self.fc1 = nn.Linear(1000, 500)
1855        self.use_dropout = dropout_rate != None
1856        self.use_checkpoint = use_checkpoint
1857
1858        if self.use_dropout:
1859            self.dropout = nn.Dropout(dropout_rate)
1860
1861        self.fc2 = nn.Linear(500, 1)
1862
1863    def forward(self, x):
1864        x.requires_grad = True  # Ensure that the tensor has requires_grad set to True
1865
1866        if self.use_checkpoint:
1867            x = checkpoint(self.resnet, x)  # Use checkpointing for just the ResNet part
1868        else:
1869            x = self.resnet(x)
1870        
1871        x = F.relu(self.fc1(x))
1872
1873        if self.use_dropout:
1874            x = self.dropout(x)
1875
1876        logits = self.fc2(x).flatten()
1877        return logits
1878
1879def split_my_dataset(dataset, split_ratio=0.1):
1880    """
1881    Splits a dataset into training and validation subsets.
1882
1883    Args:
1884        dataset (torch.utils.data.Dataset): The dataset to be split.
1885        split_ratio (float, optional): The ratio of validation samples to total samples. Defaults to 0.1.
1886
1887    Returns:
1888        tuple: A tuple containing the training dataset and validation dataset.
1889    """
1890    num_samples = len(dataset)
1891    indices = list(range(num_samples))
1892    split_idx = int((1 - split_ratio) * num_samples)
1893    random.shuffle(indices)
1894    train_indices, val_indices = indices[:split_idx], indices[split_idx:]
1895    train_dataset = Subset(dataset, train_indices)
1896    val_dataset = Subset(dataset, val_indices)
1897    return train_dataset, val_dataset
1898
1899def classification_metrics(all_labels, prediction_pos_probs, loss, epoch):
1900    """
1901    Calculate classification metrics for binary classification.
1902
1903    Parameters:
1904    - all_labels (list): List of true labels.
1905    - prediction_pos_probs (list): List of predicted positive probabilities.
1906    - loader_name (str): Name of the data loader.
1907    - loss (float): Loss value.
1908    - epoch (int): Epoch number.
1909
1910    Returns:
1911    - data_df (DataFrame): DataFrame containing the calculated metrics.
1912    """
1913    
1914    if len(all_labels) != len(prediction_pos_probs):
1915        raise ValueError(f"all_labels ({len(all_labels)}) and pred_labels ({len(prediction_pos_probs)}) have different lengths")
1916    
1917    unique_labels = np.unique(all_labels)
1918    if len(unique_labels) >= 2:
1919        pr_labels = np.array(all_labels).astype(int)
1920        precision, recall, thresholds = precision_recall_curve(pr_labels, prediction_pos_probs, pos_label=1)
1921        pr_auc = auc(recall, precision)
1922        thresholds = np.append(thresholds, 0.0)
1923        f1_scores = 2 * (precision * recall) / (precision + recall)
1924        optimal_idx = np.nanargmax(f1_scores)
1925        optimal_threshold = thresholds[optimal_idx]
1926        pred_labels = [int(p > 0.5) for p in prediction_pos_probs]
1927    if len(unique_labels) < 2:
1928        optimal_threshold = 0.5
1929        pred_labels = [int(p > optimal_threshold) for p in prediction_pos_probs]
1930        pr_auc = np.nan
1931    data = {'label': all_labels, 'pred': pred_labels}
1932    df = pd.DataFrame(data)
1933    pc_df = df[df['label'] == 1.0]
1934    nc_df = df[df['label'] == 0.0]
1935    correct = df[df['label'] == df['pred']]
1936    acc_all = len(correct) / len(df)
1937    if len(pc_df) > 0:
1938        correct_pc = pc_df[pc_df['label'] == pc_df['pred']]
1939        acc_pc = len(correct_pc) / len(pc_df)
1940    else:
1941        acc_pc = np.nan
1942    if len(nc_df) > 0:
1943        correct_nc = nc_df[nc_df['label'] == nc_df['pred']]
1944        acc_nc = len(correct_nc) / len(nc_df)
1945    else:
1946        acc_nc = np.nan
1947    data_dict = {'accuracy': acc_all, 'neg_accuracy': acc_nc, 'pos_accuracy': acc_pc, 'loss':loss.item(),'prauc':pr_auc, 'optimal_threshold':optimal_threshold}
1948    data_df = pd.DataFrame(data_dict, index=[str(epoch)]) 
1949    return data_df
1950    
1951def compute_irm_penalty(losses, dummy_w, device):
1952    """
1953    Computes the Invariant Risk Minimization (IRM) penalty.
1954
1955    Args:
1956        losses (list): A list of losses.
1957        dummy_w (torch.Tensor): A dummy weight tensor.
1958        device (torch.device): The device to perform computations on.
1959
1960    Returns:
1961        float: The computed IRM penalty.
1962    """
1963    weighted_losses = [loss.clone().detach().requires_grad_(True).to(device) * dummy_w for loss in losses]
1964    gradients = [grad(w_loss, dummy_w, create_graph=True)[0] for w_loss in weighted_losses]
1965    irm_penalty = 0.0
1966    for g1, g2 in combinations(gradients, 2):
1967        irm_penalty += (g1.dot(g2))**2
1968    return irm_penalty
1969
1970#def print_model_summary(base_model, channels, height, width):
1971#    """
1972#    Prints the summary of a given base model.
1973#
1974#    Args:
1975#        base_model (torch.nn.Module): The base model to print the summary of.
1976#        channels (int): The number of input channels.
1977#        height (int): The height of the input.
1978#        width (int): The width of the input.
1979#
1980#    Returns:
1981#        None
1982#    """
1983#    device = torch.device("cuda:0" if torch.cuda.is_available() else "cpu")
1984#    base_model.to(device)
1985#    summary(base_model, (channels, height, width))
1986#    return
1987
1988def choose_model(model_type, device, init_weights=True, dropout_rate=0, use_checkpoint=False, channels=3, height=224, width=224, chan_dict=None, num_classes=2, verbose=False):
1989    """
1990    Choose a model for classification.
1991
1992    Args:
1993        model_type (str): The type of model to choose. Can be one of the pre-defined TorchVision models or 'custom' for a custom model.
1994        device (str): The device to use for model inference.
1995        init_weights (bool, optional): Whether to initialize the model with pre-trained weights. Defaults to True.
1996        dropout_rate (float, optional): The dropout rate to use in the model. Defaults to 0.
1997        use_checkpoint (bool, optional): Whether to use checkpointing during model training. Defaults to False.
1998        channels (int, optional): The number of input channels for the model. Defaults to 3.
1999        height (int, optional): The height of the input images for the model. Defaults to 224.
2000        width (int, optional): The width of the input images for the model. Defaults to 224.
2001        chan_dict (dict, optional): A dictionary containing channel information for custom models. Defaults to None.
2002        num_classes (int, optional): The number of output classes for the model. Defaults to 2.
2003
2004    Returns:
2005        torch.nn.Module: The chosen model.
2006    """
2007
2008    torch_model_types = torchvision.models.list_models(module=torchvision.models)
2009    model_types = torch_model_types + ['custom']
2010    
2011    if not chan_dict is None:
2012        pathogen_channel = chan_dict['pathogen_channel']
2013        nucleus_channel = chan_dict['nucleus_channel']
2014        protein_channel = chan_dict['protein_channel']
2015    
2016    if model_type not in model_types:
2017        print(f'Invalid model_type: {model_type}. Compatible model_types: {model_types}')
2018        return
2019
2020    print(f'Model parameters: Architecture: {model_type} init_weights: {init_weights} dropout_rate: {dropout_rate} use_checkpoint: {use_checkpoint}', end='\r', flush=True)
2021    
2022    if model_type == 'custom':
2023        
2024        base_model = CustomCellClassifier(num_classes, pathogen_channel=pathogen_channel, use_attention=True, use_checkpoint=use_checkpoint, dropout_rate=dropout_rate)
2025        #base_model = CustomCellClassifier(num_classes=2, pathogen_channel=pathogen_channel, nucleus_channel=nucleus_channel, protein_channel=protein_channel, dropout_rate=dropout_rate, use_checkpoint=use_checkpoint)
2026    elif model_type in torch_model_types:
2027        base_model = TorchModel(model_name=model_type, pretrained=init_weights, dropout_rate=dropout_rate)
2028    else:
2029        print(f'Compatible model_types: {model_types}')
2030        raise ValueError(f"Invalid model_type: {model_type}")
2031    if verbose:
2032        print(base_model)
2033    
2034    return base_model
2035
2036def calculate_loss(output, target, loss_type='binary_cross_entropy_with_logits'):
2037    if loss_type == 'binary_cross_entropy_with_logits':
2038        loss = F.binary_cross_entropy_with_logits(output, target)
2039    elif loss_type == 'focal_loss':
2040        focal_loss_fn = FocalLossWithLogits(alpha=1, gamma=2)
2041        loss = focal_loss_fn(output, target)
2042    return loss
2043
2044def pick_best_model(src):
2045    all_files = os.listdir(src)
2046    pth_files = [f for f in all_files if f.endswith('.pth')]
2047    pattern = re.compile(r'_epoch_(\d+)_acc_(\d+(?:\.\d+)?)')
2048
2049    def sort_key(x):
2050        match = pattern.search(x)
2051        if not match:
2052            return (0.0, 0)  # Make the primary sorting key float for consistency
2053        g1, g2 = match.groups()
2054        return (float(g2), int(g1))  # Primary sort by accuracy (g2) and secondary sort by epoch (g1)
2055    
2056    sorted_files = sorted(pth_files, key=sort_key, reverse=True)
2057    best_model = sorted_files[0]
2058    return os.path.join(src, best_model)
2059
2060def get_paths_from_db(df, png_df, image_type='cell_png'):
2061    objects = df.index.tolist()
2062    filtered_df = png_df[png_df['png_path'].str.contains(image_type) & png_df['prcfo'].isin(objects)]
2063    return filtered_df
2064
2065def save_file_lists(dst, data_set, ls):
2066    df = pd.DataFrame(ls, columns=[data_set])  
2067    df.to_csv(f'{dst}/{data_set}.csv', index=False)
2068    return
2069
2070def augment_single_image(args):
2071    img_path, dst = args
2072    img = cv2.imread(img_path, cv2.IMREAD_UNCHANGED)
2073    filename = os.path.basename(img_path).split('.')[0]
2074
2075    # Original Image
2076    cv2.imwrite(os.path.join(dst, f"{filename}_original.png"), img)
2077    
2078    # 90 degree rotation
2079    img_rot_90 = cv2.rotate(img, cv2.ROTATE_90_CLOCKWISE)
2080    cv2.imwrite(os.path.join(dst, f"{filename}_rot_90.png"), img_rot_90)
2081    
2082    # 180 degree rotation
2083    img_rot_180 = cv2.rotate(img, cv2.ROTATE_180)
2084    cv2.imwrite(os.path.join(dst, f"{filename}_rot_180.png"), img_rot_180)
2085
2086    # 270 degree rotation
2087    img_rot_270 = cv2.rotate(img, cv2.ROTATE_90_COUNTERCLOCKWISE)
2088    cv2.imwrite(os.path.join(dst, f"{filename}_rot_270.png"), img_rot_270)
2089
2090    # Horizontal Flip
2091    img_flip_hor = cv2.flip(img, 1)
2092    cv2.imwrite(os.path.join(dst, f"{filename}_flip_hor.png"), img_flip_hor)
2093
2094    # Vertical Flip
2095    img_flip_ver = cv2.flip(img, 0)
2096    cv2.imwrite(os.path.join(dst, f"{filename}_flip_ver.png"), img_flip_ver)
2097
2098def augment_images(file_paths, dst):
2099    if not os.path.exists(dst):
2100        os.makedirs(dst)
2101
2102    args_list = [(img_path, dst) for img_path in file_paths]
2103
2104    with Pool(cpu_count()) as pool:
2105        pool.map(augment_single_image, args_list)
2106
2107def augment_classes(dst, nc, pc, generate=True,move=True):
2108    aug_nc = os.path.join(dst,'aug_nc')
2109    aug_pc = os.path.join(dst,'aug_pc')
2110    all_ = len(nc)+len(pc)
2111    if generate == True:
2112        os.makedirs(aug_nc, exist_ok=True)
2113        if __name__ == '__main__':
2114            augment_images(file_paths=nc, dst=aug_nc)
2115
2116        os.makedirs(aug_pc, exist_ok=True)
2117        if __name__ == '__main__':
2118            augment_images(file_paths=pc, dst=aug_pc)
2119
2120    if move == True:
2121        aug = os.path.join(dst,'aug')
2122        aug_train_nc = os.path.join(aug,'train/nc')
2123        aug_train_pc = os.path.join(aug,'train/pc')
2124        aug_test_nc = os.path.join(aug,'test/nc')
2125        aug_test_pc = os.path.join(aug,'test/pc')
2126
2127        os.makedirs(aug_train_nc, exist_ok=True)
2128        os.makedirs(aug_train_pc, exist_ok=True)
2129        os.makedirs(aug_test_nc, exist_ok=True)
2130        os.makedirs(aug_test_pc, exist_ok=True)
2131
2132        aug_nc_list = [os.path.join(aug_nc, file) for file in os.listdir(aug_nc)]
2133        aug_pc_list = [os.path.join(aug_pc, file) for file in os.listdir(aug_pc)]
2134
2135        nc_train_data, nc_test_data = train_test_split(aug_nc_list, test_size=0.1, shuffle=True, random_state=42)
2136        pc_train_data, pc_test_data = train_test_split(aug_pc_list, test_size=0.1, shuffle=True, random_state=42)
2137
2138        i=0
2139        for path in nc_train_data:
2140            i+=1
2141            shutil.move(path, os.path.join(aug_train_nc, os.path.basename(path)))
2142            print(f'{i}/{all_}', end='\r', flush=True)
2143        for path in nc_test_data:
2144            i+=1
2145            shutil.move(path, os.path.join(aug_test_nc, os.path.basename(path)))
2146            print(f'{i}/{all_}', end='\r', flush=True)
2147        for path in pc_train_data:
2148            i+=1
2149            shutil.move(path, os.path.join(aug_train_pc, os.path.basename(path)))
2150            print(f'{i}/{all_}', end='\r', flush=True)
2151        for path in pc_test_data:
2152            i+=1
2153            shutil.move(path, os.path.join(aug_test_pc, os.path.basename(path)))
2154            print(f'{i}/{all_}', end='\r', flush=True)
2155        print(f'Train nc: {len(os.listdir(aug_train_nc))}, Train pc:{len(os.listdir(aug_test_nc))}, Test nc:{len(os.listdir(aug_train_pc))}, Test pc:{len(os.listdir(aug_test_pc))}')
2156        return
2157
2158def annotate_predictions(csv_loc):
2159    df = pd.read_csv(csv_loc)
2160    df['filename'] = df['path'].apply(lambda x: x.split('/')[-1])
2161    df[['plateID', 'well', 'fieldID', 'object']] = df['filename'].str.split('_', expand=True)
2162    df['object'] = df['object'].str.replace('.png', '')
2163    
2164    def assign_condition(row):
2165        plate = int(row['plateID'])
2166        col = int(row['well'][1:])
2167        
2168        if col > 3:
2169            if plate in [1, 2, 3, 4]:
2170                return 'screen'
2171            elif plate in [5, 6, 7, 8]:
2172                return 'pc'
2173        elif col in [1, 2, 3]:
2174            return 'nc'
2175        else:
2176            return ''
2177
2178    df['cond'] = df.apply(assign_condition, axis=1)
2179    return df
2180
2181def initiate_counter(counter_, lock_):
2182    global counter, lock
2183    counter = counter_
2184    lock = lock_
2185
2186def add_images_to_tar(paths_chunk, tar_path, total_images):
2187    with tarfile.open(tar_path, 'w') as tar:
2188        for i, img_path in enumerate(paths_chunk):
2189            arcname = os.path.basename(img_path)
2190            try:
2191                tar.add(img_path, arcname=arcname)
2192                with lock:
2193                    counter.value += 1
2194                    if counter.value % 10 == 0:  # Print every 100 updates
2195                        #progress = (counter.value / total_images) * 100
2196                        #print(f"Progress: {counter.value}/{total_images} ({progress:.2f}%)", end='\r', file=sys.stdout, flush=True)
2197                        print_progress(counter.value, total_images, n_jobs=1, time_ls=None, batch_size=None, operation_type="generating .tar dataset")
2198            except FileNotFoundError:
2199                print(f"File not found: {img_path}")
2200
2201def generate_fraction_map(df, gene_column, min_frequency=0.0):
2202    df['fraction'] = df['count']/df['well_read_sum']
2203    genes = df[gene_column].unique().tolist()
2204    wells = df['prc'].unique().tolist()
2205    print(len(genes),len(wells))
2206    independent_variables = pd.DataFrame(columns=genes, index = wells)
2207    for index, row in df.iterrows():
2208        prc = row['prc']
2209        gene = row[gene_column]
2210        fraction = row['fraction']
2211        independent_variables.loc[prc,gene]=fraction
2212    independent_variables = independent_variables.dropna(axis=1, how='all')
2213    independent_variables = independent_variables.dropna(axis=0, how='all')
2214    independent_variables['sum'] = independent_variables.sum(axis=1)
2215    #sums = independent_variables['sum'].unique().tolist()
2216    #print(sums)
2217    #independent_variables = independent_variables[(independent_variables['sum'] == 0.0) | (independent_variables['sum'] == 1.0)]
2218    independent_variables = independent_variables.fillna(0.0)
2219    independent_variables = independent_variables.drop(columns=[col for col in independent_variables.columns if independent_variables[col].max() < min_frequency])
2220    independent_variables = independent_variables.drop('sum', axis=1)
2221    independent_variables.index.name = 'prc'
2222    loc = '/mnt/data/CellVoyager/20x/tsg101/crispr_screen/all/measurements/iv.csv'
2223    independent_variables.to_csv(loc, index=True, header=True, mode='w')
2224    return independent_variables
2225
2226def fishers_odds(df, threshold=0.5, phenotyp_col='mean_pred'):
2227    # Binning based on phenotype score (e.g., above 0.8 as high)
2228    df['high_phenotype'] = df[phenotyp_col] < threshold
2229
2230    results = []
2231    mutants = df.columns[:-2]
2232    mutants = [item for item in mutants if item not in ['count_prc','mean_pathogen_area']]
2233    print(f'fishers df')
2234    display(df)
2235    # Perform Fisher's exact test for each mutant
2236    for mutant in mutants:
2237        contingency_table = pd.crosstab(df[mutant] > 0, df['high_phenotype'])
2238        if contingency_table.shape == (2, 2):  # Check for 2x2 shape
2239            odds_ratio, p_value = fisher_exact(contingency_table)
2240            results.append((mutant, odds_ratio, p_value))
2241        else:
2242            # Optionally handle non-2x2 tables (e.g., append NaN or other placeholders)
2243            results.append((mutant, float('nan'), float('nan')))
2244    
2245    # Convert results to DataFrame for easier handling
2246    results_df = pd.DataFrame(results, columns=['Mutant', 'OddsRatio', 'PValue'])
2247    # Remove rows with undefined odds ratios or p-values
2248    filtered_results_df = results_df.dropna(subset=['OddsRatio', 'PValue'])
2249    
2250    pvalues = filtered_results_df['PValue'].values
2251
2252    # Check if pvalues array is empty
2253    if len(pvalues) > 0:
2254        # Apply Benjamini-Hochberg correction
2255        adjusted_pvalues = multipletests(pvalues, method='fdr_bh')[1]
2256        # Add adjusted p-values back to the dataframe
2257        filtered_results_df['AdjustedPValue'] = adjusted_pvalues
2258        # Filter significant results
2259        significant_mutants = filtered_results_df[filtered_results_df['AdjustedPValue'] < 0.05]
2260    else:
2261        print("No p-values to adjust. Check your data filtering steps.")
2262        significant_mutants = pd.DataFrame()  # return empty DataFrame in this case
2263    
2264    return filtered_results_df
2265
2266def model_metrics(model):
2267
2268    # Calculate additional metrics
2269    rmse = np.sqrt(model.mse_resid)
2270    mae = np.mean(np.abs(model.resid))
2271    durbin_w_value = durbin_watson(model.resid)
2272
2273    # Display the additional metrics
2274    print("\nAdditional Metrics:")
2275    print(f"Root Mean Squared Error (RMSE): {rmse}")
2276    print(f"Mean Absolute Error (MAE): {mae}")
2277    print(f"Durbin-Watson: {durbin_w_value}")
2278
2279    # Residual Plots
2280    fig, ax = plt.subplots(2, 2, figsize=(15, 12))
2281
2282    # Residual vs. Fitted
2283    ax[0, 0].scatter(model.fittedvalues, model.resid, edgecolors = 'k', facecolors = 'none')
2284    ax[0, 0].set_title('Residuals vs Fitted')
2285    ax[0, 0].set_xlabel('Fitted values')
2286    ax[0, 0].set_ylabel('Residuals')
2287
2288    # Histogram
2289    sns.histplot(model.resid, kde=True, ax=ax[0, 1])
2290    ax[0, 1].set_title('Histogram of Residuals')
2291    ax[0, 1].set_xlabel('Residuals')
2292
2293    # QQ Plot
2294    sm.qqplot(model.resid, fit=True, line='45', ax=ax[1, 0])
2295    ax[1, 0].set_title('QQ Plot')
2296
2297    # Scale-Location
2298    standardized_resid = model.get_influence().resid_studentized_internal
2299    ax[1, 1].scatter(model.fittedvalues, np.sqrt(np.abs(standardized_resid)), edgecolors = 'k', facecolors = 'none')
2300    ax[1, 1].set_title('Scale-Location')
2301    ax[1, 1].set_xlabel('Fitted values')
2302    ax[1, 1].set_ylabel('$\sqrt{|Standardized Residuals|}$')
2303
2304    plt.tight_layout()
2305    plt.show()
2306
2307def check_multicollinearity(x):
2308    """Checks multicollinearity of the predictors by computing the VIF."""
2309    vif_data = pd.DataFrame()
2310    vif_data["Variable"] = x.columns
2311    vif_data["VIF"] = [variance_inflation_factor(x.values, i) for i in range(x.shape[1])]
2312    return vif_data
2313
2314def lasso_reg(merged_df, alpha_value=0.01, reg_type='lasso'):
2315    # Separate predictors and response
2316    X = merged_df[['gene', 'grna', 'plateID', 'rowID', 'columnID']]
2317    y = merged_df['pred']
2318
2319    # One-hot encode the categorical predictors
2320    encoder = OneHotEncoder(drop='first')  # drop one category to avoid the dummy variable trap
2321    X_encoded = encoder.fit_transform(X).toarray()
2322    feature_names = encoder.get_feature_names_out(input_features=X.columns)
2323    
2324    if reg_type == 'ridge':
2325        # Fit ridge regression
2326        ridge = Ridge(alpha=alpha_value)
2327        ridge.fit(X_encoded, y)
2328        coefficients = ridge.coef_
2329        coeff_dict = dict(zip(feature_names, ridge.coef_))
2330        
2331    if reg_type == 'lasso':
2332        # Fit Lasso regression
2333        lasso = Lasso(alpha=alpha_value)
2334        lasso.fit(X_encoded, y)
2335        coefficients = lasso.coef_
2336        coeff_dict = dict(zip(feature_names, lasso.coef_))
2337    coeff_df = pd.DataFrame(list(coeff_dict.items()), columns=['Feature', 'Coefficient'])
2338    return coeff_df
2339
2340def MLR(merged_df, refine_model):
2341    
2342    from .plot import _reg_v_plot
2343    
2344    #model = smf.ols("pred ~ gene + grna + gene:grna + plate + row + column", merged_df).fit()
2345    model = smf.ols("pred ~ gene:grna + plate + row + column", merged_df).fit()
2346    # Display model metrics and summary
2347    model_metrics(model)
2348
2349    if refine_model:
2350        # Filter outliers
2351        std_resid = model.get_influence().resid_studentized_internal
2352        outliers_resid = np.where(np.abs(std_resid) > 3)[0]
2353        (c, p) = model.get_influence().cooks_distance
2354        outliers_cooks = np.where(c > 4/(len(merged_df)-merged_df.shape[1]-1))[0]
2355        outliers = reduce(np.union1d, (outliers_resid, outliers_cooks))
2356        merged_df_filtered = merged_df.drop(merged_df.index[outliers])
2357
2358        display(merged_df_filtered)
2359
2360        # Refit the model with filtered data
2361        model = smf.ols("pred ~ gene + grna + gene:grna + row + column", merged_df_filtered).fit()
2362        print("Number of outliers detected by standardized residuals:", len(outliers_resid))
2363        print("Number of outliers detected by Cook's distance:", len(outliers_cooks))
2364
2365        model_metrics(model)
2366        print(model.summary())
2367
2368    # Extract interaction coefficients and determine the maximum effect size
2369    interaction_coeffs = {key: val for key, val in model.params.items() if "gene[T." in key and ":grna[T." in key}
2370    interaction_pvalues = {key: val for key, val in model.pvalues.items() if "gene[T." in key and ":grna[T." in key}
2371
2372    max_effects = {}
2373    max_effects_pvalues = {}
2374    for key, val in interaction_coeffs.items():
2375        gene_name = key.split(":")[0].replace("gene[T.", "").replace("]", "")
2376        if gene_name not in max_effects or abs(max_effects[gene_name]) < abs(val):
2377            max_effects[gene_name] = val
2378            max_effects_pvalues[gene_name] = interaction_pvalues[key]
2379
2380    for key in max_effects:
2381        print(f"Key: {key}: {max_effects[key]}, p:{max_effects_pvalues[key]}")
2382
2383    df = pd.DataFrame([max_effects, max_effects_pvalues])
2384    df = df.transpose()
2385    df = df.rename(columns={df.columns[0]: 'effect', df.columns[1]: 'p'})
2386    df = df.sort_values(by=['effect', 'p'], ascending=[False, True])
2387
2388    _reg_v_plot(df)
2389    
2390    return max_effects, max_effects_pvalues, model, df
2391
2392def get_files_from_dir(dir_path, file_extension="*"):
2393    return glob(os.path.join(dir_path, file_extension))
2394    
2395def create_circular_mask(h, w, center=None, radius=None):
2396    if center is None:  # use the middle of the image
2397        center = (int(w/2), int(h/2))
2398    if radius is None:  # use the smallest distance between the center and image walls
2399        radius = min(center[0], center[1], w-center[0], h-center[1])
2400
2401    Y, X = np.ogrid[:h, :w]
2402    dist_from_center = np.sqrt((X - center[0])**2 + (Y-center[1])**2)
2403
2404    mask = dist_from_center <= radius
2405    return mask
2406    
2407def apply_mask(image, output_value=0):
2408    h, w = image.shape[:2]  # Assuming image is grayscale or RGB
2409    mask = create_circular_mask(h, w)
2410    
2411    # If the image has more than one channel, repeat the mask for each channel
2412    if len(image.shape) > 2:
2413        mask = np.repeat(mask[:, :, np.newaxis], image.shape[2], axis=2)
2414    
2415    # Apply the mask - set pixels outside of the mask to output_value
2416    masked_image = np.where(mask, image, output_value)
2417    return masked_image
2418    
2419def invert_image(image):
2420    # The maximum value depends on the image dtype (e.g., 255 for uint8)
2421    max_value = np.iinfo(image.dtype).max
2422    inverted_image = max_value - image
2423    return inverted_image  
2424
2425def resize_images_and_labels(images, labels, target_height, target_width, show_example=True):
2426    
2427    from .plot import plot_resize
2428    
2429    resized_images = []
2430    resized_labels = []
2431    if not images is None and not labels is None:
2432        for image, label in zip(images, labels):
2433
2434            if image.ndim == 2:
2435                image_shape = (target_height, target_width)
2436            elif image.ndim == 3:
2437                image_shape = (target_height, target_width, image.shape[-1])
2438                
2439            resized_image = resizescikit(image, image_shape, preserve_range=True, anti_aliasing=True).astype(image.dtype)
2440            resized_label = resizescikit(label, (target_height, target_width), order=0, preserve_range=True, anti_aliasing=False).astype(label.dtype)
2441            
2442            if resized_image.shape[-1] == 1:
2443                resized_image = np.squeeze(resized_image)
2444            
2445            resized_images.append(resized_image)
2446            resized_labels.append(resized_label)
2447    
2448    elif not images is None:
2449        for image in images:
2450        
2451            if image.ndim == 2:
2452                image_shape = (target_height, target_width)
2453            elif image.ndim == 3:
2454                image_shape = (target_height, target_width, image.shape[-1])
2455                
2456            resized_image = resizescikit(image, image_shape, preserve_range=True, anti_aliasing=True).astype(image.dtype)
2457            
2458            if resized_image.shape[-1] == 1:
2459                resized_image = np.squeeze(resized_image)
2460            
2461            resized_images.append(resized_image)
2462            
2463    elif not labels is None:
2464        for label in labels:
2465            resized_label = resizescikit(label, (target_height, target_width), order=0, preserve_range=True, anti_aliasing=False).astype(label.dtype)
2466            resized_labels.append(resized_label)
2467        
2468    if show_example:     
2469        if not images is None and not labels is None:
2470            plot_resize(images, resized_images, labels, resized_labels)
2471        elif not images is None:
2472            plot_resize(images, resized_images, images, resized_images)
2473        elif not labels is None:
2474            plot_resize(labels, resized_labels, labels, resized_labels)
2475    
2476    return resized_images, resized_labels
2477
2478def resize_labels_back(labels, orig_dims):
2479    resized_labels = []
2480
2481    if len(labels) != len(orig_dims):
2482        raise ValueError("The length of labels and orig_dims must match.")
2483
2484    for label, dims in zip(labels, orig_dims):
2485        # Ensure dims is a tuple of two integers (width, height)
2486        if not isinstance(dims, tuple) or len(dims) != 2:
2487            raise ValueError("Each element in orig_dims must be a tuple of two integers representing the original dimensions (width, height)")
2488
2489        resized_label = resizescikit(label, dims, order=0, preserve_range=True, anti_aliasing=False).astype(label.dtype)
2490        resized_labels.append(resized_label)
2491
2492    return resized_labels
2493
2494def calculate_iou(mask1, mask2):
2495    mask1, mask2 = pad_to_same_shape(mask1, mask2)
2496    intersection = np.logical_and(mask1, mask2).sum()
2497    union = np.logical_or(mask1, mask2).sum()
2498    return intersection / union if union != 0 else 0
2499    
2500def match_masks(true_masks, pred_masks, iou_threshold):
2501    matches = []
2502    matched_true_masks_indices = set()  # Use set to store indices of matched true masks
2503
2504    for pred_mask in pred_masks:
2505        for true_mask_index, true_mask in enumerate(true_masks):
2506            if true_mask_index not in matched_true_masks_indices:
2507                iou = calculate_iou(true_mask, pred_mask)
2508                if iou >= iou_threshold:
2509                    matches.append((true_mask, pred_mask))
2510                    matched_true_masks_indices.add(true_mask_index)  # Store the index of the matched true mask
2511                    break  # Move on to the next predicted mask
2512    return matches
2513    
2514def compute_average_precision(matches, num_true_masks, num_pred_masks):
2515    TP = len(matches)
2516    FP = num_pred_masks - TP
2517    FN = num_true_masks - TP
2518    precision = TP / (TP + FP) if TP + FP > 0 else 0
2519    recall = TP / (TP + FN) if TP + FN > 0 else 0
2520    return precision, recall
2521
2522def pad_to_same_shape(mask1, mask2):
2523    # Find the shape differences
2524    shape_diff = np.array([max(mask1.shape[0], mask2.shape[0]) - mask1.shape[0], 
2525                           max(mask1.shape[1], mask2.shape[1]) - mask1.shape[1]])
2526    pad_mask1 = ((0, shape_diff[0]), (0, shape_diff[1]))
2527    shape_diff = np.array([max(mask1.shape[0], mask2.shape[0]) - mask2.shape[0], 
2528                           max(mask1.shape[1], mask2.shape[1]) - mask2.shape[1]])
2529    pad_mask2 = ((0, shape_diff[0]), (0, shape_diff[1]))
2530    
2531    padded_mask1 = np.pad(mask1, pad_mask1, mode='constant', constant_values=0)
2532    padded_mask2 = np.pad(mask2, pad_mask2, mode='constant', constant_values=0)
2533    
2534    return padded_mask1, padded_mask2
2535    
2536def compute_ap_over_iou_thresholds(true_masks, pred_masks, iou_thresholds):
2537    precision_recall_pairs = []
2538    for iou_threshold in iou_thresholds:
2539        matches = match_masks(true_masks, pred_masks, iou_threshold)
2540        precision, recall = compute_average_precision(matches, len(true_masks), len(pred_masks))
2541        # Check that precision and recall are within the range [0, 1]
2542        if not 0 <= precision <= 1 or not 0 <= recall <= 1:
2543            raise ValueError(f'Precision or recall out of bounds. Precision: {precision}, Recall: {recall}')
2544        precision_recall_pairs.append((precision, recall))
2545
2546    # Sort by recall values
2547    precision_recall_pairs = sorted(precision_recall_pairs, key=lambda x: x[1])
2548    sorted_precisions = [p[0] for p in precision_recall_pairs]
2549    sorted_recalls = [p[1] for p in precision_recall_pairs]
2550    return np.trapz(sorted_precisions, x=sorted_recalls)
2551    
2552def compute_segmentation_ap(true_masks, pred_masks, iou_thresholds=np.linspace(0.5, 0.95, 10)):
2553    true_mask_labels = label(true_masks)
2554    pred_mask_labels = label(pred_masks)
2555    true_mask_regions = [region.image for region in regionprops(true_mask_labels)]
2556    pred_mask_regions = [region.image for region in regionprops(pred_mask_labels)]
2557    return compute_ap_over_iou_thresholds(true_mask_regions, pred_mask_regions, iou_thresholds)
2558
2559def jaccard_index(mask1, mask2):
2560    intersection = np.logical_and(mask1, mask2)
2561    union = np.logical_or(mask1, mask2)
2562    return np.sum(intersection) / np.sum(union)
2563
2564def dice_coefficient(mask1, mask2):
2565    # Convert to binary masks
2566    mask1 = np.where(mask1 > 0, 1, 0)
2567    mask2 = np.where(mask2 > 0, 1, 0)
2568
2569    # Calculate intersection and total
2570    intersection = np.sum(mask1 & mask2)
2571    total = np.sum(mask1) + np.sum(mask2)
2572    
2573    # Handle the case where both masks are empty
2574    if total == 0:
2575        return 1.0
2576    
2577    # Return the Dice coefficient
2578    return 2.0 * intersection / total
2579
2580def extract_boundaries(mask, dilation_radius=1):
2581    binary_mask = (mask > 0).astype(np.uint8)
2582    struct_elem = np.ones((dilation_radius*2+1, dilation_radius*2+1))
2583    dilated = morphology.binary_dilation(binary_mask, footprint=struct_elem)
2584    eroded = morphology.binary_erosion(binary_mask, footprint=struct_elem)
2585    boundary = dilated ^ eroded
2586    return boundary
2587
2588def boundary_f1_score(mask_true, mask_pred, dilation_radius=1):
2589    # Assume extract_boundaries is defined to extract object boundaries with given dilation_radius
2590    boundary_true = extract_boundaries(mask_true, dilation_radius)
2591    boundary_pred = extract_boundaries(mask_pred, dilation_radius)
2592    
2593    # Calculate intersection of boundaries
2594    intersection = np.logical_and(boundary_true, boundary_pred)
2595    
2596    # Calculate precision and recall for boundary detection
2597    precision = np.sum(intersection) / (np.sum(boundary_pred) + 1e-6)
2598    recall = np.sum(intersection) / (np.sum(boundary_true) + 1e-6)
2599    
2600    # Calculate F1 score as harmonic mean of precision and recall
2601    f1 = 2 * (precision * recall) / (precision + recall + 1e-6)
2602    
2603    return f1
2604
2605
2606
2607def _remove_noninfected(stack, cell_dim, nucleus_dim, pathogen_dim):
2608    """
2609    Remove non-infected cells from the stack based on the provided dimensions.
2610
2611    Args:
2612        stack (ndarray): The stack of images.
2613        cell_dim (int or None): The dimension index for the cell mask. If None, a zero-filled mask will be used.
2614        nucleus_dim (int or None): The dimension index for the nucleus mask. If None, a zero-filled mask will be used.
2615        pathogen_dim (int or None): The dimension index for the pathogen mask. If None, a zero-filled mask will be used.
2616
2617    Returns:
2618        ndarray: The updated stack with non-infected cells removed.
2619    """
2620    if not cell_dim is None:
2621        cell_mask = stack[:, :, cell_dim]
2622    else:
2623        cell_mask = np.zeros_like(stack)
2624    if not nucleus_dim is None:
2625        nucleus_mask = stack[:, :, nucleus_dim]
2626    else:
2627        nucleus_mask = np.zeros_like(stack)
2628
2629    if not pathogen_dim is None:
2630        pathogen_mask = stack[:, :, pathogen_dim]
2631    else:
2632        pathogen_mask = np.zeros_like(stack)
2633
2634    for cell_label in np.unique(cell_mask)[1:]:
2635        cell_region = cell_mask == cell_label
2636        labels_in_cell = np.unique(pathogen_mask[cell_region])
2637        if len(labels_in_cell) <= 1:
2638            cell_mask[cell_region] = 0
2639            nucleus_mask[cell_region] = 0
2640    if not cell_dim is None:
2641        stack[:, :, cell_dim] = cell_mask
2642    if not nucleus_dim is None:
2643        stack[:, :, nucleus_dim] = nucleus_mask
2644    return stack
2645
2646def _remove_outside_objects(stack, cell_dim, nucleus_dim, pathogen_dim):
2647    """
2648    Remove outside objects from the stack based on the provided dimensions.
2649
2650    Args:
2651        stack (ndarray): The stack of images.
2652        cell_dim (int): The dimension index of the cell mask in the stack.
2653        nucleus_dim (int): The dimension index of the nucleus mask in the stack.
2654        pathogen_dim (int): The dimension index of the pathogen mask in the stack.
2655
2656    Returns:
2657        ndarray: The updated stack with outside objects removed.
2658    """
2659    if not cell_dim is None:
2660        cell_mask = stack[:, :, cell_dim]
2661    else:
2662        return stack
2663    nucleus_mask = stack[:, :, nucleus_dim]
2664    pathogen_mask = stack[:, :, pathogen_dim]
2665    pathogen_labels = np.unique(pathogen_mask)[1:]
2666    for pathogen_label in pathogen_labels:
2667        pathogen_region = pathogen_mask == pathogen_label
2668        cell_in_pathogen_region = np.unique(cell_mask[pathogen_region])
2669        cell_in_pathogen_region = cell_in_pathogen_region[cell_in_pathogen_region != 0]  # Exclude background
2670        if len(cell_in_pathogen_region) == 0:
2671            pathogen_mask[pathogen_region] = 0
2672            corresponding_nucleus_region = nucleus_mask == pathogen_label
2673            nucleus_mask[corresponding_nucleus_region] = 0
2674    stack[:, :, cell_dim] = cell_mask
2675    stack[:, :, nucleus_dim] = nucleus_mask
2676    stack[:, :, pathogen_dim] = pathogen_mask
2677    return stack
2678
2679def _remove_multiobject_cells(stack, mask_dim, cell_dim, nucleus_dim, pathogen_dim, object_dim):
2680    """
2681    Remove multi-object cells from the stack.
2682
2683    Args:
2684        stack (ndarray): The stack of images.
2685        mask_dim (int): The dimension of the mask in the stack.
2686        cell_dim (int): The dimension of the cell in the stack.
2687        nucleus_dim (int): The dimension of the nucleus in the stack.
2688        pathogen_dim (int): The dimension of the pathogen in the stack.
2689        object_dim (int): The dimension of the object in the stack.
2690
2691    Returns:
2692        ndarray: The updated stack with multi-object cells removed.
2693    """
2694    cell_mask = stack[:, :, mask_dim]
2695    nucleus_mask = stack[:, :, nucleus_dim]
2696    pathogen_mask = stack[:, :, pathogen_dim]
2697    object_mask = stack[:, :, object_dim]
2698
2699    for cell_label in np.unique(cell_mask)[1:]:
2700        cell_region = cell_mask == cell_label
2701        labels_in_cell = np.unique(object_mask[cell_region])
2702        if len(labels_in_cell) > 2:
2703            cell_mask[cell_region] = 0
2704            nucleus_mask[cell_region] = 0
2705            for pathogen_label in labels_in_cell[1:]:  # Skip the first label (0)
2706                pathogen_mask[pathogen_mask == pathogen_label] = 0
2707
2708    stack[:, :, cell_dim] = cell_mask
2709    stack[:, :, nucleus_dim] = nucleus_mask
2710    stack[:, :, pathogen_dim] = pathogen_mask
2711    return stack
2712    
2713def merge_touching_objects(mask, threshold=0.25):
2714    """
2715    Merges touching objects in a binary mask based on the percentage of their shared boundary.
2716
2717    Args:
2718        mask (ndarray): Binary mask representing objects.
2719        threshold (float, optional): Threshold value for merging objects. Defaults to 0.25.
2720
2721    Returns:
2722        ndarray: Merged mask.
2723
2724    """
2725    perimeters = {}
2726    labels = np.unique(mask)
2727    # Calculating perimeter of each object
2728    for label in labels:
2729        if label != 0:  # Ignore background
2730            edges = morphology.erosion(mask == label) ^ (mask == label)
2731            perimeters[label] = np.sum(edges)
2732    # Detect touching objects and find the shared boundary
2733    shared_perimeters = {}
2734    dilated = morphology.dilation(mask > 0)
2735    for label in labels:
2736        if label != 0:  # Ignore background
2737            # Find the objects that this object is touching
2738            dilated_label = morphology.dilation(mask == label)
2739            touching_labels = np.unique(mask[dilated & (dilated_label != 0) & (mask != 0)])
2740            for touching_label in touching_labels:
2741                if touching_label != label:  # Exclude the object itself
2742                    shared_boundary = dilated_label & morphology.dilation(mask == touching_label)
2743                    shared_perimeters[(label, touching_label)] = np.sum(shared_boundary)
2744    # Merge objects if more than 25% of their boundary is touching
2745    for (label1, label2), shared_perimeter in shared_perimeters.items():
2746        if shared_perimeter > threshold * min(perimeters[label1], perimeters[label2]):
2747            mask[mask == label2] = label1  # Merge label2 into label1
2748    return mask
2749    
2750def remove_intensity_objects(image, mask, intensity_threshold, mode):
2751    """
2752    Removes objects from the mask based on their mean intensity in the original image.
2753
2754    Args:
2755        image (ndarray): The original image.
2756        mask (ndarray): The mask containing labeled objects.
2757        intensity_threshold (float): The threshold value for mean intensity.
2758        mode (str): The mode for intensity comparison. Can be 'low' or 'high'.
2759
2760    Returns:
2761        ndarray: The updated mask with objects removed.
2762
2763    """
2764    # Calculate the mean intensity of each object in the original image
2765    props = regionprops_table(mask, image, properties=('label', 'mean_intensity'))
2766    # Find the labels of the objects with mean intensity below the threshold
2767    if mode == 'low':
2768        labels_to_remove = props['label'][props['mean_intensity'] < intensity_threshold]
2769    if mode == 'high':
2770        labels_to_remove = props['label'][props['mean_intensity'] > intensity_threshold]
2771    # Remove these objects from the mask
2772    mask[np.isin(mask, labels_to_remove)] = 0
2773    return mask
2774    
2775def _filter_closest_to_stat(df, column, n_rows, use_median=False):
2776    """
2777    Filter the DataFrame to include the closest rows to a statistical measure.
2778
2779    Args:
2780        df (pandas.DataFrame): The input DataFrame.
2781        column (str): The column name to calculate the statistical measure.
2782        n_rows (int): The number of closest rows to include in the result.
2783        use_median (bool, optional): Whether to use the median or mean as the statistical measure. 
2784            Defaults to False (mean).
2785
2786    Returns:
2787        pandas.DataFrame: The filtered DataFrame with the closest rows to the statistical measure.
2788    """
2789    if use_median:
2790        target_value = df[column].median()
2791    else:
2792        target_value = df[column].mean()
2793    df['diff'] = (df[column] - target_value).abs()
2794    result_df = df.sort_values(by='diff').head(n_rows)
2795    result_df = result_df.drop(columns=['diff'])
2796    return result_df
2797    
2798def _find_similar_sized_images(file_list):
2799    """
2800    Find the largest group of images with the most similar size and shape.
2801
2802    Args:
2803        file_list (list): List of file paths to the images.
2804
2805    Returns:
2806        list: List of file paths belonging to the largest group of images with the most similar size and shape.
2807    """
2808    # Dictionary to hold image sizes and their paths
2809    size_to_paths = defaultdict(list)
2810    # Iterate over image paths to get their dimensions
2811    for path in file_list:
2812        img = cv2.imread(path, cv2.IMREAD_UNCHANGED)  # Read with unchanged color space to support different image types
2813        if img is not None:
2814            # Find indices where the image is not padded (non-zero)
2815            if img.ndim == 3:  # Color image
2816                mask = np.any(img != 0, axis=2)
2817            else:  # Grayscale image
2818                mask = img != 0
2819            # Find the bounding box of non-zero regions
2820            coords = np.argwhere(mask)
2821            if coords.size == 0:  # Skip images that are completely padded
2822                continue
2823            y0, x0 = coords.min(axis=0)
2824            y1, x1 = coords.max(axis=0) + 1  # Add 1 because slice end index is exclusive
2825            # Crop the image to remove padding
2826            cropped_img = img[y0:y1, x0:x1]
2827            # Get dimensions of the cropped image
2828            height, width = cropped_img.shape[:2]
2829            aspect_ratio = width / height
2830            size_key = (width, height, round(aspect_ratio, 2))  # Group by width, height, and aspect ratio
2831            size_to_paths[size_key].append(path)
2832    # Find the largest group of images with the most similar size and shape
2833    largest_group = max(size_to_paths.values(), key=len)
2834    return largest_group
2835    
2836def _relabel_parent_with_child_labels(parent_mask, child_mask):
2837    """
2838    Relabels the parent mask based on overlapping child labels.
2839
2840    Args:
2841        parent_mask (ndarray): Binary mask representing the parent objects.
2842        child_mask (ndarray): Binary mask representing the child objects.
2843
2844    Returns:
2845        tuple: A tuple containing the relabeled parent mask and the original child mask.
2846
2847    """
2848    # Label parent mask to identify unique objects
2849    parent_labels = label(parent_mask, background=0)
2850    # Use the original child mask labels directly, without relabeling
2851    child_labels = child_mask
2852
2853    # Create a new parent mask for updated labels
2854    parent_mask_new = np.zeros_like(parent_mask)
2855
2856    # Directly relabel parent cells based on overlapping child labels
2857    unique_child_labels = np.unique(child_labels)[1:]  # Skip background
2858    for child_label in unique_child_labels:
2859        child_area_mask = (child_labels == child_label)
2860        overlapping_parent_label = np.unique(parent_labels[child_area_mask])
2861
2862        # Since each parent is assumed to overlap with exactly one nucleus,
2863        # directly set the parent label to the child label where overlap occurs
2864        for parent_label in overlapping_parent_label:
2865            if parent_label != 0:  # Skip background
2866                parent_mask_new[parent_labels == parent_label] = child_label
2867
2868    # For cells containing multiple nucleus, standardize all nucleus to the first label
2869    # This will be done only if needed, as per your condition
2870    for parent_label in np.unique(parent_mask_new)[1:]:  # Skip background
2871        parent_area_mask = (parent_mask_new == parent_label)
2872        child_labels_in_parent = np.unique(child_mask[parent_area_mask])
2873        child_labels_in_parent = child_labels_in_parent[child_labels_in_parent != 0]  # Exclude background
2874
2875        if len(child_labels_in_parent) > 1:
2876            # Standardize to the first child label within this parent
2877            first_child_label = child_labels_in_parent[0]
2878            for child_label in child_labels_in_parent:
2879                child_mask[child_mask == child_label] = first_child_label
2880
2881    return parent_mask_new, child_mask
2882    
2883def _exclude_objects(cell_mask, nucleus_mask, pathogen_mask, cytoplasm_mask, uninfected=True):
2884    """
2885    Exclude objects from the masks based on certain criteria.
2886
2887    Args:
2888        cell_mask (ndarray): Mask representing cells.
2889        nucleus_mask (ndarray): Mask representing nucleus.
2890        pathogen_mask (ndarray): Mask representing pathogens.
2891        cytoplasm_mask (ndarray): Mask representing cytoplasm.
2892        uninfected (bool, optional): Whether to include uninfected cells. Defaults to True.
2893
2894    Returns:
2895        tuple: A tuple containing the filtered cell mask, nucleus mask, pathogen mask, and cytoplasm mask.
2896    """
2897    # Remove cells with no nucleus or cytoplasm (or pathogen)
2898    filtered_cells = np.zeros_like(cell_mask) # Initialize a new mask to store the filtered cells.
2899    for cell_label in np.unique(cell_mask): # Iterate over all cell labels in the cell mask.
2900        if cell_label == 0: # Skip background
2901            continue
2902        cell_region = cell_mask == cell_label # Get a mask for the current cell.
2903        # Check existence of nucleus, cytoplasm and pathogen in the current cell.
2904        has_nucleus = np.any(nucleus_mask[cell_region])
2905        has_cytoplasm = np.any(cytoplasm_mask[cell_region])
2906        has_pathogen = np.any(pathogen_mask[cell_region])
2907        if uninfected:
2908            if has_nucleus and has_cytoplasm:
2909                filtered_cells[cell_region] = cell_label
2910        else:
2911            if has_nucleus and has_cytoplasm and has_pathogen:
2912                filtered_cells[cell_region] = cell_label
2913    # Remove objects outside of cells
2914    nucleus_mask = nucleus_mask * (filtered_cells > 0)
2915    pathogen_mask = pathogen_mask * (filtered_cells > 0)
2916    cytoplasm_mask = cytoplasm_mask * (filtered_cells > 0)
2917    return filtered_cells, nucleus_mask, pathogen_mask, cytoplasm_mask
2918
2919def _merge_overlapping_objects(mask1, mask2):
2920    """
2921    Merge overlapping objects in two masks.
2922
2923    Args:
2924        mask1 (ndarray): First mask.
2925        mask2 (ndarray): Second mask.
2926
2927    Returns:
2928        tuple: A tuple containing the merged masks (mask1, mask2).
2929    """
2930    labeled_1 = label(mask1)
2931    num_1 = np.max(labeled_1)
2932    for m1_id in range(1, num_1 + 1):
2933        current_1_mask = labeled_1 == m1_id
2934        overlapping_2_labels = np.unique(mask2[current_1_mask])
2935        overlapping_2_labels = overlapping_2_labels[overlapping_2_labels != 0]
2936        if len(overlapping_2_labels) > 1:
2937            overlap_percentages = [np.sum(current_1_mask & (mask2 == m2_label)) / np.sum(current_1_mask) * 100 for m2_label in overlapping_2_labels]
2938            max_overlap_label = overlapping_2_labels[np.argmax(overlap_percentages)]
2939            max_overlap_percentage = max(overlap_percentages)
2940            if max_overlap_percentage >= 90:
2941                for m2_label in overlapping_2_labels:
2942                    if m2_label != max_overlap_label:
2943                        mask1[(current_1_mask) & (mask2 == m2_label)] = 0
2944            else:
2945                for m2_label in overlapping_2_labels[1:]:
2946                    mask2[mask2 == m2_label] = overlapping_2_labels[0]
2947    return mask1, mask2
2948
2949def _filter_object(mask, min_value):
2950    """
2951    Filter objects in a mask based on their frequency.
2952
2953    Args:
2954        mask (ndarray): The input mask.
2955        min_value (int): The minimum frequency threshold.
2956
2957    Returns:
2958        ndarray: The filtered mask.
2959    """
2960    count = np.bincount(mask.ravel())
2961    to_remove = np.where(count < min_value)
2962    mask[np.isin(mask, to_remove)] = 0
2963    return mask
2964
2965def _filter_cp_masks(masks, flows, filter_size, filter_intensity, minimum_size, maximum_size, remove_border_objects, merge, batch, plot, figuresize):
2966    
2967    """
2968    Filter the masks based on various criteria such as size, border objects, merging, and intensity.
2969
2970    Args:
2971        masks (list): List of masks.
2972        flows (list): List of flows.
2973        filter_size (bool): Flag indicating whether to filter based on size.
2974        filter_intensity (bool): Flag indicating whether to filter based on intensity.
2975        minimum_size (int): Minimum size of objects to keep.
2976        maximum_size (int): Maximum size of objects to keep.
2977        remove_border_objects (bool): Flag indicating whether to remove border objects.
2978        merge (bool): Flag indicating whether to merge adjacent objects.
2979        batch (ndarray): Batch of images.
2980        plot (bool): Flag indicating whether to plot the masks.
2981        figuresize (tuple): Size of the figure.
2982
2983    Returns:
2984        list: List of filtered masks.
2985    """
2986    
2987    from .plot import plot_masks
2988    
2989    mask_stack = []
2990    for idx, (mask, flow, image) in enumerate(zip(masks, flows[0], batch)):
2991        
2992        if plot and idx == 0:
2993            num_objects = mask_object_count(mask)
2994            print(f'Number of objects before filtration: {num_objects}')
2995            plot_masks(batch=image, masks=mask, flows=flow, cmap='inferno', figuresize=figuresize, nr=1, file_type='.npz', print_object_number=True)
2996
2997        if merge:
2998            mask = merge_touching_objects(mask, threshold=0.66)
2999            if plot and idx == 0:
3000                num_objects = mask_object_count(mask)
3001                print(f'Number of objects after merging adjacent objects, : {num_objects}')
3002                plot_masks(batch=image, masks=mask, flows=flow, cmap='inferno', figuresize=figuresize, nr=1, file_type='.npz', print_object_number=True)
3003
3004        if filter_size:
3005            props = measure.regionprops_table(mask, properties=['label', 'area'])
3006            valid_labels = props['label'][np.logical_and(props['area'] > minimum_size, props['area'] < maximum_size)] 
3007            mask = np.isin(mask, valid_labels) * mask
3008            if plot and idx == 0:
3009                num_objects = mask_object_count(mask)
3010                print(f'Number of objects after size filtration >{minimum_size} and <{maximum_size} : {num_objects}')
3011                plot_masks(batch=image, masks=mask, flows=flow, cmap='inferno', figuresize=figuresize, nr=1, file_type='.npz', print_object_number=True)
3012
3013        if filter_intensity:
3014            intensity_image = image[:, :, 1]  
3015            props = measure.regionprops_table(mask, intensity_image=intensity_image, properties=['label', 'mean_intensity'])
3016            mean_intensities = np.array(props['mean_intensity']).reshape(-1, 1)
3017
3018            if mean_intensities.shape[0] >= 2:
3019                kmeans = KMeans(n_clusters=2, random_state=0).fit(mean_intensities)
3020                centroids = kmeans.cluster_centers_
3021            
3022                # Calculate the Euclidean distance between the two centroids
3023                dist_between_centroids = distance.euclidean(centroids[0], centroids[1])
3024                
3025                # Set a threshold for the minimum distance to consider clusters distinct
3026                distance_threshold = 0.25 
3027                
3028                if dist_between_centroids > distance_threshold:
3029                    high_intensity_cluster = np.argmax(centroids)
3030                    valid_labels = np.array(props['label'])[kmeans.labels_ == high_intensity_cluster]
3031                    mask = np.isin(mask, valid_labels) * mask
3032
3033            if plot and idx == 0:
3034                num_objects = mask_object_count(mask)
3035                props_after = measure.regionprops_table(mask, intensity_image=intensity_image, properties=['label', 'mean_intensity'])
3036                mean_intensities_after = np.mean(np.array(props_after['mean_intensity']))
3037                average_intensity_before = np.mean(mean_intensities)
3038                print(f'Number of objects after potential intensity clustering: {num_objects}. Mean intensity before:{average_intensity_before:.4f}. After:{mean_intensities_after:.4f}.')
3039                plot_masks(batch=image, masks=mask, flows=flow, cmap='inferno', figuresize=figuresize, nr=1, file_type='.npz', print_object_number=True)
3040
3041
3042        if remove_border_objects:
3043            mask = clear_border(mask)
3044            if plot and idx == 0:
3045                num_objects = mask_object_count(mask)
3046                print(f'Number of objects after removing border objects, : {num_objects}')
3047                plot_masks(batch=image, masks=mask, flows=flow, cmap='inferno', figuresize=figuresize, nr=1, file_type='.npz', print_object_number=True)
3048        
3049        mask_stack.append(mask)
3050
3051    return mask_stack
3052    
3053def _object_filter(df, object_type, size_range, intensity_range, mask_chans, mask_chan):
3054    """
3055    Filter the DataFrame based on object type, size range, and intensity range.
3056
3057    Args:
3058        df (pandas.DataFrame): The DataFrame to filter.
3059        object_type (str): The type of object to filter.
3060        size_range (list or None): The range of object sizes to filter.
3061        intensity_range (list or None): The range of object intensities to filter.
3062        mask_chans (list): The list of mask channels.
3063        mask_chan (int): The index of the mask channel to use.
3064
3065    Returns:
3066        pandas.DataFrame: The filtered DataFrame.
3067    """
3068    if not size_range is None:
3069        if isinstance(size_range, list):
3070            if isinstance(size_range[0], int): 
3071                df = df[df[f'{object_type}_area'] > size_range[0]]
3072                print(f'After {object_type} minimum area filter: {len(df)}')
3073            if isinstance(size_range[1], int):
3074                df = df[df[f'{object_type}_area'] < size_range[1]]
3075                print(f'After {object_type} maximum area filter: {len(df)}')
3076    if not intensity_range is None:
3077        if isinstance(intensity_range, list):
3078            if isinstance(intensity_range[0], int):
3079                df = df[df[f'{object_type}_channel_{mask_chans[mask_chan]}_mean_intensity'] > intensity_range[0]]
3080                print(f'After {object_type} minimum mean intensity filter: {len(df)}')
3081            if isinstance(intensity_range[1], int):
3082                df = df[df[f'{object_type}_channel_{mask_chans[mask_chan]}_mean_intensity'] < intensity_range[1]]
3083                print(f'After {object_type} maximum mean intensity filter: {len(df)}')
3084    return df
3085
3086def _get_regex(metadata_type, img_format, custom_regex=None):
3087
3088    if img_format == None:
3089        img_format == '.tif'
3090    if metadata_type == 'cellvoyager':
3091        regex = f'(?P<plateID>.*)_(?P<wellID>.*)_T(?P<timeID>.*)F(?P<fieldID>.*)L(?P<laserID>..)A(?P<AID>..)Z(?P<sliceID>.*)C(?P<chanID>.*){img_format}'
3092    elif metadata_type == 'cq1':
3093        regex = f'W(?P<wellID>.*)F(?P<fieldID>.*)T(?P<timeID>.*)Z(?P<sliceID>.*)C(?P<chanID>.*){img_format}'
3094    elif metadata_type == 'auto':
3095        regex = f'(?P<plateID>.*)_(?P<wellID>.*)_T(?P<timeID>.*)F(?P<fieldID>.*)L(?P<laserID>.*)C(?P<chanID>.*).tif'     
3096    elif metadata_type == 'custom':
3097        regex = f'({custom_regex}){img_format}'
3098        
3099    print(f'regex mode:{metadata_type} regex:{regex}')
3100    return regex
3101
3102def _run_test_mode(src, regex, timelapse=False, test_images=10, random_test=True):
3103    
3104    if timelapse:
3105        test_images = 1  # Use only 1 set for timelapse to ensure full sequence inclusion
3106    
3107    test_folder_path = os.path.join(src, 'test')
3108    os.makedirs(test_folder_path, exist_ok=True)
3109    regular_expression = re.compile(regex)
3110
3111    if os.path.exists(os.path.join(src, 'orig')):
3112        src = os.path.join(src, 'orig')
3113        
3114    all_filenames = [filename for filename in os.listdir(src) if regular_expression.match(filename)]
3115    print(f'Found {len(all_filenames)} files')
3116    images_by_set = defaultdict(list)
3117
3118    for filename in all_filenames:
3119        match = regular_expression.match(filename)
3120        if match:
3121            plate = match.group('plateID') if 'plateID' in match.groupdict() else os.path.basename(src)
3122            well = match.group('wellID')
3123            field = match.group('fieldID')
3124            set_identifier = (plate, well, field)
3125            images_by_set[set_identifier].append(filename)
3126    
3127    # Prepare for random selection
3128    set_identifiers = list(images_by_set.keys())
3129    if random_test:
3130        random.seed(42)
3131    random.shuffle(set_identifiers)  # Randomize the order
3132    
3133    # Select a subset based on the test_images count
3134    selected_sets = set_identifiers[:test_images]
3135
3136    # Print information about the number of sets used
3137    print(f'Using {len(selected_sets)} random image set(s) for test model')
3138
3139    # Copy files for selected sets to the test folder
3140    for set_identifier in selected_sets:
3141        for filename in images_by_set[set_identifier]:
3142            shutil.copy(os.path.join(src, filename), test_folder_path)
3143
3144    return test_folder_path
3145
3146def _choose_model(model_name, device, object_type='cell', restore_type=None, object_settings={}):
3147    
3148    if object_type == 'pathogen':
3149        if model_name == 'toxo_pv_lumen':
3150            diameter = object_settings['diameter']
3151            current_dir = os.path.dirname(__file__)
3152            model_path = os.path.join(current_dir, 'models', 'cp', 'toxo_pv_lumen.CP_model')
3153            print(model_path)
3154            model = cp_models.CellposeModel(gpu=torch.cuda.is_available(), model_type=None, pretrained_model=model_path, diam_mean=diameter, device=device)
3155            print(f'Using Toxoplasma PV lumen model to generate pathogen masks')
3156            return model
3157    
3158    restore_list = ['denoise', 'deblur', 'upsample', None]
3159    if restore_type not in restore_list:
3160        print(f"Invalid restore type. Choose from {restore_list} defaulting to None")
3161        restore_type = None
3162
3163    if restore_type == None:
3164        if model_name in ['cyto', 'cyto2', 'cyto3', 'nuclei']:
3165            model = cp_models.Cellpose(gpu=torch.cuda.is_available(), model_type=model_name, device=device)
3166            return model
3167    else:
3168        if object_type == 'nucleus':
3169            restore = f'{type}_nuclei'
3170            model = denoise.CellposeDenoiseModel(gpu=torch.cuda.is_available(), model_type="nuclei",restore_type=restore, chan2_restore=False, device=device)
3171            return model
3172
3173        else:
3174            restore = f'{type}_cyto3'
3175            if model_name =='cyto2':
3176                chan2_restore = True
3177            if model_name =='cyto':
3178                chan2_restore = False
3179            model = denoise.CellposeDenoiseModel(gpu=torch.cuda.is_available(), model_type="cyto3",restore_type=restore, chan2_restore=chan2_restore, device=device)
3180            return model
3181
3182class SelectChannels:
3183    def __init__(self, channels):
3184        self.channels = channels
3185    
3186    def __call__(self, img):
3187        img = img.clone()
3188        if 1 not in self.channels:
3189            img[0, :, :] = 0  # Zero out the red channel
3190        if 2 not in self.channels:
3191            img[1, :, :] = 0  # Zero out the green channel
3192        if 3 not in self.channels:
3193            img[2, :, :] = 0  # Zero out the blue channel
3194        return img
3195    
3196def preprocess_image(image_path, image_size=224, channels=[1,2,3], normalize=True):
3197
3198    if normalize:
3199        transform = transforms.Compose([
3200            transforms.ToTensor(),
3201            transforms.CenterCrop(size=(image_size, image_size)),
3202            SelectChannels(channels),
3203            transforms.Normalize(mean=(0.5, 0.5, 0.5), std=(0.5, 0.5, 0.5))])
3204    else:
3205        transform = transforms.Compose([
3206            transforms.ToTensor(),
3207            transforms.CenterCrop(size=(image_size, image_size)),
3208            SelectChannels(channels)])
3209
3210    image = Image.open(image_path).convert('RGB')
3211    input_tensor = transform(image).unsqueeze(0)
3212    return image, input_tensor
3213
3214class SaliencyMapGenerator:
3215    def __init__(self, model):
3216        self.model = model
3217
3218    def compute_saliency_maps(self, X, y):
3219        self.model.eval()
3220        X.requires_grad_()
3221
3222        # Forward pass
3223        scores = self.model(X).squeeze()
3224
3225        # For binary classification, target scores can be the single output
3226        target_scores = scores * (2 * y - 1)
3227
3228        self.model.zero_grad()
3229        target_scores.backward(torch.ones_like(target_scores))
3230
3231        saliency = X.grad.abs()
3232        return saliency
3233
3234    def compute_saliency_and_predictions(self, X):
3235        self.model.eval()
3236        X.requires_grad_()
3237
3238        # Forward pass to get predictions (logits)
3239        scores = self.model(X).squeeze()
3240
3241        # Get predicted class (0 or 1 for binary classification)
3242        predictions = (scores > 0).long()
3243
3244        # Compute saliency maps
3245        self.model.zero_grad()
3246        target_scores = scores * (2 * predictions - 1)
3247        target_scores.backward(torch.ones_like(target_scores))
3248
3249        saliency = X.grad.abs()
3250
3251        return saliency, predictions
3252
3253    def plot_activation_grid(self, X, saliency, predictions, overlay=True, normalize=False):
3254        N = X.shape[0]
3255        rows = (N + 7) // 8 
3256        fig, axs = plt.subplots(rows, 8, figsize=(16, rows * 2))
3257
3258        for i in range(N):
3259            ax = axs[i // 8, i % 8]
3260            saliency_map = saliency[i].cpu().numpy()  # Move to CPU and convert to numpy
3261
3262            if saliency_map.shape[0] == 3:  # Channels first, reshape to (H, W, 3)
3263                saliency_map = np.transpose(saliency_map, (1, 2, 0))
3264
3265            # Normalize image channels to 2nd and 98th percentiles
3266            if overlay:
3267                img_np = X[i].permute(1, 2, 0).detach().cpu().numpy()
3268                if normalize:
3269                    img_np = self.percentile_normalize(img_np)
3270                ax.imshow(img_np)
3271                ax.imshow(saliency_map, cmap='jet', alpha=0.5)
3272
3273            # Add class label in the top-left corner
3274            ax.text(5, 25, str(predictions[i].item()), fontsize=12, color='white', weight='bold',
3275                    bbox=dict(facecolor='black', alpha=0.7, boxstyle='round,pad=0.2'))
3276            ax.axis('off')
3277
3278        plt.tight_layout(pad=0)
3279        return fig
3280    
3281    def percentile_normalize(self, img, lower_percentile=2, upper_percentile=98):
3282        img_normalized = np.zeros_like(img)
3283
3284        for c in range(img.shape[2]):  # Iterate over each channel
3285            low = np.percentile(img[:, :, c], lower_percentile)
3286            high = np.percentile(img[:, :, c], upper_percentile)
3287            img_normalized[:, :, c] = np.clip((img[:, :, c] - low) / (high - low), 0, 1)
3288
3289        return img_normalized
3290
3291class GradCAMGenerator:
3292    def __init__(self, model, target_layer, cam_type='gradcam'):
3293        self.model = model
3294        self.model.eval()
3295        self.target_layer = target_layer
3296        self.cam_type = cam_type
3297        self.gradients = None
3298        self.activations = None
3299
3300        # Hook the target layer
3301        self.target_layer_module = self.get_layer(self.model, self.target_layer)
3302        self.hook_layers()
3303
3304    def hook_layers(self):
3305        # Forward hook to get activations
3306        def forward_hook(module, input, output):
3307            self.activations = output
3308
3309        # Backward hook to get gradients
3310        def backward_hook(module, grad_input, grad_output):
3311            self.gradients = grad_output[0]
3312
3313        self.target_layer_module.register_forward_hook(forward_hook)
3314        self.target_layer_module.register_backward_hook(backward_hook)
3315
3316    def get_layer(self, model, target_layer):
3317        # Recursively find the layer specified in target_layer
3318        modules = target_layer.split('.')
3319        layer = model
3320        for module in modules:
3321            layer = getattr(layer, module)
3322        return layer
3323
3324    def compute_gradcam_maps(self, X, y):
3325        X.requires_grad_()
3326
3327        # Forward pass
3328        scores = self.model(X).squeeze()
3329
3330        # Perform backward pass
3331        target_scores = scores * (2 * y - 1)
3332        self.model.zero_grad()
3333        target_scores.backward(torch.ones_like(target_scores))
3334
3335        # Compute GradCAM
3336        pooled_gradients = torch.mean(self.gradients, dim=[0, 2, 3])
3337        for i in range(self.activations.size(1)):
3338            self.activations[:, i, :, :] *= pooled_gradients[i]
3339
3340        gradcam = torch.mean(self.activations, dim=1).squeeze()
3341        gradcam = F.relu(gradcam)
3342        gradcam = F.interpolate(gradcam.unsqueeze(0).unsqueeze(0), size=X.shape[2:], mode='bilinear')
3343        gradcam = gradcam.squeeze().cpu().detach().numpy()
3344        gradcam = (gradcam - gradcam.min()) / (gradcam.max() - gradcam.min())
3345
3346        return gradcam
3347
3348    def compute_gradcam_and_predictions(self, X):
3349        self.model.eval()
3350        X.requires_grad_()
3351
3352        # Forward pass to get predictions (logits)
3353        scores = self.model(X).squeeze()
3354
3355        # Get predicted class (0 or 1 for binary classification)
3356        predictions = (scores > 0).long()
3357
3358        # Compute gradcam maps
3359        gradcam_maps = []
3360        for i in range(X.size(0)):
3361            gradcam_map = self.compute_gradcam_maps(X[i].unsqueeze(0), predictions[i])
3362            gradcam_maps.append(gradcam_map)
3363
3364        return torch.tensor(gradcam_maps), predictions
3365
3366    def plot_activation_grid(self, X, gradcam, predictions, overlay=True, normalize=False):
3367        N = X.shape[0]
3368        rows = (N + 7) // 8
3369        fig, axs = plt.subplots(rows, 8, figsize=(16, rows * 2))
3370
3371        for i in range(N):
3372            ax = axs[i // 8, i % 8]
3373            gradcam_map = gradcam[i].cpu().numpy()
3374
3375            # Normalize image channels to 2nd and 98th percentiles
3376            if overlay:
3377                img_np = X[i].permute(1, 2, 0).detach().cpu().numpy()
3378                if normalize:
3379                    img_np = self.percentile_normalize(img_np)
3380                ax.imshow(img_np)
3381                ax.imshow(gradcam_map, cmap='jet', alpha=0.5)
3382
3383            #ax.imshow(X[i].permute(1, 2, 0).detach().cpu().numpy())  # Original image
3384            #ax.imshow(gradcam_map, cmap='jet', alpha=0.5)  # Overlay the gradcam map
3385
3386            # Add class label in the top-left corner
3387            ax.text(5, 25, str(predictions[i].item()), fontsize=12, color='white', weight='bold',
3388                    bbox=dict(facecolor='black', alpha=0.7, boxstyle='round,pad=0.2'))
3389            ax.axis('off')
3390
3391        plt.tight_layout(pad=0)
3392        return fig
3393    
3394    def percentile_normalize(self, img, lower_percentile=2, upper_percentile=98):
3395        img_normalized = np.zeros_like(img)
3396
3397        for c in range(img.shape[2]):  # Iterate over each channel
3398            low = np.percentile(img[:, :, c], lower_percentile)
3399            high = np.percentile(img[:, :, c], upper_percentile)
3400            img_normalized[:, :, c] = np.clip((img[:, :, c] - low) / (high - low), 0, 1)
3401
3402        return img_normalized
3403
3404def preprocess_image(image_path, normalize=True, image_size=224, channels=[1,2,3]):
3405    preprocess = transforms.Compose([
3406        transforms.Resize((image_size, image_size)),
3407        transforms.ToTensor(),
3408    ])
3409    
3410    image = Image.open(image_path).convert('RGB')
3411    input_tensor = preprocess(image)
3412    if normalize:
3413        input_tensor = transforms.Normalize(mean=[0.485, 0.456, 0.406], std=[0.229, 0.224, 0.225])(input_tensor)
3414    input_tensor = input_tensor.unsqueeze(0)
3415    
3416    return image, input_tensor
3417
3418def class_visualization(target_y, model_path, dtype, img_size=224, channels=[0,1,2], l2_reg=1e-3, learning_rate=25, num_iterations=100, blur_every=10, max_jitter=16, show_every=25, class_names = ['nc', 'pc']):
3419    
3420    def jitter(img, ox, oy):
3421        # Randomly jitter the image
3422        return torch.roll(torch.roll(img, ox, dims=2), oy, dims=3)
3423
3424    def blur_image(img, sigma=1):
3425        # Apply Gaussian blur to the image
3426        img_np = img.cpu().numpy()
3427        for i in range(img_np.shape[1]):
3428            img_np[:, i] = gaussian_filter(img_np[:, i], sigma=sigma)
3429        img.copy_(torch.tensor(img_np).to(img.device))
3430
3431    def deprocess(img_tensor):
3432        # Convert the tensor image to a numpy array for visualization
3433        img_tensor = img_tensor.clone()
3434        for c in range(3):
3435            img_tensor[:, c] = img_tensor[:, c] * SQUEEZENET_STD[c] + SQUEEZENET_MEAN[c]
3436        img_tensor = img_tensor.clamp(0, 1)
3437        return img_tensor.squeeze().permute(1, 2, 0).cpu().numpy()
3438    
3439    # Assuming these are defined somewhere in your codebase
3440    SQUEEZENET_MEAN = [0.485, 0.456, 0.406]
3441    SQUEEZENET_STD = [0.229, 0.224, 0.225]
3442    
3443    model = torch.load(model_path)
3444    
3445    dtype = torch.cuda.FloatTensor if torch.cuda.is_available() else torch.FloatTensor
3446    len_chans = len(channels)
3447    model.type(dtype)
3448
3449    # Randomly initialize the image as a PyTorch Tensor, and make it requires gradient.
3450    img = torch.randn(1, len_chans, img_size, img_size).mul_(1.0).type(dtype).requires_grad_()
3451
3452    for t in range(num_iterations):
3453        # Randomly jitter the image a bit; this gives slightly nicer results
3454        ox, oy = random.randint(0, max_jitter), random.randint(0, max_jitter)
3455        img.data.copy_(jitter(img.data, ox, oy))
3456
3457        # Forward pass
3458        score = model(img)
3459        
3460        if target_y == 0:
3461            target_score = -score
3462        else:
3463            target_score = score
3464
3465        # Add regularization
3466        target_score = target_score - l2_reg * torch.norm(img)
3467
3468        # Backward pass
3469        target_score.backward()
3470
3471        # Gradient ascent step
3472        with torch.no_grad():
3473            img += learning_rate * img.grad / torch.norm(img.grad)
3474            img.grad.zero_()
3475
3476        # Undo the random jitter
3477        img.data.copy_(jitter(img.data, -ox, -oy))
3478
3479        # As regularizer, clamp and periodically blur the image
3480        for c in range(3):
3481            lo = float(-SQUEEZENET_MEAN[c] / SQUEEZENET_STD[c])
3482            hi = float((1.0 - SQUEEZENET_MEAN[c]) / SQUEEZENET_STD[c])
3483            img.data[:, c].clamp_(min=lo, max=hi)
3484        if t % blur_every == 0:
3485            blur_image(img.data, sigma=0.5)
3486        
3487        # Periodically show the image
3488        if t == 0 or (t + 1) % show_every == 0 or t == num_iterations - 1:
3489            plt.imshow(deprocess(img.data.clone().cpu()))
3490            class_name = class_names[target_y]
3491            plt.title('%s\nIteration %d / %d' % (class_name, t + 1, num_iterations))
3492            plt.gcf().set_size_inches(4, 4)
3493            plt.axis('off')
3494            plt.show()
3495
3496    return deprocess(img.data.cpu())
3497
3498def get_submodules(model, prefix=''):
3499    submodules = []
3500    for name, module in model.named_children():
3501        full_name = prefix + ('.' if prefix else '') + name
3502        submodules.append(full_name)
3503        submodules.extend(get_submodules(module, full_name))
3504    return submodules
3505
3506class GradCAM:
3507    def __init__(self, model, target_layers=None, use_cuda=True):
3508        self.model = model
3509        self.model.eval()
3510        self.target_layers = target_layers
3511        self.cuda = use_cuda
3512        if self.cuda:
3513            self.model = model.cuda()
3514
3515    def forward(self, input):
3516        return self.model(input)
3517
3518    def __call__(self, x, index=None):
3519        if self.cuda:
3520            x = x.cuda()
3521
3522        features = []
3523        def hook(module, input, output):
3524            features.append(output)
3525
3526        handles = []
3527        for name, module in self.model.named_modules():
3528            if name in self.target_layers:
3529                handles.append(module.register_forward_hook(hook))
3530
3531        output = self.forward(x)
3532        if index is None:
3533            index = np.argmax(output.data.cpu().numpy())
3534
3535        one_hot = np.zeros((1, output.size()[-1]), dtype=np.float32)
