def augment_single_image(args): 
2071def augment_single_image(args):
2072    img_path, dst = args
2073    img = cv2.imread(img_path, cv2.IMREAD_UNCHANGED)
2074    filename = os.path.basename(img_path).split('.')[0]
2075
2076    # Original Image
2077    cv2.imwrite(os.path.join(dst, f"{filename}_original.png"), img)
2078    
2079    # 90 degree rotation
2080    img_rot_90 = cv2.rotate(img, cv2.ROTATE_90_CLOCKWISE)
2081    cv2.imwrite(os.path.join(dst, f"{filename}_rot_90.png"), img_rot_90)
2082    
2083    # 180 degree rotation
2084    img_rot_180 = cv2.rotate(img, cv2.ROTATE_180)
2085    cv2.imwrite(os.path.join(dst, f"{filename}_rot_180.png"), img_rot_180)
2086
2087    # 270 degree rotation
2088    img_rot_270 = cv2.rotate(img, cv2.ROTATE_90_COUNTERCLOCKWISE)
2089    cv2.imwrite(os.path.join(dst, f"{filename}_rot_270.png"), img_rot_270)
2090
2091    # Horizontal Flip
2092    img_flip_hor = cv2.flip(img, 1)
2093    cv2.imwrite(os.path.join(dst, f"{filename}_flip_hor.png"), img_flip_hor)
2094
2095    # Vertical Flip
2096    img_flip_ver = cv2.flip(img, 0)
2097    cv2.imwrite(os.path.join(dst, f"{filename}_flip_ver.png"), img_flip_ver)
def augment_images(file_paths, dst): 
2099def augment_images(file_paths, dst):
2100    if not os.path.exists(dst):
2101        os.makedirs(dst)
2102
2103    args_list = [(img_path, dst) for img_path in file_paths]
2104
2105    with Pool(cpu_count()) as pool:
2106        pool.map(augment_single_image, args_list)
def augment_classes(dst, nc, pc, generate=True, move=True): 
2108def augment_classes(dst, nc, pc, generate=True,move=True):
2109    aug_nc = os.path.join(dst,'aug_nc')
2110    aug_pc = os.path.join(dst,'aug_pc')
2111    all_ = len(nc)+len(pc)
2112    if generate == True:
2113        os.makedirs(aug_nc, exist_ok=True)
2114        if __name__ == '__main__':
2115            augment_images(file_paths=nc, dst=aug_nc)
2116
2117        os.makedirs(aug_pc, exist_ok=True)
2118        if __name__ == '__main__':
2119            augment_images(file_paths=pc, dst=aug_pc)
2120
2121    if move == True:
2122        aug = os.path.join(dst,'aug')
2123        aug_train_nc = os.path.join(aug,'train/nc')
2124        aug_train_pc = os.path.join(aug,'train/pc')
2125        aug_test_nc = os.path.join(aug,'test/nc')
2126        aug_test_pc = os.path.join(aug,'test/pc')
2127
2128        os.makedirs(aug_train_nc, exist_ok=True)
2129        os.makedirs(aug_train_pc, exist_ok=True)
2130        os.makedirs(aug_test_nc, exist_ok=True)
2131        os.makedirs(aug_test_pc, exist_ok=True)
2132
2133        aug_nc_list = [os.path.join(aug_nc, file) for file in os.listdir(aug_nc)]
2134        aug_pc_list = [os.path.join(aug_pc, file) for file in os.listdir(aug_pc)]
2135
2136        nc_train_data, nc_test_data = train_test_split(aug_nc_list, test_size=0.1, shuffle=True, random_state=42)
2137        pc_train_data, pc_test_data = train_test_split(aug_pc_list, test_size=0.1, shuffle=True, random_state=42)
2138
2139        i=0
2140        for path in nc_train_data:
2141            i+=1
2142            shutil.move(path, os.path.join(aug_train_nc, os.path.basename(path)))
2143            print(f'{i}/{all_}', end='\r', flush=True)
2144        for path in nc_test_data:
2145            i+=1
2146            shutil.move(path, os.path.join(aug_test_nc, os.path.basename(path)))
2147            print(f'{i}/{all_}', end='\r', flush=True)
2148        for path in pc_train_data:
2149            i+=1
2150            shutil.move(path, os.path.join(aug_train_pc, os.path.basename(path)))
2151            print(f'{i}/{all_}', end='\r', flush=True)
2152        for path in pc_test_data:
2153            i+=1
2154            shutil.move(path, os.path.join(aug_test_pc, os.path.basename(path)))
2155            print(f'{i}/{all_}', end='\r', flush=True)
2156        print(f'Train nc: {len(os.listdir(aug_train_nc))}, Train pc:{len(os.listdir(aug_test_nc))}, Test nc:{len(os.listdir(aug_train_pc))}, Test pc:{len(os.listdir(aug_test_pc))}')
2157        return
def annotate_predictions(csv_loc): 
2159def annotate_predictions(csv_loc):
2160    df = pd.read_csv(csv_loc)
2161    df['filename'] = df['path'].apply(lambda x: x.split('/')[-1])
2162    df[['plateID', 'well', 'fieldID', 'object']] = df['filename'].str.split('_', expand=True)
2163    df['object'] = df['object'].str.replace('.png', '')
2164    
2165    def assign_condition(row):
2166        plate = int(row['plateID'])
2167        col = int(row['well'][1:])
2168        
2169        if col > 3:
2170            if plate in [1, 2, 3, 4]:
2171                return 'screen'
2172            elif plate in [5, 6, 7, 8]:
2173                return 'pc'
2174        elif col in [1, 2, 3]:
2175            return 'nc'
2176        else:
2177            return ''
2178
2179    df['cond'] = df.apply(assign_condition, axis=1)
2180    return df
def initiate_counter(counter_, lock_): 
2182def initiate_counter(counter_, lock_):
2183    global counter, lock
2184    counter = counter_
2185    lock = lock_
def add_images_to_tar(paths_chunk, tar_path, total_images): 
2187def add_images_to_tar(paths_chunk, tar_path, total_images):
2188    with tarfile.open(tar_path, 'w') as tar:
2189        for i, img_path in enumerate(paths_chunk):
2190            arcname = os.path.basename(img_path)
2191            try:
2192                tar.add(img_path, arcname=arcname)
2193                with lock:
2194                    counter.value += 1
2195                    if counter.value % 10 == 0:  # Print every 100 updates
2196                        #progress = (counter.value / total_images) * 100
2197                        #print(f"Progress: {counter.value}/{total_images} ({progress:.2f}%)", end='\r', file=sys.stdout, flush=True)
2198                        print_progress(counter.value, total_images, n_jobs=1, time_ls=None, batch_size=None, operation_type="generating .tar dataset")
2199            except FileNotFoundError:
2200                print(f"File not found: {img_path}")
def generate_fraction_map(df, gene_column, min_frequency=0.0): 
2202def generate_fraction_map(df, gene_column, min_frequency=0.0):
2203    df['fraction'] = df['count']/df['well_read_sum']
2204    genes = df[gene_column].unique().tolist()
2205    wells = df['prc'].unique().tolist()
2206    print(len(genes),len(wells))
2207    independent_variables = pd.DataFrame(columns=genes, index = wells)
2208    for index, row in df.iterrows():
2209        prc = row['prc']
2210        gene = row[gene_column]
2211        fraction = row['fraction']
2212        independent_variables.loc[prc,gene]=fraction
2213    independent_variables = independent_variables.dropna(axis=1, how='all')
2214    independent_variables = independent_variables.dropna(axis=0, how='all')
2215    independent_variables['sum'] = independent_variables.sum(axis=1)
2216    #sums = independent_variables['sum'].unique().tolist()
2217    #print(sums)
2218    #independent_variables = independent_variables[(independent_variables['sum'] == 0.0) | (independent_variables['sum'] == 1.0)]
2219    independent_variables = independent_variables.fillna(0.0)
2220    independent_variables = independent_variables.drop(columns=[col for col in independent_variables.columns if independent_variables[col].max() < min_frequency])
2221    independent_variables = independent_variables.drop('sum', axis=1)
2222    independent_variables.index.name = 'prc'
2223    loc = '/mnt/data/CellVoyager/20x/tsg101/crispr_screen/all/measurements/iv.csv'
2224    independent_variables.to_csv(loc, index=True, header=True, mode='w')
2225    return independent_variables
def fishers_odds(df, threshold=0.5, phenotyp_col='mean_pred'): 
2227def fishers_odds(df, threshold=0.5, phenotyp_col='mean_pred'):
2228    # Binning based on phenotype score (e.g., above 0.8 as high)
2229    df['high_phenotype'] = df[phenotyp_col] < threshold
2230
2231    results = []
2232    mutants = df.columns[:-2]
2233    mutants = [item for item in mutants if item not in ['count_prc','mean_pathogen_area']]
2234    print(f'fishers df')
2235    display(df)
2236    # Perform Fisher's exact test for each mutant
2237    for mutant in mutants:
2238        contingency_table = pd.crosstab(df[mutant] > 0, df['high_phenotype'])
2239        if contingency_table.shape == (2, 2):  # Check for 2x2 shape
2240            odds_ratio, p_value = fisher_exact(contingency_table)
2241            results.append((mutant, odds_ratio, p_value))
2242        else:
2243            # Optionally handle non-2x2 tables (e.g., append NaN or other placeholders)
2244            results.append((mutant, float('nan'), float('nan')))
2245    
2246    # Convert results to DataFrame for easier handling
2247    results_df = pd.DataFrame(results, columns=['Mutant', 'OddsRatio', 'PValue'])
2248    # Remove rows with undefined odds ratios or p-values
2249    filtered_results_df = results_df.dropna(subset=['OddsRatio', 'PValue'])
2250    
2251    pvalues = filtered_results_df['PValue'].values
2252
2253    # Check if pvalues array is empty
2254    if len(pvalues) > 0:
2255        # Apply Benjamini-Hochberg correction
2256        adjusted_pvalues = multipletests(pvalues, method='fdr_bh')[1]
2257        # Add adjusted p-values back to the dataframe
2258        filtered_results_df['AdjustedPValue'] = adjusted_pvalues
2259        # Filter significant results
2260        significant_mutants = filtered_results_df[filtered_results_df['AdjustedPValue'] < 0.05]
2261    else:
2262        print("No p-values to adjust. Check your data filtering steps.")
2263        significant_mutants = pd.DataFrame()  # return empty DataFrame in this case
2264    
2265    return filtered_results_df
def model_metrics(model): 
2267def model_metrics(model):
2268
2269    # Calculate additional metrics
2270    rmse = np.sqrt(model.mse_resid)
2271    mae = np.mean(np.abs(model.resid))
2272    durbin_w_value = durbin_watson(model.resid)
2273
2274    # Display the additional metrics
2275    print("\nAdditional Metrics:")
2276    print(f"Root Mean Squared Error (RMSE): {rmse}")
2277    print(f"Mean Absolute Error (MAE): {mae}")
2278    print(f"Durbin-Watson: {durbin_w_value}")
2279
2280    # Residual Plots
2281    fig, ax = plt.subplots(2, 2, figsize=(15, 12))
2282
2283    # Residual vs. Fitted
2284    ax[0, 0].scatter(model.fittedvalues, model.resid, edgecolors = 'k', facecolors = 'none')
2285    ax[0, 0].set_title('Residuals vs Fitted')
2286    ax[0, 0].set_xlabel('Fitted values')
2287    ax[0, 0].set_ylabel('Residuals')
2288
2289    # Histogram
2290    sns.histplot(model.resid, kde=True, ax=ax[0, 1])
2291    ax[0, 1].set_title('Histogram of Residuals')
2292    ax[0, 1].set_xlabel('Residuals')
2293
2294    # QQ Plot
2295    sm.qqplot(model.resid, fit=True, line='45', ax=ax[1, 0])
2296    ax[1, 0].set_title('QQ Plot')
2297
2298    # Scale-Location
2299    standardized_resid = model.get_influence().resid_studentized_internal
2300    ax[1, 1].scatter(model.fittedvalues, np.sqrt(np.abs(standardized_resid)), edgecolors = 'k', facecolors = 'none')
2301    ax[1, 1].set_title('Scale-Location')
2302    ax[1, 1].set_xlabel('Fitted values')
2303    ax[1, 1].set_ylabel('$\sqrt{|Standardized Residuals|}$')
2304
2305    plt.tight_layout()
2306    plt.show()
def check_multicollinearity(x): 
2308def check_multicollinearity(x):
2309    """Checks multicollinearity of the predictors by computing the VIF."""
2310    vif_data = pd.DataFrame()
2311    vif_data["Variable"] = x.columns
2312    vif_data["VIF"] = [variance_inflation_factor(x.values, i) for i in range(x.shape[1])]
2313    return vif_data

Checks multicollinearity of the predictors by computing the VIF.

def lasso_reg(merged_df, alpha_value=0.01, reg_type='lasso'): 
2315def lasso_reg(merged_df, alpha_value=0.01, reg_type='lasso'):
2316    # Separate predictors and response
2317    X = merged_df[['gene', 'grna', 'plateID', 'rowID', 'columnID']]
2318    y = merged_df['pred']
2319
2320    # One-hot encode the categorical predictors
2321    encoder = OneHotEncoder(drop='first')  # drop one category to avoid the dummy variable trap
2322    X_encoded = encoder.fit_transform(X).toarray()
2323    feature_names = encoder.get_feature_names_out(input_features=X.columns)
2324    
2325    if reg_type == 'ridge':
2326        # Fit ridge regression
2327        ridge = Ridge(alpha=alpha_value)
2328        ridge.fit(X_encoded, y)
2329        coefficients = ridge.coef_
2330        coeff_dict = dict(zip(feature_names, ridge.coef_))
2331        
2332    if reg_type == 'lasso':
2333        # Fit Lasso regression
2334        lasso = Lasso(alpha=alpha_value)
2335        lasso.fit(X_encoded, y)
2336        coefficients = lasso.coef_
2337        coeff_dict = dict(zip(feature_names, lasso.coef_))
2338    coeff_df = pd.DataFrame(list(coeff_dict.items()), columns=['Feature', 'Coefficient'])
2339    return coeff_df
def MLR(merged_df, refine_model): 
2341def MLR(merged_df, refine_model):
2342    
2343    from .plot import _reg_v_plot
2344    
2345    #model = smf.ols("pred ~ gene + grna + gene:grna + plate + row + column", merged_df).fit()
2346    model = smf.ols("pred ~ gene:grna + plate + row + column", merged_df).fit()
2347    # Display model metrics and summary
2348    model_metrics(model)
2349
2350    if refine_model:
2351        # Filter outliers
2352        std_resid = model.get_influence().resid_studentized_internal
2353        outliers_resid = np.where(np.abs(std_resid) > 3)[0]
2354        (c, p) = model.get_influence().cooks_distance
2355        outliers_cooks = np.where(c > 4/(len(merged_df)-merged_df.shape[1]-1))[0]
2356        outliers = reduce(np.union1d, (outliers_resid, outliers_cooks))
2357        merged_df_filtered = merged_df.drop(merged_df.index[outliers])
2358
2359        display(merged_df_filtered)
2360
2361        # Refit the model with filtered data
2362        model = smf.ols("pred ~ gene + grna + gene:grna + row + column", merged_df_filtered).fit()
2363        print("Number of outliers detected by standardized residuals:", len(outliers_resid))
2364        print("Number of outliers detected by Cook's distance:", len(outliers_cooks))
2365
2366        model_metrics(model)
2367        print(model.summary())
2368
2369    # Extract interaction coefficients and determine the maximum effect size
2370    interaction_coeffs = {key: val for key, val in model.params.items() if "gene[T." in key and ":grna[T." in key}
2371    interaction_pvalues = {key: val for key, val in model.pvalues.items() if "gene[T." in key and ":grna[T." in key}
2372
2373    max_effects = {}
2374    max_effects_pvalues = {}
2375    for key, val in interaction_coeffs.items():
2376        gene_name = key.split(":")[0].replace("gene[T.", "").replace("]", "")
2377        if gene_name not in max_effects or abs(max_effects[gene_name]) < abs(val):
2378            max_effects[gene_name] = val
2379            max_effects_pvalues[gene_name] = interaction_pvalues[key]
2380
2381    for key in max_effects:
2382        print(f"Key: {key}: {max_effects[key]}, p:{max_effects_pvalues[key]}")
2383
2384    df = pd.DataFrame([max_effects, max_effects_pvalues])
2385    df = df.transpose()
2386    df = df.rename(columns={df.columns[0]: 'effect', df.columns[1]: 'p'})
2387    df = df.sort_values(by=['effect', 'p'], ascending=[False, True])
2388
2389    _reg_v_plot(df)
2390    
2391    return max_effects, max_effects_pvalues, model, df
def get_files_from_dir(dir_path, file_extension='*'): 
2393def get_files_from_dir(dir_path, file_extension="*"):
2394    return glob(os.path.join(dir_path, file_extension))
def create_circular_mask(h, w, center=None, radius=None): 
2396def create_circular_mask(h, w, center=None, radius=None):
2397    if center is None:  # use the middle of the image
2398        center = (int(w/2), int(h/2))
2399    if radius is None:  # use the smallest distance between the center and image walls
2400        radius = min(center[0], center[1], w-center[0], h-center[1])
2401
2402    Y, X = np.ogrid[:h, :w]
2403    dist_from_center = np.sqrt((X - center[0])**2 + (Y-center[1])**2)
2404
2405    mask = dist_from_center <= radius
2406    return mask
def apply_mask(image, output_value=0): 
2408def apply_mask(image, output_value=0):
2409    h, w = image.shape[:2]  # Assuming image is grayscale or RGB
2410    mask = create_circular_mask(h, w)
2411    
2412    # If the image has more than one channel, repeat the mask for each channel
2413    if len(image.shape) > 2:
2414        mask = np.repeat(mask[:, :, np.newaxis], image.shape[2], axis=2)
2415    
2416    # Apply the mask - set pixels outside of the mask to output_value
2417    masked_image = np.where(mask, image, output_value)
2418    return masked_image
def invert_image(image): 
2420def invert_image(image):
2421    # The maximum value depends on the image dtype (e.g., 255 for uint8)
2422    max_value = np.iinfo(image.dtype).max
2423    inverted_image = max_value - image
2424    return inverted_image
def resize_images_and_labels(images, labels, target_height, target_width, show_example=True): 
2426def resize_images_and_labels(images, labels, target_height, target_width, show_example=True):
2427    
2428    from .plot import plot_resize
2429    
2430    resized_images = []
2431    resized_labels = []
2432    if not images is None and not labels is None:
2433        for image, label in zip(images, labels):
2434
2435            if image.ndim == 2:
2436                image_shape = (target_height, target_width)
2437            elif image.ndim == 3:
2438                image_shape = (target_height, target_width, image.shape[-1])
2439                
2440            resized_image = resizescikit(image, image_shape, preserve_range=True, anti_aliasing=True).astype(image.dtype)
2441            resized_label = resizescikit(label, (target_height, target_width), order=0, preserve_range=True, anti_aliasing=False).astype(label.dtype)
2442            
2443            if resized_image.shape[-1] == 1:
2444                resized_image = np.squeeze(resized_image)
2445            
2446            resized_images.append(resized_image)
2447            resized_labels.append(resized_label)
2448    
2449    elif not images is None:
2450        for image in images:
2451        
2452            if image.ndim == 2:
2453                image_shape = (target_height, target_width)
2454            elif image.ndim == 3:
2455                image_shape = (target_height, target_width, image.shape[-1])
2456                
2457            resized_image = resizescikit(image, image_shape, preserve_range=True, anti_aliasing=True).astype(image.dtype)
2458            
2459            if resized_image.shape[-1] == 1:
2460                resized_image = np.squeeze(resized_image)
2461            
2462            resized_images.append(resized_image)
2463            
2464    elif not labels is None:
2465        for label in labels:
2466            resized_label = resizescikit(label, (target_height, target_width), order=0, preserve_range=True, anti_aliasing=False).astype(label.dtype)
2467            resized_labels.append(resized_label)
2468        
2469    if show_example:     
2470        if not images is None and not labels is None:
2471            plot_resize(images, resized_images, labels, resized_labels)
2472        elif not images is None:
2473            plot_resize(images, resized_images, images, resized_images)
2474        elif not labels is None:
2475            plot_resize(labels, resized_labels, labels, resized_labels)
2476    
2477    return resized_images, resized_labels
def resize_labels_back(labels, orig_dims): 
2479def resize_labels_back(labels, orig_dims):
2480    resized_labels = []
2481
2482    if len(labels) != len(orig_dims):
2483        raise ValueError("The length of labels and orig_dims must match.")
2484
2485    for label, dims in zip(labels, orig_dims):
2486        # Ensure dims is a tuple of two integers (width, height)
2487        if not isinstance(dims, tuple) or len(dims) != 2:
2488            raise ValueError("Each element in orig_dims must be a tuple of two integers representing the original dimensions (width, height)")
2489
2490        resized_label = resizescikit(label, dims, order=0, preserve_range=True, anti_aliasing=False).astype(label.dtype)
2491        resized_labels.append(resized_label)
2492
2493    return resized_labels
def calculate_iou(mask1, mask2): 
2495def calculate_iou(mask1, mask2):
2496    mask1, mask2 = pad_to_same_shape(mask1, mask2)
2497    intersection = np.logical_and(mask1, mask2).sum()
2498    union = np.logical_or(mask1, mask2).sum()
2499    return intersection / union if union != 0 else 0
def match_masks(true_masks, pred_masks, iou_threshold): 
2501def match_masks(true_masks, pred_masks, iou_threshold):
2502    matches = []
2503    matched_true_masks_indices = set()  # Use set to store indices of matched true masks
2504
2505    for pred_mask in pred_masks:
2506        for true_mask_index, true_mask in enumerate(true_masks):
2507            if true_mask_index not in matched_true_masks_indices:
2508                iou = calculate_iou(true_mask, pred_mask)
2509                if iou >= iou_threshold:
2510                    matches.append((true_mask, pred_mask))
2511                    matched_true_masks_indices.add(true_mask_index)  # Store the index of the matched true mask
2512                    break  # Move on to the next predicted mask
2513    return matches
def compute_average_precision(matches, num_true_masks, num_pred_masks): 
2515def compute_average_precision(matches, num_true_masks, num_pred_masks):
2516    TP = len(matches)
2517    FP = num_pred_masks - TP
2518    FN = num_true_masks - TP
2519    precision = TP / (TP + FP) if TP + FP > 0 else 0
2520    recall = TP / (TP + FN) if TP + FN > 0 else 0
2521    return precision, recall
def pad_to_same_shape(mask1, mask2): 
2523def pad_to_same_shape(mask1, mask2):
2524    # Find the shape differences
2525    shape_diff = np.array([max(mask1.shape[0], mask2.shape[0]) - mask1.shape[0], 
2526                           max(mask1.shape[1], mask2.shape[1]) - mask1.shape[1]])
2527    pad_mask1 = ((0, shape_diff[0]), (0, shape_diff[1]))
2528    shape_diff = np.array([max(mask1.shape[0], mask2.shape[0]) - mask2.shape[0], 
2529                           max(mask1.shape[1], mask2.shape[1]) - mask2.shape[1]])
2530    pad_mask2 = ((0, shape_diff[0]), (0, shape_diff[1]))
2531    
2532    padded_mask1 = np.pad(mask1, pad_mask1, mode='constant', constant_values=0)
2533    padded_mask2 = np.pad(mask2, pad_mask2, mode='constant', constant_values=0)
2534    
2535    return padded_mask1, padded_mask2
def compute_ap_over_iou_thresholds(true_masks, pred_masks, iou_thresholds): 
2537def compute_ap_over_iou_thresholds(true_masks, pred_masks, iou_thresholds):
2538    precision_recall_pairs = []
2539    for iou_threshold in iou_thresholds:
2540        matches = match_masks(true_masks, pred_masks, iou_threshold)
2541        precision, recall = compute_average_precision(matches, len(true_masks), len(pred_masks))
2542        # Check that precision and recall are within the range [0, 1]
2543        if not 0 <= precision <= 1 or not 0 <= recall <= 1:
2544            raise ValueError(f'Precision or recall out of bounds. Precision: {precision}, Recall: {recall}')
2545        precision_recall_pairs.append((precision, recall))
2546
2547    # Sort by recall values
2548    precision_recall_pairs = sorted(precision_recall_pairs, key=lambda x: x[1])
2549    sorted_precisions = [p[0] for p in precision_recall_pairs]
2550    sorted_recalls = [p[1] for p in precision_recall_pairs]
2551    return np.trapz(sorted_precisions, x=sorted_recalls)
def compute_segmentation_ap( true_masks, pred_masks, iou_thresholds=array([0.5 , 0.55, 0.6 , 0.65, 0.7 , 0.75, 0.8 , 0.85, 0.9 , 0.95])): 
2553def compute_segmentation_ap(true_masks, pred_masks, iou_thresholds=np.linspace(0.5, 0.95, 10)):
2554    true_mask_labels = label(true_masks)
2555    pred_mask_labels = label(pred_masks)
2556    true_mask_regions = [region.image for region in regionprops(true_mask_labels)]
2557    pred_mask_regions = [region.image for region in regionprops(pred_mask_labels)]
2558    return compute_ap_over_iou_thresholds(true_mask_regions, pred_mask_regions, iou_thresholds)
def jaccard_index(mask1, mask2): 
2560def jaccard_index(mask1, mask2):
2561    intersection = np.logical_and(mask1, mask2)
2562    union = np.logical_or(mask1, mask2)
2563    return np.sum(intersection) / np.sum(union)
def dice_coefficient(mask1, mask2): 
2565def dice_coefficient(mask1, mask2):
2566    # Convert to binary masks
2567    mask1 = np.where(mask1 > 0, 1, 0)
2568    mask2 = np.where(mask2 > 0, 1, 0)
2569
2570    # Calculate intersection and total
2571    intersection = np.sum(mask1 & mask2)
2572    total = np.sum(mask1) + np.sum(mask2)
2573    
2574    # Handle the case where both masks are empty
2575    if total == 0:
2576        return 1.0
2577    
2578    # Return the Dice coefficient
2579    return 2.0 * intersection / total
def extract_boundaries(mask, dilation_radius=1): 
2581def extract_boundaries(mask, dilation_radius=1):
2582    binary_mask = (mask > 0).astype(np.uint8)
2583    struct_elem = np.ones((dilation_radius*2+1, dilation_radius*2+1))
2584    dilated = morphology.binary_dilation(binary_mask, footprint=struct_elem)
2585    eroded = morphology.binary_erosion(binary_mask, footprint=struct_elem)
2586    boundary = dilated ^ eroded
2587    return boundary
def boundary_f1_score(mask_true, mask_pred, dilation_radius=1): 
2589def boundary_f1_score(mask_true, mask_pred, dilation_radius=1):
2590    # Assume extract_boundaries is defined to extract object boundaries with given dilation_radius
2591    boundary_true = extract_boundaries(mask_true, dilation_radius)
2592    boundary_pred = extract_boundaries(mask_pred, dilation_radius)
2593    
2594    # Calculate intersection of boundaries
2595    intersection = np.logical_and(boundary_true, boundary_pred)
2596    
2597    # Calculate precision and recall for boundary detection
2598    precision = np.sum(intersection) / (np.sum(boundary_pred) + 1e-6)
2599    recall = np.sum(intersection) / (np.sum(boundary_true) + 1e-6)
2600    
2601    # Calculate F1 score as harmonic mean of precision and recall
2602    f1 = 2 * (precision * recall) / (precision + recall + 1e-6)
2603    
2604    return f1
def merge_touching_objects(mask, threshold=0.25): 
2714def merge_touching_objects(mask, threshold=0.25):
2715    """
2716    Merges touching objects in a binary mask based on the percentage of their shared boundary.
2717
2718    Args:
2719        mask (ndarray): Binary mask representing objects.
2720        threshold (float, optional): Threshold value for merging objects. Defaults to 0.25.
2721
2722    Returns:
2723        ndarray: Merged mask.
2724
2725    """
2726    perimeters = {}
2727    labels = np.unique(mask)
2728    # Calculating perimeter of each object
2729    for label in labels:
2730        if label != 0:  # Ignore background
2731            edges = morphology.erosion(mask == label) ^ (mask == label)
2732            perimeters[label] = np.sum(edges)
2733    # Detect touching objects and find the shared boundary
2734    shared_perimeters = {}
2735    dilated = morphology.dilation(mask > 0)
2736    for label in labels:
2737        if label != 0:  # Ignore background
2738            # Find the objects that this object is touching
2739            dilated_label = morphology.dilation(mask == label)
2740            touching_labels = np.unique(mask[dilated & (dilated_label != 0) & (mask != 0)])
2741            for touching_label in touching_labels:
2742                if touching_label != label:  # Exclude the object itself
2743                    shared_boundary = dilated_label & morphology.dilation(mask == touching_label)
2744                    shared_perimeters[(label, touching_label)] = np.sum(shared_boundary)
2745    # Merge objects if more than 25% of their boundary is touching
2746    for (label1, label2), shared_perimeter in shared_perimeters.items():
2747        if shared_perimeter > threshold * min(perimeters[label1], perimeters[label2]):
2748            mask[mask == label2] = label1  # Merge label2 into label1
2749    return mask

Merges touching objects in a binary mask based on the percentage of their shared boundary.

Args: mask (ndarray): Binary mask representing objects. threshold (float, optional): Threshold value for merging objects. Defaults to 0.25.

Returns: ndarray: Merged mask.

def remove_intensity_objects(image, mask, intensity_threshold, mode): 
2751def remove_intensity_objects(image, mask, intensity_threshold, mode):
2752    """
2753    Removes objects from the mask based on their mean intensity in the original image.
2754
2755    Args:
2756        image (ndarray): The original image.
2757        mask (ndarray): The mask containing labeled objects.
2758        intensity_threshold (float): The threshold value for mean intensity.
2759        mode (str): The mode for intensity comparison. Can be 'low' or 'high'.
2760
2761    Returns:
2762        ndarray: The updated mask with objects removed.
2763
2764    """
2765    # Calculate the mean intensity of each object in the original image
2766    props = regionprops_table(mask, image, properties=('label', 'mean_intensity'))
2767    # Find the labels of the objects with mean intensity below the threshold
2768    if mode == 'low':
2769        labels_to_remove = props['label'][props['mean_intensity'] < intensity_threshold]
2770    if mode == 'high':
2771        labels_to_remove = props['label'][props['mean_intensity'] > intensity_threshold]
2772    # Remove these objects from the mask
2773    mask[np.isin(mask, labels_to_remove)] = 0
2774    return mask

Removes objects from the mask based on their mean intensity in the original image.

Args: image (ndarray): The original image. mask (ndarray): The mask containing labeled objects. intensity_threshold (float): The threshold value for mean intensity. mode (str): The mode for intensity comparison. Can be 'low' or 'high'.

Returns: ndarray: The updated mask with objects removed.

class SelectChannels: 
3183class SelectChannels:
3184    def __init__(self, channels):
3185        self.channels = channels
3186    
3187    def __call__(self, img):
3188        img = img.clone()
3189        if 1 not in self.channels:
3190            img[0, :, :] = 0  # Zero out the red channel
3191        if 2 not in self.channels:
3192            img[1, :, :] = 0  # Zero out the green channel
3193        if 3 not in self.channels:
3194            img[2, :, :] = 0  # Zero out the blue channel
3195        return img
SelectChannels(channels) 
3184    def __init__(self, channels):
3185        self.channels = channels
channels
def preprocess_image(image_path, normalize=True, image_size=224, channels=[1, 2, 3]): 
3405def preprocess_image(image_path, normalize=True, image_size=224, channels=[1,2,3]):
3406    preprocess = transforms.Compose([
3407        transforms.Resize((image_size, image_size)),
3408        transforms.ToTensor(),
3409    ])
3410    
3411    image = Image.open(image_path).convert('RGB')
3412    input_tensor = preprocess(image)
3413    if normalize:
3414        input_tensor = transforms.Normalize(mean=[0.485, 0.456, 0.406], std=[0.229, 0.224, 0.225])(input_tensor)
3415    input_tensor = input_tensor.unsqueeze(0)
3416    
3417    return image, input_tensor
class SaliencyMapGenerator: 
3215class SaliencyMapGenerator:
3216    def __init__(self, model):
3217        self.model = model
3218
3219    def compute_saliency_maps(self, X, y):
3220        self.model.eval()
3221        X.requires_grad_()
3222
3223        # Forward pass
3224        scores = self.model(X).squeeze()
3225
3226        # For binary classification, target scores can be the single output
3227        target_scores = scores * (2 * y - 1)
3228
3229        self.model.zero_grad()
3230        target_scores.backward(torch.ones_like(target_scores))
3231
3232        saliency = X.grad.abs()
3233        return saliency
3234
3235    def compute_saliency_and_predictions(self, X):
3236        self.model.eval()
3237        X.requires_grad_()
3238
3239        # Forward pass to get predictions (logits)
3240        scores = self.model(X).squeeze()
3241
3242        # Get predicted class (0 or 1 for binary classification)
3243        predictions = (scores > 0).long()
3244
3245        # Compute saliency maps
3246        self.model.zero_grad()
3247        target_scores = scores * (2 * predictions - 1)
3248        target_scores.backward(torch.ones_like(target_scores))
3249
3250        saliency = X.grad.abs()
3251
3252        return saliency, predictions
3253
3254    def plot_activation_grid(self, X, saliency, predictions, overlay=True, normalize=False):
3255        N = X.shape[0]
3256        rows = (N + 7) // 8 
3257        fig, axs = plt.subplots(rows, 8, figsize=(16, rows * 2))
3258
3259        for i in range(N):
3260            ax = axs[i // 8, i % 8]
3261            saliency_map = saliency[i].cpu().numpy()  # Move to CPU and convert to numpy
3262
3263            if saliency_map.shape[0] == 3:  # Channels first, reshape to (H, W, 3)
3264                saliency_map = np.transpose(saliency_map, (1, 2, 0))
3265
3266            # Normalize image channels to 2nd and 98th percentiles
3267            if overlay:
3268                img_np = X[i].permute(1, 2, 0).detach().cpu().numpy()
3269                if normalize:
3270                    img_np = self.percentile_normalize(img_np)
3271                ax.imshow(img_np)
3272                ax.imshow(saliency_map, cmap='jet', alpha=0.5)
3273
3274            # Add class label in the top-left corner
3275            ax.text(5, 25, str(predictions[i].item()), fontsize=12, color='white', weight='bold',
3276                    bbox=dict(facecolor='black', alpha=0.7, boxstyle='round,pad=0.2'))
3277            ax.axis('off')
3278
3279        plt.tight_layout(pad=0)
3280        return fig
3281    
3282    def percentile_normalize(self, img, lower_percentile=2, upper_percentile=98):
3283        img_normalized = np.zeros_like(img)
3284
3285        for c in range(img.shape[2]):  # Iterate over each channel
3286            low = np.percentile(img[:, :, c], lower_percentile)
3287            high = np.percentile(img[:, :, c], upper_percentile)
3288            img_normalized[:, :, c] = np.clip((img[:, :, c] - low) / (high - low), 0, 1)
3289
3290        return img_normalized
SaliencyMapGenerator(model) 
3216    def __init__(self, model):
3217        self.model = model
model
def compute_saliency_maps(self, X, y): 
3219    def compute_saliency_maps(self, X, y):
3220        self.model.eval()
3221        X.requires_grad_()
3222
3223        # Forward pass
3224        scores = self.model(X).squeeze()
3225
3226        # For binary classification, target scores can be the single output
3227        target_scores = scores * (2 * y - 1)
3228
3229        self.model.zero_grad()
3230        target_scores.backward(torch.ones_like(target_scores))
3231
3232        saliency = X.grad.abs()
3233        return saliency
def compute_saliency_and_predictions(self, X): 
3235    def compute_saliency_and_predictions(self, X):
3236        self.model.eval()
3237        X.requires_grad_()
3238
3239        # Forward pass to get predictions (logits)
3240        scores = self.model(X).squeeze()
3241
3242        # Get predicted class (0 or 1 for binary classification)
3243        predictions = (scores > 0).long()
3244
3245        # Compute saliency maps
3246        self.model.zero_grad()
3247        target_scores = scores * (2 * predictions - 1)
3248        target_scores.backward(torch.ones_like(target_scores))
3249
3250        saliency = X.grad.abs()
3251

def plot_activation_grid(self, X, saliency, predictions, overlay=True, normalize=False):

3262
3263            if saliency_map.shape[0] == 3:  # Channels first, reshape to (H, W, 3)
3264                saliency_map = np.transpose(saliency_map, (1, 2, 0))

3277            ax.axis('off')

def percentile_normalize(self, img, lower_percentile=2, upper_percentile=98): 
3282    def percentile_normalize(self, img, lower_percentile=2, upper_percentile=98):
3283        img_normalized = np.zeros_like(img)
3284
3285        for c in range(img.shape[2]):  # Iterate over each channel
3286            low = np.percentile(img[:, :, c], lower_percentile)
3287            high = np.percentile(img[:, :, c], upper_percentile)
3288            img_normalized[:, :, c] = np.clip((img[:, :, c] - low) / (high - low), 0, 1)

class GradCAMGenerator: 
3292class GradCAMGenerator:
3293    def __init__(self, model, target_layer, cam_type='gradcam'):
3294        self.model = model
3295        self.model.eval()
3296        self.target_layer = target_layer
3297        self.cam_type = cam_type
3298        self.gradients = None
3299        self.activations = None
3300
3301        # Hook the target layer
3302        self.target_layer_module = self.get_layer(self.model, self.target_layer)
3303        self.hook_layers()
3304
3305    def hook_layers(self):
3306        # Forward hook to get activations
3307        def forward_hook(module, input, output):
3308            self.activations = output
3309
3310        # Backward hook to get gradients
3311        def backward_hook(module, grad_input, grad_output):
3312            self.gradients = grad_output[0]
3313
3314        self.target_layer_module.register_forward_hook(forward_hook)
3315        self.target_layer_module.register_backward_hook(backward_hook)
3316
3317    def get_layer(self, model, target_layer):
3318        # Recursively find the layer specified in target_layer
3319        modules = target_layer.split('.')
3320        layer = model
3321        for module in modules:
3322            layer = getattr(layer, module)
3323        return layer
3324
3325    def compute_gradcam_maps(self, X, y):
3326        X.requires_grad_()
3327
3328        # Forward pass
3329        scores = self.model(X).squeeze()
3330
3331        # Perform backward pass
3332        target_scores = scores * (2 * y - 1)
3333        self.model.zero_grad()
3334        target_scores.backward(torch.ones_like(target_scores))
3335
3336        # Compute GradCAM
3337        pooled_gradients = torch.mean(self.gradients, dim=[0, 2, 3])
3338        for i in range(self.activations.size(1)):
3339            self.activations[:, i, :, :] *= pooled_gradients[i]
3340
3341        gradcam = torch.mean(self.activations, dim=1).squeeze()
3342        gradcam = F.relu(gradcam)
3343        gradcam = F.interpolate(gradcam.unsqueeze(0).unsqueeze(0), size=X.shape[2:], mode='bilinear')
3344        gradcam = gradcam.squeeze().cpu().detach().numpy()
3345        gradcam = (gradcam - gradcam.min()) / (gradcam.max() - gradcam.min())
3346
3347        return gradcam
3348
3349    def compute_gradcam_and_predictions(self, X):
3350        self.model.eval()
3351        X.requires_grad_()
3352
3353        # Forward pass to get predictions (logits)
3354        scores = self.model(X).squeeze()
3355
3356        # Get predicted class (0 or 1 for binary classification)
3357        predictions = (scores > 0).long()
3358
3359        # Compute gradcam maps
3360        gradcam_maps = []
3361        for i in range(X.size(0)):
3362            gradcam_map = self.compute_gradcam_maps(X[i].unsqueeze(0), predictions[i])
3363            gradcam_maps.append(gradcam_map)
3364
3365        return torch.tensor(gradcam_maps), predictions
3366
3367    def plot_activation_grid(self, X, gradcam, predictions, overlay=True, normalize=False):
3368        N = X.shape[0]
3369        rows = (N + 7) // 8
3370        fig, axs = plt.subplots(rows, 8, figsize=(16, rows * 2))
3371
3372        for i in range(N):
3373            ax = axs[i // 8, i % 8]
3374            gradcam_map = gradcam[i].cpu().numpy()
3375
3376            # Normalize image channels to 2nd and 98th percentiles
3377            if overlay:
3378                img_np = X[i].permute(1, 2, 0).detach().cpu().numpy()
3379                if normalize:
3380                    img_np = self.percentile_normalize(img_np)
3381                ax.imshow(img_np)
3382                ax.imshow(gradcam_map, cmap='jet', alpha=0.5)
3383
3384            #ax.imshow(X[i].permute(1, 2, 0).detach().cpu().numpy())  # Original image
3385            #ax.imshow(gradcam_map, cmap='jet', alpha=0.5)  # Overlay the gradcam map
3386
3387            # Add class label in the top-left corner
3388            ax.text(5, 25, str(predictions[i].item()), fontsize=12, color='white', weight='bold',
3389                    bbox=dict(facecolor='black', alpha=0.7, boxstyle='round,pad=0.2'))
3390            ax.axis('off')
3391
3392        plt.tight_layout(pad=0)
3393        return fig
3394    
3395    def percentile_normalize(self, img, lower_percentile=2, upper_percentile=98):
3396        img_normalized = np.zeros_like(img)
3397
3398        for c in range(img.shape[2]):  # Iterate over each channel
3399            low = np.percentile(img[:, :, c], lower_percentile)
3400            high = np.percentile(img[:, :, c], upper_percentile)
3401            img_normalized[:, :, c] = np.clip((img[:, :, c] - low) / (high - low), 0, 1)
3402
3403        return img_normalized
GradCAMGenerator(model, target_layer, cam_type='gradcam') 
3293    def __init__(self, model, target_layer, cam_type='gradcam'):
3294        self.model = model
3295        self.model.eval()
3296        self.target_layer = target_layer
3297        self.cam_type = cam_type
3298        self.gradients = None
3299        self.activations = None
3300
3301        # Hook the target layer
3302        self.target_layer_module = self.get_layer(self.model, self.target_layer)
3303        self.hook_layers()
model
target_layer
cam_type
gradients
activations
target_layer_module
def hook_layers(self): 
3305    def hook_layers(self):
3306        # Forward hook to get activations
3307        def forward_hook(module, input, output):
3308            self.activations = output
3309
3310        # Backward hook to get gradients
3311        def backward_hook(module, grad_input, grad_output):
3312            self.gradients = grad_output[0]
3313
3314        self.target_layer_module.register_forward_hook(forward_hook)
3315        self.target_layer_module.register_backward_hook(backward_hook)
def get_layer(self, model, target_layer): 
3317    def get_layer(self, model, target_layer):
3318        # Recursively find the layer specified in target_layer
3319        modules = target_layer.split('.')
3320        layer = model
3321        for module in modules:
3322            layer = getattr(layer, module)
3323        return layer
def compute_gradcam_maps(self, X, y): 
3325    def compute_gradcam_maps(self, X, y):
3326        X.requires_grad_()
3327
3328        # Forward pass
3329        scores = self.model(X).squeeze()
3330
3331        # Perform backward pass
3332        target_scores = scores * (2 * y - 1)
3333        self.model.zero_grad()
3334        target_scores.backward(torch.ones_like(target_scores))
3335
3336        # Compute GradCAM
3337        pooled_gradients = torch.mean(self.gradients, dim=[0, 2, 3])
3338        for i in range(self.activations.size(1)):
3339            self.activations[:, i, :, :] *= pooled_gradients[i]
3340
3341        gradcam = torch.mean(self.activations, dim=1).squeeze()
3342        gradcam = F.relu(gradcam)
3343        gradcam = F.interpolate(gradcam.unsqueeze(0).unsqueeze(0), size=X.shape[2:], mode='bilinear')
3344        gradcam = gradcam.squeeze().cpu().detach().numpy()
3345        gradcam = (gradcam - gradcam.min()) / (gradcam.max() - gradcam.min())
3346
3347        return gradcam
def compute_gradcam_and_predictions(self, X): 
3349    def compute_gradcam_and_predictions(self, X):
3350        self.model.eval()
3351        X.requires_grad_()
3352
3353        # Forward pass to get predictions (logits)
3354        scores = self.model(X).squeeze()
3355
3356        # Get predicted class (0 or 1 for binary classification)
3357        predictions = (scores > 0).long()
3358
3359        # Compute gradcam maps
3360        gradcam_maps = []
3361        for i in range(X.size(0)):
3362            gradcam_map = self.compute_gradcam_maps(X[i].unsqueeze(0), predictions[i])
3363            gradcam_maps.append(gradcam_map)
3364
3365        return torch.tensor(gradcam_maps), predictions
def plot_activation_grid(self, X, gradcam, predictions, overlay=True, normalize=False): 
3367    def plot_activation_grid(self, X, gradcam, predictions, overlay=True, normalize=False):
3368        N = X.shape[0]
3369        rows = (N + 7) // 8
3370        fig, axs = plt.subplots(rows, 8, figsize=(16, rows * 2))
3371
3372        for i in range(N):
3373            ax = axs[i // 8, i % 8]
3374            gradcam_map = gradcam[i].cpu().numpy()
3375
3376            # Normalize image channels to 2nd and 98th percentiles
3377            if overlay:
3378                img_np = X[i].permute(1, 2, 0).detach().cpu().numpy()
3379                if normalize:
3380                    img_np = self.percentile_normalize(img_np)
3381                ax.imshow(img_np)
3382                ax.imshow(gradcam_map, cmap='jet', alpha=0.5)
3383
3384            #ax.imshow(X[i].permute(1, 2, 0).detach().cpu().numpy())  # Original image
3385            #ax.imshow(gradcam_map, cmap='jet', alpha=0.5)  # Overlay the gradcam map
3386
3387            # Add class label in the top-left corner
3388            ax.text(5, 25, str(predictions[i].item()), fontsize=12, color='white', weight='bold',
3389                    bbox=dict(facecolor='black', alpha=0.7, boxstyle='round,pad=0.2'))
3390            ax.axis('off')
3391
3392        plt.tight_layout(pad=0)
3393        return fig
def percentile_normalize(self, img, lower_percentile=2, upper_percentile=98): 
3395    def percentile_normalize(self, img, lower_percentile=2, upper_percentile=98):
3396        img_normalized = np.zeros_like(img)
3397
3398        for c in range(img.shape[2]):  # Iterate over each channel
3399            low = np.percentile(img[:, :, c], lower_percentile)
3400            high = np.percentile(img[:, :, c], upper_percentile)
3401            img_normalized[:, :, c] = np.clip((img[:, :, c] - low) / (high - low), 0, 1)
3402
3403        return img_normalized
def class_visualization( target_y, model_path, dtype, img_size=224, channels=[0, 1, 2], l2_reg=0.001, learning_rate=25, num_iterations=100, blur_every=10, max_jitter=16, show_every=25, class_names=['nc', 'pc']): 
3419def class_visualization(target_y, model_path, dtype, img_size=224, channels=[0,1,2], l2_reg=1e-3, learning_rate=25, num_iterations=100, blur_every=10, max_jitter=16, show_every=25, class_names = ['nc', 'pc']):
3420    
3421    def jitter(img, ox, oy):
3422        # Randomly jitter the image
3423        return torch.roll(torch.roll(img, ox, dims=2), oy, dims=3)
3424
3425    def blur_image(img, sigma=1):
3426        # Apply Gaussian blur to the image
3427        img_np = img.cpu().numpy()
3428        for i in range(img_np.shape[1]):
3429            img_np[:, i] = gaussian_filter(img_np[:, i], sigma=sigma)
3430        img.copy_(torch.tensor(img_np).to(img.device))
3431
3432    def deprocess(img_tensor):
3433        # Convert the tensor image to a numpy array for visualization
3434        img_tensor = img_tensor.clone()
3435        for c in range(3):
3436            img_tensor[:, c] = img_tensor[:, c] * SQUEEZENET_STD[c] + SQUEEZENET_MEAN[c]
3437        img_tensor = img_tensor.clamp(0, 1)
3438        return img_tensor.squeeze().permute(1, 2, 0).cpu().numpy()
3439    
3440    # Assuming these are defined somewhere in your codebase
3441    SQUEEZENET_MEAN = [0.485, 0.456, 0.406]
3442    SQUEEZENET_STD = [0.229, 0.224, 0.225]
3443    
3444    model = torch.load(model_path)
3445    
3446    dtype = torch.cuda.FloatTensor if torch.cuda.is_available() else torch.FloatTensor
3447    len_chans = len(channels)
3448    model.type(dtype)
3449
3450    # Randomly initialize the image as a PyTorch Tensor, and make it requires gradient.
3451    img = torch.randn(1, len_chans, img_size, img_size).mul_(1.0).type(dtype).requires_grad_()
3452
3453    for t in range(num_iterations):
3454        # Randomly jitter the image a bit; this gives slightly nicer results
3455        ox, oy = random.randint(0, max_jitter), random.randint(0, max_jitter)
3456        img.data.copy_(jitter(img.data, ox, oy))
3457
3458        # Forward pass
3459        score = model(img)
3460        
3461        if target_y == 0:
3462            target_score = -score
3463        else:
3464            target_score = score
3465
3466        # Add regularization
3467        target_score = target_score - l2_reg * torch.norm(img)
3468
3469        # Backward pass
3470        target_score.backward()
3471
3472        # Gradient ascent step
3473        with torch.no_grad():
3474            img += learning_rate * img.grad / torch.norm(img.grad)
3475            img.grad.zero_()
3476
3477        # Undo the random jitter
3478        img.data.copy_(jitter(img.data, -ox, -oy))
3479
3480        # As regularizer, clamp and periodically blur the image
3481        for c in range(3):
3482            lo = float(-SQUEEZENET_MEAN[c] / SQUEEZENET_STD[c])
3483            hi = float((1.0 - SQUEEZENET_MEAN[c]) / SQUEEZENET_STD[c])
3484            img.data[:, c].clamp_(min=lo, max=hi)
3485        if t % blur_every == 0:
3486            blur_image(img.data, sigma=0.5)
3487        
3488        # Periodically show the image
3489        if t == 0 or (t + 1) % show_every == 0 or t == num_iterations - 1:
3490            plt.imshow(deprocess(img.data.clone().cpu()))
3491            class_name = class_names[target_y]
3492            plt.title('%s\nIteration %d / %d' % (class_name, t + 1, num_iterations))
3493            plt.gcf().set_size_inches(4, 4)
3494            plt.axis('off')
3495            plt.show()
3496
3497    return deprocess(img.data.cpu())
def get_submodules(model, prefix=''): 
3499def get_submodules(model, prefix=''):
3500    submodules = []
3501    for name, module in model.named_children():
3502        full_name = prefix + ('.' if prefix else '') + name
3503        submodules.append(full_name)
3504        submodules.extend(get_submodules(module, full_name))
3505    return submodules
class GradCAM: 
3507class GradCAM:
3508    def __init__(self, model, target_layers=None, use_cuda=True):
3509        self.model = model
3510        self.model.eval()
3511        self.target_layers = target_layers
3512        self.cuda = use_cuda
3513        if self.cuda:
3514            self.model = model.cuda()
3515
3516    def forward(self, input):
3517        return self.model(input)
3518
3519    def __call__(self, x, index=None):
3520        if self.cuda:
3521            x = x.cuda()
3522
3523        features = []
3524        def hook(module, input, output):
3525            features.append(output)
3526
3527        handles = []
3528        for name, module in self.model.named_modules():
3529            if name in self.target_layers:
3530                handles.append(module.register_forward_hook(hook))
3531
3532        output = self.forward(x)
3533        if index is None:
3534            index = np.argmax(output.data.cpu().numpy())
3535
3536        one_hot = np.zeros((1, output.size()[-1]), dtype=np.float32)
3537        one_hot[0][index] = 1
3538        one_hot = torch.from_numpy(one_hot).requires_grad_(True)
3539        if self.cuda:
3540            one_hot = one_hot.cuda()
3541
3542        one_hot = torch.sum(one_hot * output)
3543        self.model.zero_grad()
3544        one_hot.backward(retain_graph=True)
3545
3546        grads_val = features[0].grad.cpu().data.numpy()
3547        target = features[0].cpu().data.numpy()[0, :]
3548
3549        weights = np.mean(grads_val, axis=(2, 3))[0, :]
3550        cam = np.zeros(target.shape[1:], dtype=np.float32)
3551
3552        for i, w in enumerate(weights):
3553            cam += w * target[i, :, :]
3554
3555        cam = np.maximum(cam, 0)
3556        cam = cv2.resize(cam, (x.size(2), x.size(3)))
3557        cam = cam - np.min(cam)
3558        cam = cam / np.max(cam)
3559
3560        for handle in handles:
3561            handle.remove()
3562            
3563        return cam
GradCAM(model, target_layers=None, use_cuda=True) 
3508    def __init__(self, model, target_layers=None, use_cuda=True):
3509        self.model = model
3510        self.model.eval()
3511        self.target_layers = target_layers
3512        self.cuda = use_cuda
3513        if self.cuda:
3514            self.model = model.cuda()
model
target_layers
cuda
def forward(self, input): 
3516    def forward(self, input):
3517        return self.model(input)
def show_cam_on_image(img, mask): 
3565def show_cam_on_image(img, mask):
3566    heatmap = cv2.applyColorMap(np.uint8(255 * mask), cv2.COLORMAP_JET)
3567    heatmap = np.float32(heatmap) / 255
3568    cam = heatmap + np.float32(img)
3569    cam = cam / np.max(cam)
3570    return np.uint8(255 * cam)
def recommend_target_layers(model): 
3572def recommend_target_layers(model):
3573    target_layers = []
3574    for name, module in model.named_modules():
3575        if isinstance(module, torch.nn.Conv2d):
3576            target_layers.append(name)
3577    # Choose the last conv layer as the recommended target layer
3578    if target_layers:
3579        return [target_layers[-1]], target_layers
3580    else:
3581        raise ValueError("No convolutional layers found in the model.")
class IntegratedGradients: 
3583class IntegratedGradients:
3584    def __init__(self, model):
3585        self.model = model
3586        self.model.eval()
3587
3588    def generate_integrated_gradients(self, input_tensor, target_label_idx, baseline=None, num_steps=50):
3589        if baseline is None:
3590            baseline = torch.zeros_like(input_tensor)
3591        
3592        assert baseline.shape == input_tensor.shape
3593
3594        # Scale input and compute gradients
3595        scaled_inputs = [(baseline + (float(i) / num_steps) * (input_tensor - baseline)).requires_grad_(True) for i in range(0, num_steps + 1)]
3596        grads = []
3597        for scaled_input in scaled_inputs:
3598            out = self.model(scaled_input)
3599            self.model.zero_grad()
3600            out[0, target_label_idx].backward(retain_graph=True)
3601            grads.append(scaled_input.grad.data.cpu().numpy())
3602
3603        avg_grads = np.mean(grads[:-1], axis=0)
3604        integrated_grads = (input_tensor.cpu().data.numpy() - baseline.cpu().data.numpy()) * avg_grads
3605        return integrated_grads
IntegratedGradients(model) 
3584    def __init__(self, model):
3585        self.model = model
3586        self.model.eval()
model
def generate_integrated_gradients(self, input_tensor, target_label_idx, baseline=None, num_steps=50): 
3588    def generate_integrated_gradients(self, input_tensor, target_label_idx, baseline=None, num_steps=50):
3589        if baseline is None:
3590            baseline = torch.zeros_like(input_tensor)
3591        
3592        assert baseline.shape == input_tensor.shape
3593
3594        # Scale input and compute gradients
3595        scaled_inputs = [(baseline + (float(i) / num_steps) * (input_tensor - baseline)).requires_grad_(True) for i in range(0, num_steps + 1)]
3596        grads = []
3597        for scaled_input in scaled_inputs:
3598            out = self.model(scaled_input)
3599            self.model.zero_grad()
3600            out[0, target_label_idx].backward(retain_graph=True)
3601            grads.append(scaled_input.grad.data.cpu().numpy())
3602
3603        avg_grads = np.mean(grads[:-1], axis=0)
3604        integrated_grads = (input_tensor.cpu().data.numpy() - baseline.cpu().data.numpy()) * avg_grads
3605        return integrated_grads
